loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old. She is married to a soldier and they have four children. She owns a bar and has been running this business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers and other types of drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to invest and establish a food business.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para incrementar su inventario comprara ropa y algunos utensilios de cocina, como cacerolas, ollas, lo que le servirá para que en estas fechas próximas de fin de fin de año tanga lo necesario para cumplir con sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento sus ventas mejoro su economía, cancelo sus deudas y le permitió mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to increase her inventory of clothing and some kitchen utensils such as casserole dishes and pots.  These will be helpful over the end of year season so that she will have what she needs to meet her customer demand.

The previous loan helped her increase her sales and improve her financial situation.  She paid off her debt and improved her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing and kitchen items.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram, age 39, is from Kutaisi city, where he is a married father of two children, one of whom is attending university. He also looks after his retired mother. Guram used to work on house renovations, but he had to stop due to health problems. Currently, the only one who earns income in the household is Guram’s wife, who picks vegetables in local farmers’ greenhouses. 

Because he regrets not generating income, Guram is requesting a loan to start his own business. He has experience driving and wishes to buy a secondhand car to use in a taxi business. Guram wants to provide his family members with better living conditions and give them what they need. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Kamotsi Group

texts.en:
Eve used her previous loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials. She says the loan enabled her to employ at least two employees and to sew more skirts, shirts and uniforms. Eve says the loan made a great impact on her business and family. She has also finished building her house and her first-born child has graduated from university, all of which is a result of her improved income.

Eve has requested a loan of $750 to buy more uniform materials since she wants to prepare for the back-to-school season in January. She says she has benefited a lot from MicroKing and its partners. She is a member of Kamotsi Group.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 25 years old and she lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia and Nimba County is the second-most populated county in Liberia. 

Cynthia did not go to school and she grew up in a rural area of Sanniquellie. Traditionally, she and her boyfriend live together, and her boyfriend is a security guard. They both have five children, whose ages are between 2 to 16 years. Her five children are in school and live at home. 

Seven years ago, Cynthia received a small amount of money from her boyfriend to establish her business. Now, she is running a small, local shop where she sells rice and oil. She spends ten hours each day on her business. One problem she faces is that sometimes there is no buying. 

Cynthia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Her plan is to, one day, improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Reina Pricila

texts.es:
Doña Reina de 37 años de edad curso hasta el quinto grado de primaria es casada y madre de 3 hijos varones, el primero tiene 17 años y curso el 1 año de bachillerato, el segundo tiene 15 años y cursa el segundo curso de ciclo común y el ultimo de 6 años está en primer grado. Su negocio es el cultivo de café y maíz en menor escala, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años ya que lo heredo de sus padres vendiendo sus productos en otra comunidad cercana. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 40 minutos al cual se traslada caminando involucrándose todos los miembros de su familia ya que es necesario por el bajo costo del café y si pagan quien les ayude a recolectar les disminuye las ganancias.
Su meta hacer crecer su negocio, esto invirtiendo sus ganancias en la compra de terreno para poder sembrar y ampliar sus activos para dejar una herencia digna a sus tres hijos y la puedan seguir trabajando. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios de manera que ellos puedan ser personas profesionales, con carreras universitarias que les ayuden a formar sus negocios, empresas, etc. enfrentando la vida de manera positiva para el bienestar de sus familias.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café que son 3 manzanas la mayoría es nueva y necesita asistencia para el desarrollo del grano, protección y crecimiento de la planta.
texts.en:
Doña Reina who is 37 years old studied until the 5th grade of elementary school, she is married and a mother of 3 sons. Her oldest son is 17 years old and studied until the 1st year of high school; the middle child is 15 years old and currently in his 2nd year of middle school, and the youngest one is 6 years old and in his 1st year of elementary school. Her business is the cultivation of coffee and corn on a small scale. She has been dedicated to this activity for several years now since she inherited it from her parents by selling their products in a nearby community. Her coffee plantations, to which she goes by foot, are located 40 minutes away from her home. All the members of her family are involved in this activity because the price of coffee is low and hiring someone else to help them would reduce their profits.

Her goal is to make her business grow by investing her profits in the purchase of land to sow, and to increase her assets so she can leave her sons a decent inheritance in which they can keep on working. As a mother, her goal is to support them in their studies so they can become professionals with university careers that will help them to form their own businesses, companies, etc. by confronting life in a positive way for the well-being of their families.  

She has requested a loan to the cooperative COMIXMUL, which will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer for her coffee plantations, which have the size of 3 blocks. The plantations are new and in need of assistance for the development of the grain, protection and growth of the plant.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to use on her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Wendy Karolina

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de 26 años de edad con un grado de estudio de primaria completa en un estado civil de unión libre siendo su pareja comerciante individual y madre de un hijo quien es menor de edad. A muy temprana edad ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus padres quienes han sido apoyo y pilar fundamental en su vida ya que por más de 2 años trabaja en la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas siendo su pareja quien se involucre como apoyo en el trabajo de campo junto a ella. Ella es una productora muy buscada en su localidad gracias a la calidad del producto que ella y su pareja producen limpio e higiénico, con un buen tamaño y un precio muy accesible para revender. La tierra que ella y su compañero de hogar cultivan es propia la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia al cual se trasladan para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.
Wendy ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas que ayudaran al desarrollo, crecimiento y cuidado de sus cultivos de papaya como también la compra de y semilla certificada para cultivar.
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida, la ampliación de sus cultivos de papaya mediante la compra de más tierra para no solo depender de un solo producto si no también ofrecer una diversidad que permita generar mayores ingresos. Como madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios, dar la oportunidad para que se convierta en una persona profesional con muchas opciones en la vida.
texts.en:
Wendy is a 26-year-old woman who completed primary school and is in a common-law marriage.  Her partner is a merchant, and Wendy is the mother of a young son.  At a very early age, she learned to work the land thanks to her parents who were her support and foundation in life.  

For more than two years she has worked in planting and cultivating vegetables.  Her partner helps to work the field next to hers.  Wendy is a highly sought after producer in her town thanks to the quality of product that she and her partner produce.  It is clean and hygienic, a good size, and has an affordable price for reselling.  The land that she and her partner work is theirs; it is located 2 kilometers away.  They travel that distance to provide assistance and maintenance.

Wendy has asked for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, manure, and fungicide to help with the development, growth, and care of her papaya crops, as well as to buy certified seeds for planting.

Her goals are to improve their quality of life, expand her papaya crops by purchasing more land so that she does not only rely on one product, but also offer a variety that would allow her to generate more income.  As a mother, she wants to help her son in school and give him the opportunity to become a professional with many options in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified papaya seeds to grow.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира добродушная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Со своей семьёй Нодира живёт в маленьком посёлке. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание, она с мужем много работают. Сама является портнихой, дома для этого дела она имеет швейную машинку. Принимает заказы на дому и зарабатывает этим на проживание. Муж Нодиры уже боле 15 лет работает сварщиком. Эта работа также приносит ему хороший доход. Сейчас Нодира с мужем хотят отремонтировать свой дом, который пришёл уже в негодное состояние. В доме нужно заменить полы, крышу и окна. Но для этого нужна большая сумма денег. Из за нехватки денежных средств Нодира обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит. На полученный кредит она хочет купить строительные материалы, а также половые доски, окна и двери. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за  своевременную поддержку и в дальнейшем надеется на сотрудничество.
texts.en: Nodira is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married and has children. Nodira lives with her family in a small town. To earn a living, she and her husband work hard. She has a sewing machine at home for her work as a seamstress. She takes orders and completes them to earn her living. Her husband has worked as a welder for over 15 years. This work earns him a good income. Now Nodira and her husband want to make repairs to their home, which has fallen into an unsuitable state. The floors, roof and windows need to be replaced. However, it will take a lot of money. Since they do not have enough money, Nodira came to Arvand and would like to take out a loan. She wants to use the loan to buy building materials as well as floor boards, windows, and doors. She thanks Arvand in advance for the timely support and hopes to work together again in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ann. Barabhuja Shg Group

texts.en:
Chinamayee is a 34-year-old lady living with her husband, parents-in-law and two children, aged nine years and five years in a small village of Odisha, India. 

In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Chinamayee. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman having a leadership trait within her. She stepped out from her house and made a group with other women from her village and gave the name "Ann. Barabhuja SHG" to the group. All the group members are doing some business to support their families. All the group members support and help each other in their business activity.

Chinamayee has been engaged in the spice-making business for the last four years. She purchases raw spices like turmeric, ginger, white pepper, black salt, chilies, etc. and makes mixed spices using a grinder machine. From this activity, she earns 2,000 INR per month. She wants to expand her business, and for this she requires financial support.

So she, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 250,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a new grinder machine and raw spices in bulk for her spice-making business. 

She says, "In the future, I want to be a big manufacturer of spices." She is also saying, "I am very grateful to Kiva for supporting my business".

loans.use: to pay for a new grinder machine and raw spices in bulk for her spice-making business.

loans.name: Rwebicoori Bika Oguze Group

texts.en: The group is from a predominantly farming village that is well-known for maize production from which it derives the name Rwebicoori, literally meaning a maize area. Robert (raising his hand), a member of the group, buys and sells maize. This being a harvest season for the maize, he wants to buy from the farmers in bulk at harvest before the prices hit the ceiling. The challenge right now has been limited capital. He hopes, if given the loan, that his worries will cease. He can then store the maize and sell it to schools after the harvest season when the prices have gone up. He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Mustafe Ahmed

texts.en: Mustafe Ahmed is 20 years old and a secondary school student. He wants to start his education at a local university, after he finishes his work at his current school. To do this, he needs a laptop, and has requested that Kaaba give him a loan so that he can buy it. He will repay the loan in installments. After entering university, Mustafe hopes to learn Information Technology.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His wife, Nyamtsetseg, works at a local public school as a janitor, his older son has just enrolled local primary school and his younger daughter is two years old and stays home with her grandmother during the day.
 
Batbayar started his taxi service business in town in 2008, with his second-hand Korean car. He also works part-time at construction sites during the  summers along with running his taxi service business. He is a hardworking, family-oriented man who has pleased his clients with his safe and reliable service. He is now in need of a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car to ensure his taxi service business runs smoothly with no sudden stops.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 51 years old lives with his wife and 4 children in Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. 

His wife, Ganchimeg, is unemployed and stays at home to take care of their children and family. His older daughter is a university student,  2 of his younger children attend local school and the youngest child stays at home with her mother.
 
Batsaihan is a driver at a local company and works shifts. He has recently started manufacturing traditional boots at home with his wife, to increase their family income. They are hardworking, responsible and positive people. Batsaihan needs 500,000 MNT to purchase material to produce  traditional boots to sell before the Lunar New Year when the demand is high.

loans.use: to purchase material to produce more traditional boots to sell before the Lunar New year, when the demand is high.

loans.name: Bayartsaihan

texts.en: Mr. Bayartsaihan is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger, or traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Chimgee manufactures traditional leather boots at home and his daughters attend local public schools. Bayartsaihan started his transportation business to serve smaller administrative areas within the province with his small truck. He is a careful and reliable driver and popular with his customers. He needs 2,700,000 MNT to replace some parts to ensure that his truck is safe. He will also use a portion of this loan to buy leather for his wife to use in her boot-making business. The Bayartsaihan's are hardworking and enthusiastic people.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy leather for his wife's boot-making business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has a business operating a motorcycle transport as well as a rental business to earn extra income. She needs to find ways to support her children's education. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to finance the cost of motor maintenance for the motorcycle used in the business. In the near future, she plans to acquire additional motorcycles for business expansion.

loans.use: to finance the cost of motor maintenance.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is 47 years old, married and the father of four children. He and his family live in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he has worked as a tailor since 1998. He supplements his income by working as a farmer, but has limited capital for expansion. His income is also affected by seasonal changes on his farm. His goal for the future is to have a better sewing machine that will allow him to serve his customers more easily. He is requesting this loan to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Veronica

texts.es:
Nancy, se decidió por otro crédito para surtir el inventario de la tienda y la venta de pupusas, comprara granos básicos, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, bebidas y golosinas, le servirá para mejorar sus ventas y atraer a nuevos clientes.
El capital anterior le ayudo a adquirir mercadería nueva para ofrecerla a mejor precio, sus ingresos son mayores, tiene nuevos clientes y su aporte a los gastos familiares son mayores.
texts.en:
Nancy decided upon another loan in order to stock her store and for her ‘pupusa’ [stuffed tortillas] sales.  She will buy basic grains, cooking oil, fried pork rinds, soft cheese, soft drinks, and sweets.  This will serve to improve her sales and to attract new customers.

The previous loan helped her to get new merchandise to offer at better prices.  Her sales are greater, she has new customers, and her contribution to the family expenses is greater.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cooking oil, fried pork rinds, soft cheese, soft drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Jane has been selling goats' meat at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Encarnacion De Jesus

texts.es: Don Encarnación es originario de la ciudad de Managua, Soltero y padre de cinco hijos cuatro de ellos ya independientes. De 50 años de edad. Se dedica al negocio de vulcanización. Inicio su negocio como ayudante en un negocio de reparación de llantas donde adquirió experiencia, poco a poco con dinero propio decidió poner su pequeño negocio y  ha ido prosperando notablemente. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Llantas de segunda mano y materiales de vulcanización. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Encarnación hails from the city of Managua. He is single and father to five children, four of whom are already independent. He is 50 years old and makes his living in the vulcanization business. He started out as an assistant in a tire repair business where he got experience. Little by little, he started his own business with his own money, and it has thrived considerably.

His is applying for the loan to buy secondhand tires and materials for vulcanization. He anticipates that the loan will be of great help since he will be able to offer his customers better service. His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to buy secondhand tires and materials for vulcanization.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea is a resident from Moung Russey district of Baatambang province. She is 53 years old and a mother of seven children. Currently, five children still rely on her as four are in school and one is too young for schooling. To strive for a living, Phea and her husband do rice farming and work for others for a fee. This business has returned her about 34,400 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth cycle for Phea and a co-borrower and the third cycle for a remaining borrower in this group of three with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back, has helped Phea to improve her living condition better than before. The total requested amount for her group is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is Phea's loan portion. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for a reaping fee. Phea hopes to harvest rice on time and to earn more income from her cash-crop.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fee

loans.name: Anjaz Group

texts.en: Anjaz Group consists of five women living in Sana'a, Yemen. Aqla, age 51, is a member of the group. She is a housewife and a mother. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her family with a better future. She has applied for a loan to be able to buy a gas cooker for her home. She has been unable to buy this item her family needs because of a lack of money. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker for her home.

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet really appreciates the help he received from his previous loan, which enabled him to purchase machines to make donair kebabs and pizza, as well as a freezer for his small restaurant. It was because of this loan that he was able to improve his business and profit, thereby improving the living conditions of his family. Since he credits the loan and lenders with this improvement and was very satisfied with his experience, Ismet would like to apply for a second loan for his same business. 

This time Ismet would like to renovate the restaurant, painting and replacing the flooring as well as purchasing new tables and chairs. He thinks that this second loan will also have a positive impact on his business and attract more clients. He is very pleased to have this opportunity to again improve his enterprise, and emphasizes that without the previous loan he would never have been able to make the improvements he did. It is so important to Ismet to be able to continue to grow and be successful, as he wants to save money and give his children a better education.

loans.use: To renovate his restaurant, painting and replacing the flooring as well as purchasing new tables and chairs

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is a 35-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband had been driving an auto rickshaw, paying a daily fare to use it. With the help of savings, he bought a used auto rickshaw; its engine’s condition is good, but the body is fully damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Hajira requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. 

Hajira hopes that her husband will now be able to generate more income because he does not need to pay a daily fare to anyone.
 
Hajira is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw used in his business.

loans.name: Bilkizoy

texts.en:
Bilkizoy is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1988. She is married but has no money. She is a seamstress. Bilzikoy’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia. He doesn’t send enough money to her and that’s why she must earn her own living. She sews wonderful dresses. Thanks to her high quality service, she has her regular clients. 

Bilkizoy’s husband came home from Russia some months ago and now he is going back to Russia again, but he has not enough money to buy an air ticket. Bilzikoy is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy an air ticket for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband

loans.name: Bibikhon

texts.en:
Bibikhon is smart and hard-working woman. She is married with 4 children that they love very much. She lives in a  house with her family.

She sells a variety of food items. She sells her goods in a food shop. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city, making periodic buying trips. She began working this way over 6 years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise.  She wants to increase her working capital for New Year season. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy food items for improve her stock. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for her market.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman from CPG, Bohol and the mother of three grown-up children. Sylvia operates a motorcycle transport business with her husband. This is the source of their income. 
Sylvia is asking for a loan to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts. Sylvia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Ninel

texts.en:
This nice and clever lady, whose name is Ninel, lives in Kapan city. She is 37 years old. Ninel is divorced and she lives with her son, who is school-aged. 

Ninel has graduated Yerevan State University and, after her graduation, she has worked at the school for 15 years as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. This year, she has been awarded with the title of Best Teacher and this is because she does her work with a great sense of duty, care, and love towards the children, whom she educates and teaches to always be fair and honest in all human relations. She also has 12 pupils whom she gives private courses of Armenian Language and Literature and prepares them for entrance examinations.

Ninel asks for a loan of AMD 800,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a computer, some professional literature, and she also wants to furnish her living room more comfortably, since that is where she and her pupils have their courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature, and to furnish her living room more comfortably.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob is 29 years old and he lives in Yerevan. Serob is one of the best and most responsible clients of Nor Horizon and Kiva. 

This will be Serob’s second loan from Kiva. The first loan he used to purchase of gold for his business. For several years he had worked as a minibus driver, but then he changed his work to what he is engaged in now. He works at one of the biggest wholesale markets for gold in the city. He rents a small workshop where he works and makes unbelievably nice and precious jewelry. All of the jewelry he makes, his mother sells at the same wholesale market at a rented stall. 

Serob is married and he has a very pretty daughter and very soon his son will be born. Since his family is going to become larger, Serob also works part-time at a gas-station in order to be able to meet all of the needs of his beloved family.

Now Serob needs a loan of 2500 dollars in order to buy gold, precious and semiprecious stones since before the Christmas and New Year’s holidays the price of gold becomes lower and it also means that he may have a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy gold and precious, semiprecious stones

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Foday. He is single and has no children. He has one dependent, his grandmother. He is assisting her because of her old age. 
He is still doing his gara tie-dying. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 
Foday would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Foday requires a loan in order to buy phone accessories, electrical bulbs and CD disks.
Foday's plans to build are still on hold but he has expanded his business by buying a refrigerator to sell cold water and drinks, He also has a commercial motor bike. This loan will help to generate more income. He is a hard-working and honest businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories, electrical bulbs and CD disks.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, surtirá su negocio para las próximas fechas navideñas, por lo que necesita capital para comprar aceite, pan, bebidas, frijoles, cocos, entre otros, le servirán para mejorar su inventario y aprovechar que las ventas aumentan un poco.
Con el crédito anterior pudo aumentar la mercadería de su tienda lo que le permitió aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar su calidad de pago, su familia se encuentra mus saludable y continúan brindándole el apoyo para salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
Maria will stock her business for the next holiday dates for which she needs capital to buy oil, bread, drinks, beans, coconuts, among other items. They will serve to improve her inventory and take advantage of sales increasing a little.

With the previous loan, she was able to expand the merchandise in her store which allowed her to increase her profits and improve her payment quality. Her family is now healthier and continues providing the support to get ahead together.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, drinks, beans and coconuts.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима добродушная и отзывчивая женщина. Она родилась и живёт в кишлаке. Фотима вдова, и имеет на иждивении одного ребёнка. Всё своё время она посвящает  воспитанию своего единственного ребёнка. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, она занимается своим бизнесом. Фотима разводит скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, и тем более ей удобно заниматься этим делом в той местности, где она живёт. У неё сейчас имеется несколько голов скота, которых она выращивает. Но для расширения своего бизнеса она хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота, чтобы в будущем успешно их продать и иметь денежные средства для удовлетворения всех имеющихся нужд своей семьи. Фотима также хочет построить коровник для своих скот. По этой причине Фотима обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Fotima is a kind and sympathetic woman. She was born and still lives in this village. Fotima is a widow, and has one dependent child. She spends all her time caring for her one child. In order to earn a living, she has her own business raising livestock. The business earns a good income, and it is also easy for her to run the business where she lives. She now has a few head of livestock which she is raising. However, she wants expand her business by buying a few more animals which she can then sell at a profit to earn money to meet the needs of her family. Fotima also wants to build a small barn for her animals. For that reason Fotima is asking Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. She hopes for a good result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Linex

texts.en: Linex is 33 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. Linex is a 12th grade graduate. She is single and has four children who are in school and live at home. She established a used clothes business and will use the loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe KELEGNA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec   l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Mme ASSETOU, occupe la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  fait la vente de miel dans ce groupe de femmes KELEGNA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  30 litres de miel. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000fcfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kelegna group are married women who average 40 years of age with five children each. They live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Assetou, who is on the far right of the photo, is the member of the Kelegna group who sells honey. With her loan she is planning to buy 30 liters of honey. She gets her supplies in Sikasso town and resells them for cash at a fixed place in the market and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings.

loans.use: to buy honey.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  LA PAIX sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à   ATTBOUGOU  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  NASSITAN  fait le commerce de tissus  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est en première  position de la  droite vers la    gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  20 pièces de pagnes. Sa vente se fait  sur place à un clientèle composé pour la plus part de femme au contant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the La Paix group are married women who average 37 years of age with four children each. They live in monogamous families in Attbougou, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. 
Within the group, Nassitan, who is on the far right of the photo, buys and sells fabrics. With her loan she is planning to buy 20 pieces of "pagne" (brightly colored fabric). She sells her products locally for cash to a customer base made up principally of women.
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings. 

Her ambition is to increase her turnover so that she can provide more customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes".

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 37 years old and lives with her two children in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt house, in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her older son works at local construction company as an assistant worker and her younger son attends the local high school. 

Batchimeg started her own business in 2007, and started selling office supplies at a rental counter at the local market in 2009. She has a lot of experience in running a small business and is teaching her sons her skills and wisdom. She is now opening a small general store at a rental counter at the local market and needs an additional investment of 5,000,000 MNT, in order to purchase starting inventory to sell household goods in the province center. 

Batchimeg is a hardworking and caring mother of two.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new general store.

loans.name: Oyimbiby

texts.en: Oyimbiby was born in 1983. She is married and has two children. Oyimbiby lives with her family in a rural area. She started in business with animal husbandry but changed her business some years ago. Now she sews national dress for women. She has regular customers. With her profits, she bought a house, but it is in bad condition. Oyimbiby wants to repair her house and, for this purpose, she is applying for a loan of 10,000 TJS (Tajikistan Somoni) to buy building materials, including cement, soil and paint, to use in repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including cement, soil and paint, to repair her house.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more plastic shoes, plastic utensils and fruits for her business. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic shoes, plastic utensils and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is applying for a loan to buy more bags of maize to be ground. She is grateful for the new support she will receive.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to be ground.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: Chork, 56 years old and married, is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He does rice cropping and sesame farming, each on one hectare of land. This business has returned him about 29,600 KHR. This is not the first loan for Chork with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his past loan wisely and it has improved his lifestyle better than before. Now he leads a group of five borrowers to obtain a new loan. The total amount of the loan is 6,200,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is his loan portion. As the leader, he will spend his entire portion of the loan to pay reaping fees and to support his sesame farming business. He hopes that he can collect his yield on time with a good income.

loans.use: to pay reaping fees and to support her sesame farming business.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en: Tengiz is a 27-year-old man from Moliti village in Kharagauli district. He has a wife, a father and three children. Tengiz's father receives monthly assistance from the local government. His wife works at the library and generates 90 GEL (Georgian Lari) per month. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a cow, three other cattle and 18 beehives. Tengiz also cultivates a plot of land and sells the products locally. However, the total family income is so small that they live in poverty and receive social assistance from the government. Tengiz has a great desire to improve his family's living conditions by starting a new activity. The loan he applied for was approved within the Start-up program, which enables rural people to start up or re-start businesses. With the loan proceeds, he will buy a car and transport local people who place private orders. Tengiz will create a new source of income to satisfy his family's growing needs. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a transportation business.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Sim is 46 years old and the mother of seven children. She is a resident of Moung Russey district in Battambang province. Currently, only two of her kids are her dependents, one still in school and one too young for school. To provide for the daily basic needs of her family, she grows rice as her main source of income, and she also works for others for pay to supplement her income. After engaging in her current activities for 26 years, she is able to generate about 28,900 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), who has successfully repaid her past two loans. Now, she forms part of a group of four borrowers applying for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire portion of the group’s loan to cover the harvesting fees for her crop. She hopes to collect a good yield, on time, by selling at good prices, so she can triple her income.

loans.use: to pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en:
Mehriban and her family have benefited from the Kiva program. A previous loan has helped her and her husband to purchase an engine for their woodcutting saw.  They are satisfied with the money that they earn through this business and would like to continue to do this kind of work.  They hope to get a second loan so they can improve their living conditions and have healthy food. 

Meribane requests a second loan because she needs to repair their woodcutting machine which is in need of repair due to the constant wear and tear.  She wants to continue to provide  effective and efficient services, especially in the last few months of the cold season. 

It is through this work that they care for their family and she hopes to be able to provide an opportunity for a better education for her children. Thus far, they have only been able to finish primary school since the lack of money has kept the older children from being able to attend secondary school. 

Mehriban believes that this second loan will improve her husband’s business dramatically as it will help him be more efficient in his work and produce larger quantities in a shorter period of time. 

They really appreciate all Kiva lenders for the loan and their help to achieve the family's goals.

loans.use: to to repair  her woodcutting machine.

loans.name: Chantara

texts.en:
Chantara, aged 25 and single, is a local villager from Kandal Stueng district of Kandal province. He grows rice as the main source of income. He has been in this business for two years and earns 10 USD per day. 

This is the first microloan for VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  He is applying for an education loan to cover his school fee in university and major in economics. He hopes to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover his school fee in university, majoring in economics.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is a 40-year-old married mother blessed with four children. 

She needs to support two dependent children who remain in school. Therefore, she grows rice and sesame on two hectares area each as the main source of income for the sake of her children and entire family. It is the business that she has had for 11 years and she earns about 40,000 KHR.  

This is the fifth loan for Heang and third loan for her co-borrower.  The past loan was repaid completely and it enabled her to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,400,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to	pay the reaping fee and labor costs and buy fertilizer and insecticide. 

She hopes to collect her yield on time and triple last year's yield.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee and labor costs and buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is 52 years old, married and has two children. Today they live in the Baku region, but 21 years ago their home city, Fuzuli,  was occupied by Armenians and they became IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). His wife is a housewife, his older daughter is married and his son is in college. Mehman rents a store where he sells different toys like cars, puzzles, puppets, etc. He loves little children and therefore loves his job. Today he wants to expand his business and has applied to Komak company for a loan for 1,500AZN (Azerbaijam New Manat). With this loan Mehman wants to buy more toys to sell in the new year. Mehman thanks Kiva's organization and lenders for help. In the future he wants to buy a store where he can increase his business.

loans.use: to buy more toys

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a tender su granja de pollos y a cultivar jícamas, no tiene horario para dedicarse a estas actividades, lo fundó por iniciativa propia, es apoyado por su familia. Luis vive junto a su familia, es soltero y  no posee otro ingreso económico.
Con el capital que se le facilite efectuara la compra de concentrado e insumos agrícolas, como fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono e insecticidas para  la preparación del terreno para sembrar, espera fortalecer su negocio, aumentar su producción, mejorar sus ventas, obtener mejores ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares y pagar los costos de sus estudios.
 Sueña con mejorar su economía y poder culminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Luis makes a living by tending to his chicken farm and growing jicama.  He does not have a fixed schedule for doing these activities, he set it up on his own initiative, and it is supported by his family.  Luis lives with his family; he is single and does not have any other financial income.

With the capital being loaned to him, Luis will purchase feed and agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticide, manure, and insecticide in order to prepare the land for planting.  He hopes to strengthen his business, increase production, improve his sales, and get better income in order to help with family expenses and to pay for the cost of his studies.  

He dreams of improving his finances and being able to complete his college education.

loans.use: to buy feed and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Vilma Gloria

texts.es:
Vilma, es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años de edad, no posee ayuda de nadie más, para poder cumplir con los gastos de su familia se dedica a atender su tienda que instalo en su vivienda como iniciativa propia, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.
Con el capital comprara golosinas, bebidas, pan, azúcar, aceite, etc., con lo que podrá tener variedad de productos con los cuales podrá mejorar las opciones de compra para sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener ganancias extras con las cuales podrá ir cancelando puntualmente sus cuotas y dará a su familia una vida mejor.
Su aspiración es ampliar su negocio para poder contar con el capital para mejorar su svivienda.
texts.en:
Vilma is the single mother of a 6-year-old little boy.  She does not have help from anyone else, so to cover her family expenses she makes a living tending to her shop which she set up in her home on her own initiative.  Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

With the loan she will buy sweets, drinks, bread, sugar, oil, etc., so that she can have a variety of products which will improve the purchase options for her customers.  She hopes to increase sales and have extra earnings so that she can make her payments on time and give her family a better life.

Her aspiration is to expand her business in order to have the money to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks, bread, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Vilma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Vilma, es jefa de hogar tiene dos hijos de 18 y 22 años respectivamente, bien como una familia muy unida, se dedica al cultivo de frijol y maíz, es una actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo apoyada por sus hijos.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, semilla y mano de obra, con lo que podrá mejorar las condiciones del terreno donde siembra, espera tener una cosecha abundante, granos de calidad, y sobre todo tener más ingresos para cumplir con sus múltiples compromisos familiares.
Aspira a seguir creciendo en su negocio y dar a su familia una vida mucho más digna.
texts.en:
Vilma is the head of her household and has two children, ages 18 and 22.  Her family is very close and she raises beans and corn, and has done this for a long time to support her children.

She will use the money to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and pay for labor so she can improve her crops.  She hopes to have a good harvest, quality grains, and above all greater income so she can meet her multiple family obligations.

She aspires to continue growing her business and provide a more dignified life for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nelson Hilario

texts.es:
Nelson, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, no posee ayuda del extranjero, de sus padres aprendió el cultivo de maíz, yuca y ajonjolí, cuando formo su propia familia empezó a realizar esta actividad de manera independiente, además trabaja como jornalero. Tiene 8 años de experiencia por lo que no se le dificulta cumplir con sus actividades.
Comprará abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y pagara mano de obra, para que le ayuden a terminar las labores de siembra en menor tiempo, espera mejorar su producción, tener más clientes satisfechos y tener más ganancias.
Aspira ofrecer a su familia un estilo de vida mejor y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nelson lives with his life companion and his son, and receives no assistance from abroad. He learned from his parents to cultivate corn, cassava, and sesame. When Nelson started his own family, he began to carry out these activities independently while also working as a day laborer. Nelson has 8 years of experience  and, as a result, he doesn't find farming difficult.

Nelson will purchase manure, insecticides and plaguicides, and pay laborers to help finish the planting tasks in less time. He hopes to improve production, gain additional satisfied customers, and earn more income.

Nelson aspires to offer his family a better style of life and to be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, and plaguicides, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Edis Marleni

texts.es:
Edis, comparte día con día con sus tres hijos, es casada, ella en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para su familia hace 12 años trabaja de forma independiente en su salón de belleza, en un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m., por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad en el negocio.
Con el capital podrá comprar tintes, esmaltes, maquillaje, cremas entre otros productos que utiliza para atender bien a sus clientes, el resto lo utilizara para remodelar su local y dar una mejor imagen. Espero seguir atendiendo de una forma especial a sus  clientes, atraer a clientes nuevos y obtener más ganancias con las cuales podrá cancelar sus deudas, así como también mejorar las condiciones familiares.
Sueña con terminar de cancelar su casa y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Edis is married and shares her daily life with her three children. She is looking for better quality of life for her family and has been working in her beauty salon for 12 years, working from 9am till 7pm. Her business currently doesn't face any challenges.

With this loan she can buy dyes, enamels, makeup, creams and other products she uses to serve her customers well. With the remaining amount she will remodel her salon and improve the way it looks. 

Edis hopes to continue serving her customers in a special way, attract new clients and make more profit, with which she will be able to pay back her debt and improve her family's conditions.

Edis dreams about completing the payments for her house and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy dyes, enamels, makeup and creams

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, los cueles ya son independientes, su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina elote, lo hace todos los días, sale a vender por la cuidad donde vive.
Con el capital comprara maíz, elotes, aceite, pollo, leña, ya que son la materia prima para su venta, le servirá para a aumentar su producción, mejorara atención a sus clientes, incrementara sus ventas, mejorara su economía y cancelara sus cuotas.
Aspira tener una mejor calidad de vida y fortalecer su negocio
texts.en:
Gabriela is married and has four children, who are now independent.  Her business is making and selling chicken and corn tamales.  She does this every day.  She goes out to sell in the city where she lives.

She will use the loan to buy corn, corn on the cob, cooking oil, and firewood.  These are the raw materials for her sales, which will serve to increase her production, provide better service to her customers, increase her sales, improve her finances, and to make her payments.

She wishes to have a better quality of life and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn on the cob, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Эту жительницу города Душанбе зовут Латофат. Ей 54 года. Она начинает новую деятельность. Латофат умеет шить и кроить, и теперь хочет использовать свое умение, чтобы зарабатывать. Латофат планирует открыть швейное дело у себя дома. Она уже отвела отдельную комнату для работы. Поскольку ее собственного сбережения не хватает она запрашивает кредит. Латофат на сумму кредита и сбережения хочет купить три швейных машинок. Ей в новом деле будет помогать ее единственная дочь, которой 21 год. Она тоже умеет шить и научилась у матери. Они вместе будут работать над заказами. Латофат очень надеется на поддержку кредиторов KIVA. Начав прибыльный швейный бизнес, она сможет улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en:
Latofat is a resident of Dushanbe and is 54 years old. She is starting a new business. Latofat knows how to sew and tailor, and wants to use her skills to earn an income. Latofat plans to open a sewing business in her home. She has already set aside a room for the work. 

Latofat is requesting a loan because her personal savings are not enough. She plans to use the money to buy three sewing machines. Latofat's 21-year-old daughter will help Latofat in this endeavor; she also knows how to sew and is learning from her mother. Together, they will work to complete their orders. Latofat is thankful for the support of Kiva lenders. By starting a profitable business, she will be able to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy three sewing machines and start a business

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine and her family live in Vanadzor in Lori region. She is 43 years old. Marine works at the preschool educational institution and she is greatly pleased with her work. Marine has a daughter and a son. Her daughter has graduated from Pedagogical University and now works as a computer operator. Her son is studying at the economics college. Marine’s husband now works in the Russian Federation abroad to support his family financially.
Marine asks for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer for her daughter's work (to be informed about computer programs’ innovations).

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter's work (to be informed about computer programs’ innovations)

loans.name: Yryskul

texts.ru: Ырыскул 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Ырыскул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ырыскул занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ырыскул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ырыскул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ырыскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Yryskul i 55 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising six children. Yryskul has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Yryskul raises livestock, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 6,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Yryskul currently has on her farm: three dairy cows, three horses, and 15 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 6,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Yryskul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy steers for expanding her livestock count.

Yryskul plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 27 years old. She lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Here, living conditions are much better than in the capital city. Nimba County is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Ruth completed college, and she has a 9-year-old child. She is unmarried. Her child is in school. With the little money she saved, she managed to establish her business. She has been running this business selling oil, vita, pepper, etc. for the past four years. She spends nine hours per day on her business. She faces no problems, other than too few goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, vita, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to one day move from a table business to a shop business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita, and pepper

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is 32 years old and lives in the Akhalkalaki district. He is married with an infant daughter. Samvel’s mother lives with his family as well and works as the local school cleaner. His wife used to work as a stylist at a beautiful salon but after childbirth she serves her loyal clients from her house. Samvel works on house renovations and repairs.  In order to generate more income, he plans to start a seasonal business for New Year's that involves buying fireworks and fir-tree toys in bulk and selling them to his customers. After the holidays are over his wife will start tailoring activities. The family owns a sewing machine and with the loan, she will buy material to sew bed sheets and pillow cases. Samvel’s wife is skilled at sewing and hopes she will sell her produce easily. Samvel and his family are grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to sell seasonal items and allows his wife to buy supplies for a sewing business.

loans.name: Goshi

texts.en: Goshi is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling children's clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Goshi requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, age 36, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

Kalsoom needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. 

She is in her third loan cycle, with good credit history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet their household expenses.

Currently, Akbari requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and biscuits to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and biscuits

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

Previously she took a loan to purchase a buffalo. Now she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. It will help her to increase her sales which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.  She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe   SERIEUX  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à   ATTBOUGOU  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme    KADIATOU fait de la restauration  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en première  position de la    droite vers la    gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  5 sacs de riz plus divers condiments. Sa vente de plats alimentaires se fait au comptant sur le marché à une clientèle composée  de femmes  et hommes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Serieux group are married women who average 33 years of age with four children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Attbougou, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. 

Within the group Kadiatou, who is on the far right of the photo, has a restauration activity. With her loan she is planning to buy five sacks of rice and a variety of condiments. She sells her dishes for cash in the market to a customer base made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration business.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   SINIGNESSIGUI  sont  essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne  6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à   ATTBOUGOU  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   DIALIA fait le commerce de condiments  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en deuxième position de la   gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 cartons de cube maggi  1 carton de 10 boite de concentrée de tomate et 1 panier de 30 kg d’oignon séché. Sa vente se fait  sur place à une clientèle composée pour la plus part de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The majority of the four members of the Sinignessigui group are married women who average 43 years of age with six children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Attbougou, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. 

Within the group Dialia, who is second from the left in the photo, buys and sells condiments. With her loan she is planning to buy two cartons of Maggi stock cubes, one carton of ten cans of tomato concentrate and a basket of 30kg of dried onions. She sells her products locally and for cash to a customer base made up essentially of women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Bat-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Ochir is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Dolgor, is retired and stays home taking care of the family. His three children all attend universities. 

Bat-Ochir has been manufacturing traditional leather boots at home by order since 2010. He learned to produce handmade leather boots from his parents when he was little. He used to produce their own boots until he made it a business. 

He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and thoughtful person who is concerned about his children's education. He is now requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to purchase leather and other inventory to meet his clients' orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other inventory to meet his clients' orders on time.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam was born in 1951 and is a widow with one child. They live in a rural area. 

Muharam has raised cattle for more than 7 years. She developed her business step by step. She has a good opportunity to develop her business and is the main provider for her family. She asks for a loan of 7000 TJS to buy cattle to increase her working capital. 

This loan will help Muharam to develop the business and maximize profit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mary Melanie

texts.en:
Mary Melanie is a hard working mother who runs a small variety store to help her husband generate income. She is 40 years old and has only one child. 

She and her husband aim to become financially stable in order to give their child a better future. She plans to improve  her store and increase her income to satisfy their basic necessities. In this regard, she asks for 30,000.00 PHP to buy canned goods, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, noodles, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

She is hoping that someday, she will improve her business and make it more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, noodles, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Batbaatar, helps his wife to run their family grocery store in a rental stall of a local market. Her 2 children attend local school and kindergarten.
 
Bayarmaa started her own business 10 years ago. She has a lot of experience running a micro business in the province. She is well-known for her welcoming and friendly service. Her husband helps with heavy lifting and purchasing inventory. She requests a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase food before the holiday season (Lunar New year) to sell at her stall. 

She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of food before the holiday season (Lunar New year) to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a retail business where he sells wallets, watches and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local customers. His biggest business challenge is that he has inadequate funds to buy more inventory. He will use this  40,000 KES loan to add to his stock of wallets, watches and other items he sells. His business goal is to have a wholesale emporium within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will create more jobs. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to add to his stock of wallets, watches and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es:
Rosa, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, arroz, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, aderezos, leña y bolsas para seguir trabajando en su negocio de pupusas y tortillas y dar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
El préstamo anterior le facilito la compra de la materia prima para fortalecer el negocio, le dio como resultado mejores ventas, sus ganancias aumentaron y continua ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa has chosen to ask for a new loan to buy corn, rice, oil, cheese, pork rinds, dressings, firewood, and bags. This is to keep working in her pupusa and tortilla business, and to give her clientele better service.

Her previous loan helped her to buy supplies to strengthen her business.  As a result, she had better sales, her earnings increased, and she has continued to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, oil, cheese, pork rinds, dressings, firewood, and bags.

loans.name: Juan Alcides

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado;  por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no pudo seguir estudiando, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos ellos tienen 3 hijos de 18 años, 14 años y el ultimo de 12 años y que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y cuando sus hijos tienen tiempo libre le apoyan en los trabajos de la agricultura, en su vivienda solo viven su esposa y sus 3 hijos.

Juan se dedica a la venta de ataúdes funerarios, él tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este oficio, comenta que es una fuente de ingreso que le genera a su familia desde hace varios años; él aprendió este oficio cuando un amigo lo recomendó para que pudiera trabajar y desde entonces se ha dedicado a este oficio que hoy en día lo maneja a la perfección, su zona de cobertura es todo el departamento de Morazán, comenta que tiene muchos clientes, aparte de dedicarse a este oficio también se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos y que es otra fuente de ingresos para él y su familia.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la remodelación de su vivienda, específicamente lo que arreglara con el préstamo es la pila y el baño de su vivienda, ya que en el invierno se moja el área del baño y la pila y no deja desarrollar sus actividades diarias. Era un sueño que tenía Juan de mejorar su vivienda, en la construcción de una nueva pila y baño.

Juan desea en el futuro tener mucho bienestar para él y su familia, tener su propio negocio de venta de ataúdes, vender mucho más para tener más ingresos para su familia y para sus hijos que sean personas de bien en la sociedad que sigan estudiando y logren sacar una carrera universitaria, todo esto dice que lo lograra con los ingresos extra de los productos para ampliar más su producción.
texts.en:
Juan, age 39, studied through the fifth grade.  Due to his family’s financial situation, he didn’t manage to keep studying.  His wife works in the home; they have three children, ages 18, 14, and 12.  Only his wife and three children live in his home.  His children are currently students, and when they have free time they help him in his farm work.  

Juan works selling caskets.  He has been doing this work for ten years.  He says that it has been a source of income for his family for a number of years.  He learned this work when a friend recommended it to him so he could work.  Since then he has been doing this job, and today he has perfected it.  His sales market includes the entire Morazón region.  He says that he has a lot of customers.  Besides doing this work, he also farms, growing grains.  This is another source of income for his family.

He is asking for a loan to remodel his home.  Specifically, with the loan he will fix his pila [a large outdoor sink] and bathroom, because in the winter the bathroom and pila area gets wet.  This doesn’t let them do their daily chores.  Improving his home was a dream that Juan had: the construction of a new pila and bathroom.

In the future, Juan wants to ensure the well-being of his family and himself.  He hopes to have his own business selling caskets, selling a lot more in order to have a larger income for his family and for his children.  He wants his children to be people of standing in this community who keep studying and complete a university degree.  He says he will do all this with the extra income from his merchandise, to increase his production.

loans.use: to fix his home's sink and bathroom.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, 32, is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province.   His  two-hectare  rice and sesame plantation is the main source of income. He has had the business for 10 years and he earns about 40,000 KHR per day.  

This is not the original loan for Sambath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He successfully repaid his previous loan and it enabled him to improve his lifestyle. Now, he teams up with a group of four to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total requested loan amount for the group is 5,000,000 KHR. His loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR. 

As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee and buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop. He believes that he can collect his yield on time and have a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee and buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 38 years old, married and has two sons.  He lives with his wife, children, and mother.  Azer’s wife does not work, but she takes care of their children.  His mother works as a baker. 

Azer has had his own business for 6 years. He is a merchant and sells food products. The profit from this business is 700 AZN.  Now, Azer is asking for a loan of 700 AZN to purchase food products for his store.  He hopes that Kiva will help him.  This is his first loan.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food products for his store

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a 27-year-old, single client, and lives with his parents. Farid grows fruits and vegetables in his garden, and has been doing this for the last four years. He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of the land and how to work it. 

Farid usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables, and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN. This is the only source of income for his family.

Now, he would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 600 AZN. He hopes this loan will improve life for his family. This is going to be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilian Francisca

texts.es:
Lilian, tiene 31 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos, por iniciativa propia hace dos años inicio a vender ropa de forma ambulante, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Con el crédito comprara camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, para salir a vender con más variedad y poder contar con la satisfacción de los clientes, le ayudara a aumentar sus ventas en esta época navideña, mejoran sus ingresos con los cuales podrá seguir aportando en los gastos familiares y cancelara las cuotas de la deuda.
Sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos en un ambiente sano, seguro y también darles la oportunidad de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Lilian is 31 years old and has a partner and two children. She has been selling clothes as a street vendor on her own initiative for the past two years. She hasn't had any problems with her business so far.

With this loan Lilian will buy shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and trousers, so she can go out and sell a wider variety of items and keep her customers satisfied. This will help her increase her sales in the Christmas period and improve her income, which will allow her to contribute towards family expenses and pay back her debt. 

Lilian dreams about seeing her children grow in a safe, healthy environment and about giving them the opportunity for a university career.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and trousers

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis, necesita capital para cumplir con la entrega de trabajos pendientes de entregar por lo q necesita comprar hierro, tubos y laminas, para poder continuar trabajando.
Con el préstamo anterior compro los materiales necesarios para cubrir la demanda en ese momento, mejoro sus ingresos, tiene más clientes y a cancelado sus deudas.
texts.en: Luis needs capital to complete the delivery of outstanding orders. He needs to buy iron, tubes and sheeting in order to continue working. With his last loan he bought the materials necessary to cover the demands of that time, increased his income, has more clients and paid off his debt.

loans.use: to buy iron, tubes and sheeting.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
