Riza is a married mother of four young children, from Bohol, Philippines. She earns an income through her hog-raising business. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Riza is asking for a loan to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and her savings. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Revendeuse au marché, Enyonam sollicite un  premier crédit pour acheter des céréales qu'elle revend au marché. Elle espère avoir un magasin pour stocker ses marchandises et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille(Mariée, elle a 03 enfants scolarisés). Elle a une ancienneté de 20ans dans l'activité et âgée de 42ans.
texts.en: A retailer at the market, Enyonam is requesting an initial loan to purchase some grain, which she resells at the market. She hopes to have a store to stock her goods and to ensure her family's needs are met as much as possible. (She is married and has three children in school.) She has twenty years of seniority in this business and is 42 years old.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kyabwito est une brave commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Imara » âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 7 qui étudient et 2 sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires depuis 8 ans. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire dans l’Administration publique. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 4 sacs de maïs et 100 poissons salés. Au début, elle démarra de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, adhérer à une mutuelle d’assurance maladie, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de microcrédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont aussi exclues du systeme bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Kyabwito, is a good and honest merchant and a member of the business group "Imara". She is 44 years old and a married mother of nine children, of whom seven are students, and two are already married. She has been selling grocery items for eight years. Her husband is a public servant. 

Kyabwito is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her enterprise. She is going to purchase 4 sacks of corn and 100 salted fish. She would like to increase her capital, acquire group health insurance, and provide education, clothing, and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support for women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system by according them no-collateral microloans.

loans.use: to purchase corn and salted fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
María, opta por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz, harina, verduras, aceite, bebidas y gas propano, con lo que continuara trabajando en su tienda y la pupuseria, y continuar atendiendo bien a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció su negocio lo que le da mejor solvencia económica para cancelar las cuotas del préstamo y mejorar su vida familiar.
texts.en:
María has decided on another loan to invest in the purchase of corn, flour, vegetables, oil, beverages and propane gas, with which she will continue working in her store and pupusa shop and she will continue serving her clients well. 

With the previous loan she strengthened her business which gave her greater financial solvency to pay the loan installments and improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, vegetables, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Sayfullo

texts.ru: Сайфулло добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат  и имеет четверых детей. Сайфулло живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Он очень трудолюбивый, и полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Сайфулло сотрудничает с Арванд уже с 2008 года.  Он занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  небольшая площадь земли, где он выращивает сельхоз культуру, а также пасёт своих скот. Его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Животноводство приносит Сайфулло хороший доход, и этим самым он может удовлетворять все нужды своей семьи, а также обучение своих детей в достойных учебных заведениях. Поэтому сейчас Сайфулло хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Сайфулло заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Sayfullo is a kindhearted man of 43. He is married and has four children. He lives with this family in a modest house in a small town in the country. He is very hardworking and full of the strength and willingness to work for the good of his family. Sayfullo has been working with Arvand since 2008. He works in farming and in animal husbandry. He has a small plot of land where he grows crops and lets his cattle graze. His wife helps him look after and raise the cattle. Animal husbandry brings Sayfullo a good income with which he can fulfill all his family's needs as well as educate his children in good schools. Therefore Sayfullo now wants to expand his business by increasing his head count of cattle. For this he has turned to Arvand in order to receive a loan to purchase cattle. Sayfullo thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. hace 5 años decidió por vender mercadería, vende camisas, telas por yardas, ropa interior como bóxer, calcetas etc. pantalones y otros que le pidan. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Doña Guadalupe ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener surtido el negocio, actualmente ha solicitado otro por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas producto como ropa, zapatos y cosméticos para vender. Tiene como plan establecer el negocio en un local fijo para que sus hijos tengan una fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 52, is a single mother. She has two children and resides in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. She has always made her living in sales. 5 years ago, she decided to sell merchandise; she sells shirts, cloth by the yard, underwear like boxers, socks, etc., pants, and other things that people order from her. She carries out the sales in the street.

Guadalupe has applied for various loans in order to maintain stock in the business. Currently she has applied for 15,000 lempiras to buy more products like clothing, shoes and cosmetics to sell. She has a plan to establish a fixed business location so that her children have a source of work.

loans.use: to buy more products like clothing, shoes and cosmetics to stock and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, bags, manure, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia and Nimba County is the second-most populated county in Liberia. 

Mary is 40 years old. She stopped her education at ninth grade and she is married to a teacher. She has three children between 16 and 21 years old, all three of her children are in school. 

With the little sales she makes from her garden, Mary managed to establish her business and she learned this way of selling from friends. She spends 12 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is low income. 

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes (plates, bowls, pans, spoons, etc.) for her business. Her plan is to build a shop. She is grateful to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes (plates, bowls, pans, spoons, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Raima

texts.ru: Райме 57 лет, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. После смерти супруга, Райма очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Райма решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Разведением скота занимается с 2008 года, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве у Раймы имеется: 4 дойные коровы, также у Раймы имеется небольшой яблоневый сад, который дает неплохую прибыль. Осенью Райма вместе с детьми собирает урожай яблок и реализовывает его на местном рынке оптовым торговцам за наличный расчет. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Райма обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку овец для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Райма планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Raima is a 57-year-old widow with three children.  After her husband died, Raima struggled for a long time with the death of someone so close to her.  She needed to raise and care for her children, so she decided to take the household and the material responsibilities of her family into her own hands.  She has been involved in raising livestock since 2008, a business she started with 20,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her tireless work and support, Raima now earns a monthly income of 12,000 KGS.  Her farm now has four dairy cows and a small apple orchard, which brings a decent income.  In the fall, Raima and her children gather the apple harvest and sell the fruit at the local market for extra money.  With the goal of increasing her livestock, Raima has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy sheep for resale.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock and to improve the material conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Рыскул - среднее образование, трудовую деятельность Рыскул начала в 1981 году -поваром, в 1984 году перевелась в мед.пункт-поваром и работает там по сей день. Также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Рыскул занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 3 лошади, 8 коз, 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рыскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства в помощь сыну при покупке квартиры.
texts.en: Ryskul is 51 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education and she began her working life in 1981 as a cook, becoming a cook in a medical center in 1984, where she works to this day.  As an extra source of income for her family, Ryskul raises animals.  She started doing this 29 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has seven dairy cows, three horses, eight goats and eleven sheep.  Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Ryskul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy bulls to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock, and she also plans to save up money to help her son buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Chairul

texts.en:
Chairul lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Chairul is married.

Chairul began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has had around $79 - $80 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sumarti

texts.en:
Sumarti runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Sumarti lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1,5 hours from Jakarta.  Sumarti is married and lives with five persons in their family house. 

Sumarti began working with Ruma one year ago because she interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months she has had around $123 – $124 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Romli

texts.en:
Romli runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Romli lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1,5 hours from Jakarta. Romli is married and lives with six persons in their family house. 

Romli began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months he has had around $83 – 84 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en:
Muniran is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them close to the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries).

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves

loans.name: Glevis Grisel

texts.es: Glevis es una joven emprendedora la cual en su primer financiamiento llevo a cabo la idea de negocio sobre una repostería misma que por varios meses fue muy rentable y hasta la fecha lo sigue siendo. Ella gracias a este negocio logro crear credibilidad en las personas que la rodearon y apoyaron para que su meta fuese posible de cumplir que por cosas de la vida en su familia surgió un problema de salud con su hija misma que tuvo que atender con tiempo y dinero para que se recuperara y que hoy en día está mucho mejor. Este problema dio cabida a que ella vendiera su negocio ya que no tenía los recursos económicos para atender la necesidad presentada. Desde hace muchos años su familia practica el negocio de la cría y venta de aves misma que ella aprendió pero no hasta hoy en día volvió a ejercer para poder superarse nuevamente y salir adelante. En la actualidad solicita su segundo financiamiento con el que llevara a cabo su nuevo proyecto mismo que invertirá para compra de concentrado ya que necesita asistencia de 600 aves. Esta idea de negocio está empezando a tener resultados positivos pero necesita inyectar un poco más de capital para mejorar y así darle el adecuado mantenimiento ya que cuenta con una buena experiencia y es asesorada y apoyada en la parte técnica por sus padres.
texts.en:
Glevis is an enterprising young woman, who in her first loan implemented the idea of a bakery business. For many months, it was very profitable and today she continues doing it. Thanks to this business, she achieved creating credibility in the people that surrounded and supported her so that her goal was possible to achieve. 

Because of life, a health problem emerged in her family with her own daughter, who she had to take care of with time and money so that she would recuperate. Today, she is much better. This problem caused her to sell her business given that she did not have the economic resources to attend to the presented need.

Her family has been in the business of raising and selling poultry for many years. She learned it but not until today has she gone back to do it in order to overcome and get ahead. Currently, she is applying for a second loan with which she will carry out her new project. She will invest in the purchase of chicken feed since she needs assistance for 600 birds. This business idea is beginning to have positive results but she needs to inject a little more capital in order to improve and therefore give it adequate maintenance. She has had a good experience and is advised and supported in the technical part by her parents.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. For about 5 years she has been in work doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 40-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a hand embroidery business for many years. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone, while Rani’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is the mother of three children.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Boldbayar

texts.en:
Boldbayar is 47 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Munhtuya, works at the local public school as a teacher, and his 2 daughters attend university and secondary school. 
Boldbayar started his wooden furniture manufacturing business at home in 2000. He is already a well-known craftsman in the province and receives orders all the time. He is now increasing his production and hiring an extra worker, who he is teaching and grooming for his further business. He is now requesting a loan of 2,800,000MNT to purchase wood inventory to increase his productivity and meet orders on time. He is a hardworking, talented and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase wood inventory to increase his productivity and meet orders on time

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway runs a livestock business. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. 

Liwayway has been running her livestock business for ten years. Meanwhile, she has 16 hogs to raise. With the number of hogs she raises, she is in need of additional capital to keep them healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. 

Liwayway is asking a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase three sacks of feed and vaccine. She believes that through her loan, she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children.
 
Hamzeh owns a garage where he specializes in repairing tires from different types of cars, as well as changing engine oils. He has a lot of experience in this field and has been practicing this business since 2000. He has three hired employees and is well-known and respected in the neighborhood.

Hamzeh is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his garage. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may continue providing for his family's needs but with better standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his garage

loans.name: Yokasi

texts.en: Yokasi is a hard working married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the farming business since 1998. He also sells milk for additional income. He started his business so as to save some money at the end of the month for his family's and his personal use. He is affected by price fluctuations and the increasing banana bacterial wilt. He hopes to have a healthy family and a stable income. Yokasi intends to use the loan to weed and to improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to weed and to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Fikiri Group

texts.fr: Munyerenkana, femme ambitieuse est membre du groupe de credit  Fikiri. Veuve à l’âge de 60 ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour s’approvisionner en 600 sacs vides  qui constitue son activité principale. Elle souhaite avoir son propre dépôt de commerce et acheter une parcelle pour la stabilité de sa famille.  Elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Munyerenkana is an ambitious lady and a member of the Fikiri loan group. She is a 60-year old widow and has five children, all of whom have been educated. She is requesting this new loan to buy 600 empty bags; this is her main activity. She would like to have her own warehouse and buy a plot of land to give her family some stability. She thanks Hekima for its support of poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to buy 600 empty bags.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 37, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is single. The family’s main source of income is from farming rice. Having been in this business for 17 years, she can earn about 77,000KHR per day and she can save about 40,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Morn is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is now applying for a loan to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Kirabo Women's Group

texts.en:
This women's group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the tremendous work they are doing. Thanks to the low interest rate by UGAFODE, the clients have been able to keep their businesses progressing and repay their loans fully and on time, courtesy of the Kiva lenders.

Faith is a widow, aged 40 years, with four children, three of whom go to school. She is a resident of Nabulagala in the city outskirts and a member Kirabo Women’s Group. Her business is selling goats and selling animal skins and hides. However, she also has another side income from rent, where she gets money to pay school fees and also look after her family at large. 

She has borrowed a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to boost her business. The purpose of the loan is to buy more hides and skins. She is thankful for the institution for enabling them to get money, despite their low status in society. 

The eleventh person seated on a chair (middle right) is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy more hides and skins to sell.

loans.name: Al-Arham Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Arham and is made up of four women living in Sana`a, Yemen. Together, they request a loan of 200,000 YER. They will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

Fatima, age 31, is the leader of the group. She is a resourceful and honest woman. She and her husband have three children and live in Sana`a. However, she is unable to buy home appliances because her husband`s income is hardly enough to buy food and pay rent. So she requests a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine for her house. 

Her goal is to offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is 50 years old and has five children. She is living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where she grows rice and beans each on three hectares. She has been in this business for 11 years. This is the fourth microloan for Pov’s group, which consists of four borrowers. Pov has completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her to improve her lifestyle so that it is better than before. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a reaping fee, to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labor expenses for her agribusiness. She hopes to gain a good income from her crop.

loans.use: To pay a reaping fee, to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos: una mujercita y un hombre; actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en  la aldea Monte Mercedes, Sololá
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa y específicamente de trajes típicos que la gente de su comunidad usa. La elaboración de la ropa lo realiza en la casa donde vive. La venta de este producto la lleva a cabo con sus vecinos y también lo vende en el mercado de Sololá. Esta actividad la realiza porque es algo que tiene mucha demanda y le genera los ingresos necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. 
Tiene más de 10 años realizando esta labor; además de esta actividad ella también se dedica a realizar oficios domésticos (lavado de ropa) en casa de sus vecinos, con lo cual complementa su presupuesto familiar
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para compra de hilo para la elaboración de más trajes típicos y compra de trajes ya elaborados.
Isabel tiene dos sueños importantes: darle la preparación académica necesaria a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 33-year-old woman.  She is single and has two children: a young lady and man.  She currently lives together with her children in the village of Monte Mercedes, Sololá.  She works making and selling clothing, specifically the traditional outfits that the people in her community wear.  She sews the clothes in the house where she lives.  She sells her wares to her neighbors and also sells them in the Sololá market.  She does this work because there is a high demand for it, and it generates the necessary income to support her family.

She has been doing this work for more than ten years.  Besides this, she also does domestic work (washing clothes) in her neighbors’ house.  This supplements her family’s budget.

She is asking for a loan of 4,000 quetzales to buy thread to embroider more traditional outfits, and to buy outfits that have already been decorated.

Isabel has two important dreams: to give her children a good academic preparation, and to improve the quality of her home.

loans.use: to buy thread to embroider traditional outfits, and to buy outfits that are already decorated.

loans.name: Celeste * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CELESTE * 26, Está  compuesto por Diez integrantes nueve mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del banco es la señora Cinthya Sra. Teresa tiene 30 años y dos hijos,  su actividad es la venta de ropa ella vende calzas,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Tembladerani,  la señora Cinthya se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para salir a vender, con el dinero del crédito la señora Cinthya comprara mercadería por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta , la señora Cinthya es una persona responsable y trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: The entrepreneurship group Celeste*26 is made up of 10 members: 9 women and one man. The president of the group is Cinthya. She is 30 and has two children. Her job is selling clothing. She sells hosiery. Her stall can be found in the area of Tembladerani. Cinthya wakes up at early hours of the morning to sell her wares. With the money from the loan, Cinthya will buy merchandise at wholesale to stock her stall. Cinthya is a responsible and hard working person who is thankful to the institution for the economic support provided so she can have a better quality of life and keep moving forward for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy hosiery at wholesale.

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru: Хурмат в ИМОНе кредитуется первый раз. Она имеет грандиозную идею организовать новый бизнес. Хурмат раньше занималась скотоводством. Теперь она хочет организовать новый бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов, так как она получала недостаточный доход от скотоводства. Хурмат участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Хурмат считает, что ее бизнес будет развеваться, так как спрос на сухофрукты на местном рынке большой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hurmat is taking a loan for the first time from IMON. She has a grand idea to establish a new business. Hurmat was previously involved in raising livestock. Now, she wants to organize a new business buying and selling dried fruits, since she received insufficient income from livestock. Hurmat took part in the course "Bring On Success!" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She will trade at the local market. Hurmat considers that the business will develop since demand for dried fruits at the local market is large. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 somoni to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Ganjinai

texts.ru: Ганчинаи молодая девушка в возрасте 21 года. Она замужем и живет с мужем в городе Вахдат. Ее муж работает экспедитором в одной фирме. Сама Ганчинаи домохозяйка и нигде не работает. Еще в юности Ганчинаи интересовалась шитьем и хорошо знает эту профессию. Она хочет использовать свой талант шитья и зарабатывать этим путем. Ганчинаи хочет быть независимой и решила открыть собственное швейное дело. Она уже знает кто будет ее первыми клиентками - это близкие, друзья, родственники, соседи. Ганчинаи имеет немного сбережения, но его недостаточно. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Ганчинаи собирается купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку и различные ткани для шитья. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Ganjinai is a young woman of 21. She is married and lives with her husband in the town of Vahdat. Her husband works as a forwarding agent in a private firm. Ganjinai herself is a homemaker and does not work anywhere. Still in her youth, Ganjinai was interested in sewing and knows well this profession. She wants to use her sewing talent and to earn a living in this way. Ganjinai wants to be independent and decided to open her own sewing business. She already knows who will be her first customers: close friends, acquaintances, relatives, and neighbors. Ganjinai has a little savings but is is not enough. Therefore, she requested a loan. Ganjinai intends to buy a modern computerized sewing machine and various fabrics for sewing. She very much hopes for support.

loans.use: to acquire a computerized sewing machine and fabrics for sewing with the aim of opening a sewing business

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 38-year-old, married father of 5 children, who puts much effort into providing them with their living necessities and covering their education fees.

Rabih has worked as a butcher since 2006.  He has one employee who helps him in responding faster to his customers’ needs.  He is well known in the region for the good quality of meat he serves in addition to the special prices he offers. 

Rabih is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car so he can expand his business and transport his goods easily from the market at a lower cost.  He hopes to keep on expanding his business through opening a new branch and starting a wholesale trade.

loans.use: to buy a car so he can expand his business and transport his goodseasily from the market at a lower cost.

loans.name: Hand In Hand Group

texts.en:
Mary is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mary was born in Koidu city 28 years ago. She is married to a technician and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mary sells market food, such as rice, onions, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. and has been doing business for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Mary and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Mary will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy rice, onions, palm-oil, pepper, margi, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, onions, palm-oil, pepper, margi, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, vive con su hija y un nieto, ella heredo de sus padres el negocio de la crianza de ganado, hoy en día lo hace con ayuda de su hija y su nieto, no le representa ninguna dificultad. Y de esta forma obtiene los ingresos para cubrir  gastos familiares.
Comprará más ganado y alimento para engordarlo, lo que le facilitará venderlos a sus clientes, espera mejorar sus ventas, fortalecer su negocio, y tener más ganancias, con las que cancelara su préstamo,
Aspira a tener una mejor economía para apoyar a su nieto en sus estudios y que tenga mayores oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ernestina lives with her daughter and a grandson. She inherited the business raising livestock from her parents. Today she performs the work with the help of her daughter and grandson. She does not have much difficulty. In this way, she earns income to cover the family's expenses.

She will buy more livestock and food to fatten them, which will help her to sell them to her customers. She hopes to improve her sales, strengthen her business and have more earnings with which to repay her loan.

She aspires to have a better financial standing to support her grandson in his education and have greater development opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and food.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, se siente complacido con el servicio que la empresa y los múltiples beneficios que tiene al hacer uso de los créditos, es por esa razón que solicita capital para comprar arroz, maíz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, etc., para surtir la tienda y de esa manera aprovechar la época navideña.
Con el préstamo anterior compro mucha mercadería que le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is pleased with the service that the company and the many benefits he has from the loans. It is for this reason that he is requesting money to buy rice, maize, beans, sugar, oil, etc. to stock his shop and thus take advantage of the holiday season. With the previous loan, he bought a lot of merchandise which helped him strengthen his business, satisfy his customers' needs and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, beans, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 43 years old and she lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region.  Gohar graduated from Yerevan State Medical University, from the Medical Faculty.  Now, she works at the local polyclinic as a therapist.  She is a smart and skilled specialist.  Thanks to her caring and professionalism, all the people she has helped recover mention that she is a kind and wise woman who is always ready to help resolve your health problems. 

Gohar says that since her childhood she had dreamed of becoming doctor.  So after many years of studying day and night and being devoted to her profession, finally, her dream has come true.  Gohar is married and has a son.  Her husband works as a real estate appraisor.  She says their living conditions are good, but they still have some problems with the heating of their flat, which requires serious financial expenditures.  

She asks for a loan of 800.000 Armenian drams to buy a heating boiler and generator for their flat, in order to provide warm and comfortable living conditions for their only son.

loans.use: to buy a heating boiler and generator for their flat

loans.name: Leanon

texts.fr: Femme de 39ans, Leanon a pour conjoint un mécanicien auto avec 03 enfants en charge. Ils sont âgés de 17,15 et 11ans et sont tous scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint, elle revend des couches et des insecticides de façon ambulante. Afin de faire avancer son activité, elle fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises.  le profit lui permettra de garder pérenne son activité et d'assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: A 39-year-old woman, Leanon has a husband who is an automobile mechanic and three children to support. They are 17, 15, and 11 years old, and they are all in school. To help out her husband, she resells diapers and insecticides door to door. To advance her business, she is taking out her very first loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise to sell. The profit will enable her to keep her business going and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase diapers and insecticides to sell

loans.name: Boanerges Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael de 62 años de edad, es divorciado y tiene un hijo, trabaja prestado servicios como chofer, hace 5 años participo en un diplomado de panadería, que hasta la fecha pone en práctica en el negocio. Vive con su madre, con quien trabaja la panadería 3 veces por semana y los días que tiene libre venden el pan en ruta o trabaja como chofer si se lo solicitan.

Boanerges decidió trabajar como panadero al ver las ganancias que el negocio dejaba y por la poca competencia que había en el lugar.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de trabajo para la panadería, tales como, azúcar, harina, levadura, manteca, huevos, bandejas, colorantes, entre otros, planea comprar grandes cantidades de producto porque viven lejos del lugar de suministro, así trabajara todos los pedidos que le soliciten los clientes.

En un futuro espera tener un local más grande, un vehículo para vender su producto en el municipio y emplear más personas.
texts.en:
Ismael, 62, is divorced and has one son. He works lending his services as a driver. Five years ago he participated in a bakery course which, up until now, he has put in practice in a business. He lives with his mother with whom he works in the bakery three time a week and on the days he has free, he sells the bread en route or works as a driver, if requested.

Boanerges decided to work as a baker upon seeing the earnings that the business generated and for the little competition that was in place.

The loan will be used to buy working materials for the bakery like sugar, flour, yeast, butter, eggs, trays, colorings, among other items. He plans to buy great quantities of product because they live far from the supply place. So he will work all the orders that the customers request.

In the future, he hopes to have a bigger shop, a vehicle to sell his product in the town and to employ more people.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast, butter, eggs, trays, colorings, among other items.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Yuni lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta.  Yuni is married and lives with four persons in their family house. 

Yuni began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months she has had around $136 – 137 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Rudy lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta. Rudy is married and lives with five persons in their family house. 

Rudy began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months he has had around $59 – 60 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya runs a small stall which sells computer accesories and mobile phone airtime credits. Lidya lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta.  Lidya is married and lives with four persons in their family house. 

Lidya began working with Ruma  one year ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months she has had around $32 – 33 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Ghulam Fizan

texts.en:
Ghulam Fizan is 37 years old and a married woman. She has been doing a business of selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets and then sells them to the people in her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income. 

Ghulam Fizan has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her increase her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs 40,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to stock her supply of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María es una mujer soltera y propietaria de un pequeño taller de confeccion en general, ubicado en su casa de habitacion, donde confecciona por encargo y reparación de ropa de trajes de niños, adultos, pantalones, blusas entre otros, su mayor demanda es la elaboracion de juegos de sabanas de cama, cortinas. gracias a la buena atencion que ella ofrece a sus clientes es que tiene mayor demanda de pedidos, El objetivo de este credito es para compra de materia prima tales como: telas, hilos, botones, encaje, siperes, rivetes, agujas entre otros materiales. uno de sus mayores sueños es poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que es en su casa. Ana María se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para superarse en la vida y les agradece a los inversionistas kivas por este apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Ana María is a single woman and the owner of a small general sewing workshop located in her house. She sews garments to order and mends adults' and children's clothing including pants, blouses, and more. Her greatest demand is for making bed sheet sets and curtains. Thanks to the good service that she offers her clients, her orders have increased.

The objective of this loan is to purchase raw materials like fabrics, threads, buttons, lace, zippers, rivets, needles, and others. One of her greatest dreams is to be able to improve her working conditions within her house. 

Ana María feels very grateful for this opportunity to better herself in life and she thanks the Kiva lenders for the support that they are providing to her.

loans.use: to purchase sewing products like thread, needles, fabric, zippers, buttons, lace, and more.

loans.name: Ensan Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Ensan. The members live in Taiz, Yemen. Together they have applied for a loan to the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Roqia is a 35-year-old married woman living in a poor area of Taiz. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned about the well-being of her family, who are now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan from AMB which she will use to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house.

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because in this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for completing her house.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is a 30-year-old single woman. She has one child who is 4 years old. She describes herself as confident. She operates a food stall where she sells tea, mandazi (East African doughnuts) and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small-scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy milk, wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy milk, wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman and the mother of two young children. She is from Bien Unido in Bohol. She has been engaged in a general store business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of products to sell, like canned goods, rice, candy, soda, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her store, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of products to sell, like canned goods, rice, candy, soda, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a constructor. He provides different types of construction services to locals in Yerevan town. Edgar lives with his wife and 5-year-old son. He works hard to provide appropriate living conditions for them.

By applying for this loan, Edgar asks financial support to be able to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work. The loan will greatly assist him to use new equipment and continue providing construction services to his customers. Edgar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Edgar hopes for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing construction services

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 23-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hardworking and loving person. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture, such as single beds, tables, chairs, cabinets, etc. He started this business from a young age; now he has grown young and energetic.  

Today, her husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but the family's needs are increasing day by day, and he needs more money to afford household expenses. 

Now, he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why Nusrat came to BRAC Pakistan. She wishes to obtain a loan so that her husband can buy raw materials for making furniture. 

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family.

Nusrat thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you once again the members of the "Sababu" group from the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. 

This group of entrepreneurs is very pleased to inform their numerous Kiva lenders that their previous Kiva loan has contributed significantly to the improvement of their businesses and personal lives. 

Having done repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group in other to further add more business inventories into their respective businesses. 

Marian remains the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Marian is again going to use her share of the loan to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба женщина с большим жизненным опытом. Она родилась в 1967 году. Матлюба замужем и имеет 3 детей. Матлюба несколько лет назад уехала в Российскую Федерацию, но дела у нее не сложились, и она вернулась в Таджикистан. Она теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес и зарабатывать деньги на жизнь. С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать бизнес. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Matlyuba is a woman with a lot of life experience. She was born in 1967. Matlyuba is married and has three children. Several year ago, Matlyuba went to the Russian Federation, but she did not find work and she returned to Tajikistan. She now wants to organize her own business and to earn a living.

With this aim, she took part in the course "Bring on Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to start a business buying and selling dried fruits. She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to purchase dried fruits, in order to organize a business. She will trade at the local market.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz tiene 36 años una hijita de 6 meses sigue con la misma actividad de la   elaboración de cigarrillos de chocolate ella tiene su pequeña fábrica que se encuentran en la  zona rio seco. este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Señora Beatriz va a usar este préstamo para la compra de quintales de azúcar por cantidad por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para la elaboración de más cigarrillos y preparar para la época fuerte de febrero y marzo, la Señora Beatriz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el trabajo que realiza implica que tenga que estar mucho tiempo parada y también inhalar muchas partículas de azúcar con colapiz que afectan al sistema pulmonar, va a utilizar los beneficios en compra de materia prima para volver a comprar más materia prima, su deseo para su negocio es llegar a tener una fábrica en la cual produzca en cantidad y llegar a exportar su producto, en los anteriores créditos utilizó el crédito en la compra de azúcar por mayor ya que esta es la principal materia prima para su negocio. Se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esto le permitió crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 36 years old with a 6-month-old daughter.  She continues in the same business activity of making chocolate cigarettes.  She has her small factory that is located in the Rio Seco (Dry River) zone.  This loan is her third with the institution.  Beatriz is going to use this loan to purchase quintals of sugar in quantity for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is for the manufacture of more cigarettes and to prepare for the busy season of February and March.  

Beatriz faces challenges in her business which are that the work that she does involves her having to stand a lot of the time and also involves her inhaling a lot of sugar particles with gelatin that affect the lungs.  She is going to use the benefits in the purchase of raw materials to purchase more raw materials again.  Her desire for her business is to have a factory that produces in quantity and to export her product.  She used the previous loans to purchase wholesale sugar since it is the principal raw material for her business.  

She feels happy and grateful for this opportunity that is offered her by the granting of the loan as this allowed her to grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar wholesale for the manufacture of her products.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона родилась в 1994 году. Она жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая молодая женщина. Рухшона участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Она будет предоставлять услуги портнихи у себя дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и верит, что этот займ даст ей надежду светлой будущей.
texts.en:
Rukhshona was born in 1994. She is a cheerful and hardworking young woman. Rukhshona took part in a course "Bring on Success: organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in this course and received a lot of positivity for herself. After she completed the course, she received a certificate. Now, she is ready to start a business, but at the same time she does not have money to buy a sewing machine. She will offer dressmaking services from her home.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She believes that this loan will give her hope for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Olufta

texts.ru: Олуфта жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1975 года. Она вдова и имеет одну дочь. Она с 1998 года работает в государственной организации. Олуфта имеет высшее образование. Она очень качественно выполняет свою работу. Коллеги Олуфты знают ее как честную и справедливую. Она выдала замуж свою дочь, и теперь она живет одна. Она уже несколько лет она больна и ей срочно надо лечиться, но она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Olufta is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1975. She is a widow and has one daughter. Since 1998, she has been working in a state organization. Olufta has a higher education. She fulfills her responsibilities in a high quality manner. Olufta's colleagues know her as honest and fair.

She married of her daughter, and she now lives alone. For several years, she has been ill and she has been in urgent need of medicine but she does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to purchase medication for treatment.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.ru: Шохзода трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать 2 детей. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад, и она данное время является вдовой. Она имеет свой собственный бизнес. Шохзода занимается купле продажей тканей. Шохзода справляется с бизнесом сама. Она торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою точку для продажи. Она хочет обновить ассортимент своего товара на новогодний сезон, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shohzoda is a hardworking woman. She is the mother of two children. Her husband passed away several years ago, and she is now a widow. She has her own business. Shohzoda buys and sells fabrics. Shohzoda copes with the business herself. She trades at the local market and has her own point of sale.

She wants to refresh her assortment of goods for the holiday season, but she does not have money. She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Vanadzor in Lori region.  She is of 39 years old.  Armine is married and she has 2 sons.  Her elder son is doing military service in the army and her second son studies at the medical college. 

Armine has her degree in education.  She works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.  She also has pupils she tutors and prepares for entrance examinations.  She says she loves her work and she does it with great care and devotion.

She asks a loan of 350.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and have access to more information about innovations in teaching and teaching methods.

loans.use: to buy a computer and have access to more information about innovations in teaching and teaching methods

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a 44-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 to 21 years. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a maize grinding business where she provides services of grinding maize into flour. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving her business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water tank. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is the fourth loan she is taking from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Reynald

texts.en:
Reynald is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income. He needs to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. In this way, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the  future, Reynald has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a lady of twenty-eight years, married to Patrick and a mother of two children. She runs a retail shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This will be Florah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy stock for her business like sugar, rice, cooking flour, etc. In the future, she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, rice, cooking oil, maize flour,  etc

loans.name: Lucema

texts.en:
Lucema is married and the mother of five young children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. 

She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for almost seven years now. As of now, Lucema is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the fishing boat so that her husband can continue in his fishing.

In the future, Lucema hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her fishing boat

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María,  es casada y madre de un niño de 2 años de edad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar ella instalo una tienda en su casa, su mayor venta es que es la única tienda en la zona donde reside, trabaja todos los días. 
Con el préstamo comprara bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas y un poco de pólvora (luces, volcancitos y cohetes), para aprovechar la época navideña y surtir su tienda con más productos para que sus clientes tengan en un solo lugar lo que buscan, espera aumentar sus ventas y generar más ingresos para cancelar sus deudas.
Aspira poder contar son los recursos necesarios para darle a su hijo una educación suprior.
texts.en:
María is married and is the mother of a 2-year-old son. In order to help her husband with household expenses, she installed a small store in their home. Her greatest advantage is that hers is the only store in the neighborhood where she lives, so she works every day of the week.

With the loan she will purchase beverages, basic grains and candies. She will also purchase gunpowder (for firecrackers) to take advantage of the holiday season, when it makes sense to stock her store with more products so that her clients have a one-stop-shop.

She hopes to increase her sales and generate greater earnings so that she can pay off her debts. She hopes to be able to have enough resources to give her son a college education.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, basic grains and and candies.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio, es un señor de dicado al cultivo de granos básico (maíz, frijol y maicillo), para obtener los ingresos necesarios para pagar los gastos familiares, realiza estas jornadas con ayuda de mozos, él vive junto a su esposa y una pequeña nieta, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en su negocio.
Utilizara el capital para pagar la mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de esta temporada, espera tener listo el producto en menor tiempo para cumplir con sus clientes y de esta manara empezar a recibir ganancias con anticipación y poder cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas, así como también cubrir los gastos familiares.
Aspira seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su economía para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Fidencio makes a living in the cultivation of basic grains (corn, beans and sorghum). To obtain the  income to pay for family expenses, he works with helpers nowadays. He lives with his wife and a young granddaughter. He has not had any problems with his business so far.

Fidencio will use this loan to pay for labour to harvest the crop this season. He hopes the product will be ready in less time, so he can meet his customers' needs and start earning sooner. This will allow him to repay his debt and cover family expenses.

He wishes to grow his business and improve his savings, so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the labour to harvest the crops

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es: Rosa, quien está de pie a la izquierda de la fotografía y viste polera a rayas negras y verdes y una cartera cruzada, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Abejitas de Concepción. En este Banco Comunal los socios venden ropa, hacen costuras y confección y tienen negocios de abarrotes. El negocio de Rosa es la venta de ropa usada de primera calidad y esto lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre vendió ropa , y ella lleva ya 10 años en el mismo negocio. Ella solo quiere seguir adelante en su negocio es por esto que está solicitando el préstamo, ya que quiere seguir comprando ropa y así poder vender a sus clientes quienes le han solicitado, es por esto que sabe que le irá muy bien. Está muy contenta de participar en Fondo Esperanza por toda la ayuda que le han prestado.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is standing on the left of the photo and is wearing a t-shirt with green and black stripes and has her purse across her, belongs to Las Abejitas de Concepción communal bank.  In this communal bank, the members sell clothing, do dressmaking, tailoring, and have grocery stores.  

Rosa's business is selling high quality used clothing, which she learned from her mother who always sold clothing.  She has spent 10 years in this business.  All she wants is to be successful in her business, which is why she is asking for a loan.  She wants to continue buying clothing and thus be able to sell to her customers who have asked for it, which is how she knows her business is doing very well.  

She is very pleased to participate in Fondo Esperanza due to all the help they have given her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, opta por otro crédito para invertir en la comprar harina, levadura, azúcar, manteca y pagara mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de maíz y frijol, lo que le permite crecer en su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más ganancias, más clientes satisfechos, invirtió más en el ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, ha pagado sus deudas, y su familia se encuentra saludable brindándole el apoyo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria has opted for another loan to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, sugar, butter and to pay for labor to gather the harvest of maize and beans which allows her to grow her business.

With the previous loan, she managed to have more income, more satisfied customers and invested more in the livestock and the cultivation of basic grains. She has paid her debts and her family is healthy providing the necessary support to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, butter and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Evelyn is 23 years old, a seventh grade dropout, unmarried, and has three children between 7 months old and 7 years old, who live at home. Only one attends school. She has a business cooking and selling rice and soup. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, fish, meat, etc. for her business. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old and just married, a young man from the town of Telavi. His wife is a university attendant. The young couple has recently moved to their own small flat and started living separately, but they still depend on their parents financially. 

In order to generate income on his own, George is requesting a loan. He plans to buy a second-hand car and serve locals as a taxi driver. He has the appropriate license, and as the taxi demand is high in his region, George thinks his initiative will be successful.

George awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 22 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquille, the capital of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and where living conditions are  much better than in Monrovia, the capital city of Liberia. 

Alice did not go to school.  She has two children, ages 4 and 6, both in school and living at home. 

Alice got money from her fiance to start her business. For over three years she has been running a table where she sells slippers, spending 12 hours each day on her business. 

Alice is requesting a loan to buy more slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Melahat

texts.en:
Melahat is married and has four children.  She has been working for 25 years.  When her husband became ill and couldn’t work, she endeavored to look after her children and to be the breadwinner for her family.  At first she did crocheting and knitting at home, selling the items to her neighbors and her circle of friends.  Later she began selling at the market.  Alongside the knitted items, she began selling vegetables.  She would also go to fairs.  

When the municipality opened an arcade for handicrafts sellers, Melahat applied and was accepted.  For the last seven years, she has made and sold handicrafts in the arcade.  Thanks to her work, she has made a living and raised her children.  All of her children except for her younger son are now married; Melahat wants to marry him off, too.  

Because she didn’t have capital, she couldn’t buy materials.  With the loan she gets from Maya, she’ll be able to buy materials and supplies, and she’ll be able to offer a greater variety of products.  With the tulle and lace she is going to buy, she will sew doily and tablecloth sets, and increase her earnings.

Her only hope is not to lose her health. As long as she is in good health, she wants to continue working.  She wants to continue selling in the arcade.  Because the arcade is located in the town center of Karamürsel, it is busy every day.  She feels that she has the chance to socialize and to meet many people by working in the arcade, and for that reason she doesn’t want to leave.  


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Melahat Hanım,evli ve 4 çocuğu var.  Yirmibeş senedir çalışıyor.  Eşi hastalanıp çalışamayınca çocuklarını bakmak için ,evini geçindirmek için çabalamış.  Önceleri evde lif,örgü işleri yapıp çevresine ,komşularına satmaya başlamış.  Sonra da pazarlara gidip satmış.  Örgülerinin yanında sebze de satmış.  Panayırlara gitmiş.  Belediye  el işi pasajı  açınca Melahat Hanım da müraacat etmiş ve kabul edilmiş.  Yedi senedir  bu pasajda el işlerini yapıp satıyor.  Yaptığı bu işlerle hem evini geçindirmiş hem de çocuklarını büyütmüş.  Çocuklarından  bir  tek küçük oğlu evlenmemiş.  Onu da evlendirmek istiyor.  Elinde sermaye olmadığından malzeme alamıyordu.  Mayadan aldığı kredi ile mal,malzeme alıp satışını arttıracak.  Çeşidini arttıracak.  Aldığı tül ve küpürlerle  oda takımları dikip burada satacak.Kazancını artıracak.  Bir tek ümidi sağlığını yitirmemek.  Sağlığı el verdikçe işlerini yapmak istiyor.  Bu pasajda satışlarına devam etmek  istiyor.  Pasaj  Karamürsel’in merkezinde olduğundan her gün çok hareketli geçiyor .  Bu pasajda sosyalleştiğini ve çok insan tanıdığını düşünüyor.Bu yüzden buradan ayrılmak istemiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Aiymkan

texts.ru: Айымкан 61 год, вдова, одна воспитала дочь. У Айымкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айымкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 700 сом KGS. Айымкан проживает вместе со своей дочерью и зятем, которые помогают ей по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Айымкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 8 коз, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айымкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома. Айымкан планирует установить ворота и сделать ограждение дома.
texts.en:
Aiymkan is 61 years old, widowed, and has one daughter. Aiymkan has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Aiymkan raises livestock, having begun 23 years ago with a livestock purchase of 700 som KGS. Aiymkan resides with her daughter and son-in-law, who help her around the homestead. Thanks to her hard work, Aiymkan currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows, one hors, eight goat, and ten sheep. Monthly income amounts to 3,600 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aiymkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy a cow to expand her livestock count.

Aiymkan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs. Aiymkan plans to install gates and to build a fence around the house.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Leonardo Jose

texts.es:
Su nombre es Leonardo y pide su apoyo para seguir estudiando,en el área de  Administración en Salud y así graduarse como técnico; ya que no tiene la facilidad de pagar todo el semestre,él es una persona muy responsable con ganas de salir adelante, viene de un pueblo y terminó la secundaria allí con mucho sacrificio, pues debía recorrer 4 kilómetros diarios en bicicleta para llegar al colegio. Llegaba a su casa, comía algo y salía a vender rifas hasta las 9 de la noche,  luego , en su nuevo trabajo le pagaban a diario y muy poco. 

Luego de terminar el colegio se presentó a la policía para prestar servicio, pero no aprobó, ese día fue terrible  y pensó que se me iba a acabar el mundo, pero no se dejó vencer por ese inconveniente y siguió trabajando como jornalero por días, hasta que se le presentó la oportunidad  de estudiar administración agropecuaria, terminó el ciclo y pensó que iba a conseguir trabajo en lo que había estudiado pero no fue así, entonces creó su propia micro empresa de cría y levante de pollos de engorde para la venta y también trabajaba lavando carros pesados como mulas y doble troques, pero este ultimo trabajo hizo que el enfermara. Unos familiares le propusieron irse a la ciudad para alcanzar nuevos objetivos y así lo hizo. Los primeros meses fue duro por su familia ya que tuvo que alejarme de ella, empezó a laborar  en una empresa de seguridad privada, donde por sus turnos rotativos no podía estudiar, en ninguna institución lo aceptaban por el horario, hasta que conoció esta institución donde coordinaron sus horarios los sábados y la oportunidad de pagar a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
His name is Leonardo and he asks for your support to continue studying in the area of Health Administration and thereby graduate as a specialist. He does not have the ability to pay for the semester. He is a very responsible person with drive to get ahead. He comes from a small town and finished high school there with a lot of sacrifice. He had to travel 4 kilometers each day by bicycle in order to get to school. He would get home, eat something and leave to sell raffle tickets until 9 at night. Later, in his new job they paid him very little daily.

After finishing high school, he went to the police to offer services but was not approved. This day was terrible and he thought that the world had ended, but he did not stay defeated by this inconvenience. He continued working as a day laborer for days, until the opportunity to study agricultural administration presented itself. He finished the course and thought that he was going to find work in what he had studied, but it was not so. Therefore, he created his own micro business of breeding and raising broiler chickens for sale. He also worked washing heavy autos like tractor-trailers and dump trucks, but this last job made him sick. 

Some family members proposed that he go to the city to reach new goals and that's what he did. The first months were tough because he had to leave his family. He started to work in a private security company, where because of rotating shifts he could not study: no institution accepted him because of the schedule, until he found out about this institution where they coordinated his schedule on Saturdays and the opportunity to pay through Kiva.

loans.use: fund his education.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has eight years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for five years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.  She is also involved in farming on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of PKR. 45,000 to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: Maman Ntagulwa  est vice-présidente du groupe Utulivu. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 44ans, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un  instituteur d’une école de la place. Le prêt sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 2 sacs de souliers d’occasion. Elle envisage devenir grossiste et  voir ses enfants achevés  leurs études  universitaires. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes.
texts.en: Aunt Ntagulwa is the vice-president of the Utulivu group. An energetic woman, she is 44 years old and has 10 children, all of whom go to school. She is married to a local school teacher.
