The requested loan will allow her to buy two bags of used shows. She plans to become a wholesaler and ensure that her children finish their college degrees. She thanks Hekima for supporting women.

loans.use: to buy two bags of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham lives in Getazat village of Ararat region. He lives there together with his mother, brother, wife and little child. 

Gegham works at a local company. As the salary is not high and isn't enough for covering his family’s basic costs, Gegham also earns his living by providing transportation service using his own truck. He receives orders and transports different types of products to individuals and also to companies. 

The truck that he is using is damaged and needs to be renovated. That's the reason Gegham asks for this loan. He will use the loan in renovating the truck and bringing it to working condition again. 

Gegham has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Gegham, and he hopes that lenders will assist him with his business activity.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his truck.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright, a twenty-eight year old hardworking man is married with one child and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been operating a butcher shop for the last seven years. He started this business to fight the poverty that was knocking at his door. Bright is faced with a challenge of low supply, especially in the dry season where animals lack water and the grass dries. However, he dreams of opening more butcher shops in the nearby towns.
Bright has asked for a loan to buy cows to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 41 years old and married, with two children. His wife is a literature teacher.  Elchin’s daughter is 15 years old; she is so talented a girl, she plays the piano. His son goes to school; in the future he wants to be a programmer. They are live in Baku region. 

Elchin rents a store, where he sells discs and phone accessories. Today he wants to increase his business. So that Elchin wants to buy a computer and a printer for office. Therefore he has applied to the Komak Credit Union for a loan of AZN 2,000. 

Elchin says he is thankful to the Kiva organization and its lenders for help. In the future he wants to buy a store to increase his monthly income and business.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Las Dinámicas Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia de estado civil casada. Tiene 51 años de edad. Curso 3 años de educación primaria. Tiene 1 hijo que va a la escuela. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de Refacciones. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concedió su esposo y a la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para poder preparar las refacciones que vende. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital propio y grande y desea tener un comedor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa americana, crianza de animales y venta de verduras.
texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman, 51, with three years of primary education. She has one son who goes to school. She makes her living preparing and selling snacks. She started this business with a small capital that her husband granted her and, to date, she has 15 years' experience.

She organized a group and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies to be able to prepare the snacks she sells. In the future, she wishes to have her own large capital and she wishes to have a small restaurant.

The other members of the group work in the sale of American clothing, animal raising and the sale of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy supplies for snacks.

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en: Nilma is a married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have a fishing business. Nilma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for their boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Nilma hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat (for a fishing business)

loans.name: Shirxan

texts.en:
Shirxan is 28 years old and married. He is hard-working with a great desire to progress in life. His lifetime partner is a housewife, and they have two children. They live in the house he has succeeded in building, thanks to his great dedication, in a rural area.

He is one of the successful businessmen of his town. For more than two years, he has been busy selling technology items. He sells computers, DVD discs, antennas, etc. 

He knows all aspects of his business very well. His experience and skill help him to develop the business and in this way improve living conditions. His brother helps him with the business. 

Shirxan wants to develop the business further, but his income is small, and he needs your help and mercy. He is asking for a loan of AZN 2,000 to buy technology items and increase his working capital. 

He awaits your support

loans.use: to buy technology items and increase his working capital.

loans.name: Aftandil

texts.en:
Aftandil is married. He is 34 years old and has two children. His elder child goes to the fourth class and his little child goes to the first class of school. Aftandil’s wife is a nurse in a local polyclinic. His family are IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Fuzuli city for  21 years already and now they live in the Baku region. 

Aftandil is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between different areas of the Baku region. Now it is the winter season and he wants to buy new wheels and an anti-crash chain for his car. Also he wants to repair it. Therefore he has applied for a loan amount of 1,850 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future he wants to paint the car and change the car’s salon.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and an anti-crash chain

loans.name: Amchigul

texts.ru: Амчигул трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1963 году. Амчигул работает в больнице своего района, как сестра хозяйка. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Амчигул замужем и имеет одну дочь. Она вместе со своей семьей живет в доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Она несколько лет начала стройку нового дома, но так как у нее маленькая она не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы достроить дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Amchigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1963. Amchigul works in a hospital in her region, as a nurse hostess. She is a hardworking and cheerful woman. Amchigul is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in a home which is in poor condition.

Several years ago, she began building a new home, but since she has little she does not have enough money to finish building. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to purchase slate.

loans.use: to buy slate for making a roof

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1960 году. Мавчигул имеет собственный бизнес. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Мавчигул выращивает пшеницу, хлопок и картофель. Она продает свой урожай на местном рынке. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Она всегда старается для благополучия своих детей. Ее сын учится в Технологическом Университете Таджикистана и Мавчигул должна оплатить за его учебный договор. Мавчигул запрашивает займ на сумму 750 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavjigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1960. Mavjigul has her own business. She grows crops. Mavjigul grows wheat, cotton and potatoes. She sells her harvest at the local market. She is married and has six children. She always strives for the well-being of her children. Her son is studying at the Technology Universisty of Tajikistan and Mavjigul must pay for his tuition.

Mavjigul is requesting a loan of US$750 to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a lady of forty years, married to Daniel and a mother of two lovely children. She runs a beauty salon in Kangemi and also sells beauty products. She has been in this business for one year now, and she gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. 

This will be Alice’s second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more beauty products like hair relaxer, shampoo, etc. In future she wants open a wholesale beauty supplies shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair relaxer, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Santigie. He is married and has two children, ages 11 and 8 years. They are both school-going children. 

In 2008, Santigie established his spare parts (bicycle) business. He began his business because he dropped out of school at the primary level. He was inspired by his elder brother's trade. His brother was a bicycle mechanic. 

Santigie refused to go to school and, instead, spent his time with his brother. His elder brother gave him the opportunity to join his trade. Years later, Santigie decided to sell spare parts that are of great demand to customers. He now owns a spare parts shop. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 984,000 every month from this business. 

Santigie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase boxes of inner and outer tires and other spare parts. 

In the future, Santigie plans to expand his business and improve his family's status. Changes in the price of goods is his main challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of inner and outer tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Mohamed Cox

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Mohamed Cox. He is married and has two children aged two and one year. 

In 2009, Mohamed Cox established his clothing sales business, selling shirts, polo shirts, trainers, slippers, jeans etc. He began his business because after the death of his father he had no one to sponsor his education. In order not to become a liability, he sold some of his belongings to start the business.

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about LE 898,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of LE 4,000,000. Mohamed Cox requires a loan to buy trainers, jeans and polo shirts for resale. 

In the future, Mohamed Cox plans to open another outlet, develop his piece of land and educate his children. Inadequate capital is his main challenge.
He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for providing additional capital towards his business and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, trainers and polo shirts for resale

loans.name: Isatu K.

texts.en:
This is 20-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 1 child, a 15-month-old baby.  In 2008, Isatu established her jewelry and cosmetics business.  She began her business because she was brought up by an aunt who was a business woman.  She spent most her time helping her with housework and her business because she lacked an interest in education.  Therefore, she grew up to be a business-oriented person with a lot of experience.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,196,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics.  In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business and also educate her child to college level.  Competition is very high.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yamileth, es una mujer que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene una venta de queso y también ejerce el cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, son oficios que aprendió de familia y lo realiza de 7:00 a.m. hasta 4:00 p.m., no le representa ninguna dificultad para realizarlo.
Invertirá en la compra de quesos e insumos agrícolas, tales como  fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas y abono, le servirá para tener más fortalecido su negocio, espera mejorar su producción, mejorar sus ganancias y  brindar producto freso y de buena calidad a sus clientes.
Sueña con comprar un vehículo que le facilite el traslado de mercadería y que a su vez le una comodidad para su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a woman who works to get her family ahead.  She has three children and sells cheese and raises corn, beans, and “maicillo.”  She learned this from her family and works from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm and she hasn’t had any problems.

She will buy cheeses and farming supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, and compost.  This will help her strengthen her business to improve her production, increase her earnings, and provide good quality, fresh products to her customers.

She dreams of buying a car that will allow her to transport her merchandise and also to provide more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy cheese and farming supplies.

loans.name: Lucio Escobar

texts.es:
Lucio, necesita un nuevo crédito para seguir trabajando y seguir generando los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia, en esta ocasión lo utilizara para pagar la mano de obra para pagar mozos que le ayuden a realizar la recolección de la cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior compro comprar taladro y madera para aserrar para fortalecer el negocio, lo que le permitió salir beneficiado con mejores ventas, mayores ingresos y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Lucio needs a new loan to continue working and generating income that he needs to get his family ahead. On this occasion, he will use it to pay labor costs for assistants that help him carry out the collection of the harvest.

With the previous loan, he bought a drill and sawtimber to strengthen the business. This let him leave benefitting with improved sales, increased income and he could pay off his debts.

loans.use: pay labor costs to assistants.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 32-year-old married man and lives in Kotianeti, Senaki district. He lives with his parents, wife, and son. Every member of the family gets a refugee pension of 28 GEL per person, except his wife. Omar's mother also gets a disability pension of 100 GEL. 

Omar works as a salesman for a car paint shop and generates 200 GEL monthly. Now he wants to open a workshop for car repair in the center of the town, specifically to repair and paint cars' plastic parts. His project will be profitable but it needs support. 

Omar received credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, a Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 1,200 USD, he will purchase the inventory that he needs for his activities. His regular customers will be locals and passersby as well. Omar will serve his clients himself and work hard to increase turnover gradually. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To open a workshop for car repair

loans.name: Maria Evelia

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, es comerciante, tiene una venta de panes con pollo en un puesto frente a la alcaldía municipal, vive sola y es empleada por su propia cuenta, genera los suficientes ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.

Tiene dos años de experiencia en este negocio, lo aprendió de su mamá que también se dedico a este tipo de negocio. De lunes a sábado trabaja de 6: 00 de la mañana a 3:00 de la tarde.

El préstamo será utilizado para poner un pequeño negocio de bebidas y compra de luces pirotécnicas para vender en la temporada. Así podrá dar un mejor servicio en el negocio y espera por la temporada vender toda la pólvora.

Los planes para el futuro son mejorar el local, comprar mesas y sillas para dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old. She is single and does not have any children. She lives alone and is self-employed. She works in sales, selling bread and chicken from a stall located in front of city hall. She learned this business from her mother who was also a saleswoman, and has had this business for two years. Working Monday-Saturday from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. Maria earns enough money to satisfy her basic needs. 

This loan will be used to stock beverages and to purchase fireworks to sell for the holiday season. In this way María will be able to give a better service and she hopes that with the season she will be able to sell all the fireworks she buys. Her plans for the future are to improve her storefront and to purchase tables and chairs to better server her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and fireworks.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her son's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s son. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time, they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of five children, and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in large quantities, she applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way, they would be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. She dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, with the packs of polish and nails in large quantities.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She has been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to maintain a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hoping to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of a bright future for her children and desires to improve their standard of living. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Bismilla

texts.en: Bismilla is a 47-year-old married woman, who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items and other products for everyday use at a reasonable price, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She will use the loan to buy stock of rice, sugar and biscuits from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and biscuits for her store.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en: Hafeez is a 32-year-old married woman. She is an energetic woman and she has been running a clothing business for the past seven years. Hafeez buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough income through her business. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs, to expand her inventory and attract more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Resmiye

texts.en:
Resmiye is married with four children.  Three of them are studying.  She started her business without any capital in order to take care of her four children’s needs.  

In the beginning she was making dowry goods for her relatives and neighbors from her home.  Later on she borrowed some money and bought a machine and opened a store.  Business went well and she paid her debts back.  In time she invested her profits in her business, and now she has five machines in her store.  

She heard about Maya from her colleagues, and she got a loan.  With the loan she received, she is planning to buy various types of fabrics.  She believes that with more variety of material she will reach a wider customer range.  

Her aim is to provide for her children’s education and a better future, increase her business volume, hire people, and also teach those people her occupation.    

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Resmiye Hanım,evli ve 4 çocuğu var.  Üç çocuğu okula gidiyor.  Sıfır sermaye ile işe başlamış.  Dört çocuğunun ihtiyaçlarını  karşılamak için ,çalışmak istiyordu.  İlk başlarda evde akrabalara,komşulara çeyiz işi yapıyordu.  Sonra borç  para alarak bir makinayla dükkanını açtı.  İşleri iyi gitti ,borçlarını ödedi.  Kazancı ile her defasında bir makine aldı ve bugün dükkanında beş makinası var.
Maya yı esnaf arkadaşından duymuş ve onunla birlikte kredi almış .  Aldığı kredi ile çeşitli kumaşlar alacak.  Elinde çeşit olursa daha çok müşteriye ulaşıcağını düşünüyor.
Hayali çocuklarını okutup, onlara güzel bir gelecek sağlamak.  İşini daha da ilerletmek.Yanına eleman alıp yetiştirmek ve meslek öğretmek.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is a married woman and a mother of two.  One of her children is attending school now. 

Zeynep runs her aunt's hosiery store.  When her aunt got sick, she decided to transfer the shop to Zeynep, who began to work at this job, thanks to her aunt.  She did not have any stock when she first began in this business.  She took the business over with great courage and borrowed from her aunt.  She paid half of what she owed in only four months.  

There was only hosiery in the store when she first took the business over.  She then got in contact with local women who work in their homes and make muslin, towels, prayer rugs, and picot items.  She bought some trousseau items that the women produced, displayed them in her shop, and received a lot of new orders from customers.  Both Zeynep and the other women earned a lot.  

She is now working with ten women.  With the loan from Maya, she wants to buy women’s clothing, especially winter clothes.  She believes that if the variety of the products is larger, she will make more sales.  She wants to advance her business, open a bigger shop, and support her children's education without depending on anyone.  She wants to stand on her own feet and move forward.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Zeynep Yeşilda, evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Çocuklardan bir tanesi okula gidiyor.  Yengesi tuhafiye dükkanı o işletiyordu.  Hastalanınca Zeynep Hanıma devretti.  Yengesinin teşviki ile bu işi yapmaya başlamış.  Elinde hiç sermayesi yoktu .  Dükkanı aldı ve bir cesaretle işe başladı.  Yengesine borçlandı.  Dört ayda borcunun yarısını ödedi.  Zeynep dükkanı aldığında sadece tuhafiye malzemeleri vardı.  Çevresinde , evde tülbent ,havlu,seccade ve piko yapan kadınlarla iletişime geçti.  Onlara çeyizlik malzemeleri yaptırdı.  Gören müşteriler sipariş verdi.  Hem onların hem de Zeynep Hanımın  kazancı arttı.  Şu anda on kadın ile çalışıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile kadın üst giyim alacak.  Çeşidi ne kadar çok olursa kazancıda o kadar artacak.  Özellikle kışlık giysiler alacak.  İşimde daha da yükselmek istiyoru.  Daha büyük bir dükkan açmak hayali ve İki çocuğunu okutmak,kimseye muhtaç olmadan ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak.  Kendi ayaklarının üstünde durmak ve ilerlemek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Inka Sevillano Group

texts.es:
El socio Saul pertenece al banco comunal INKA SEVILLANO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Accha, provincia de Paruro y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Saúl tiene 56 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como ganados, el socia cría a estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para su negocio.
Los demas socios se dedican a la venta de carpinteria , menajeria, verduras y frutas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Saúl is a member of the Inka Sevillano communal bank.  The bank is located in the Accha district, which is in the province of Paruro in the Cusco region.  Saúl is 56 years old and is single.  He spends his days raising animals such as cattle.  Saúl raises these animals to sell when customers request them.  He has been in this business for some time, and it's going well, thanks to the hard work he puts in every day.  Saúl is a responsible person which is how he makes progress.  He requests this loan so he can buy a cow for his business.  The other members work selling furniture, dishes, and fruits and vegetables.  Saúl is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Yerevan. He has been involved in shoe making for 3 years. Near the house where Armen and his family live, there is a small booth where Armen provides shoe making and repair services (making shoes, renovation of shoes, etc).
He has many loyal clients who value the good quality work that Armen provides and order their shoes from him. He has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase materials and a sewing machine needed for his work. 
Armen has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
The loan will greatly assist Armen and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making shoes and to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chimedee

texts.en:
Chimedee is 62 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (traditional nomadic yurt house) in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. His wife Nyamsuren is retired and stays home taking care of the family. His older son helps him to run their family business of wooden furniture manufacturing. His younger son is 14 and is a local public school student. 

Chimedee has worked at a local wooden furniture manufacturing company since 1990. He started his own business years ago. He has lot of experience and now his son is involved in the business. Chimedee teaches and grooms his son to prepare him to run the family business further. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to replace some of the tools and purchase wooden inventories for his business.

loans.use: to replace some of the tools and purchase wooden inventories for his business

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar is a farmer. He has a lovely family: his wife and three children. His children help Anvar in his work. Anvar’s wife is a housewife. They live in the Baku region. 

It’s noted that Anvar is a farmer. He has been in the animal breeding business for 17 years, so Anvar buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. He learned this trade from his father and in the future he wants his sons to be farmers, too. 

Today Anvar wants to increase his business and requests a loan in amount of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy more calves. He is thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future Anvar wants to start producing dairy products and selling them.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado pues pudo incrementar el capital del negocio, ella desea seguir participando en el proyecto porque es una persona responsable y trabajadora, ella continua con la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, piñas, yucas, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Leonarda es un miembro del banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Leonarda thanks the lenders for the [previous] loan and for the support it provided, which helped her increase her business capital. She wishes to continue participating in the project because she is a responsible and hard working person. She is still working in agriculture; in fact, she is cultivating various plots of land where she plants plantains, pineapple, yucca, and corn in addition to other crops. She has been in this business for a number of years and she is doing quite well thanks to the determination she applies to her work. 

Leonarda is a member of the communal bank "Tesoritos del Manu" and at this time she requires a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the village Kheta, Khobi district.  She lives with her husband and 4 children.  The family is involved in agriculture.  Tamar and her husband work hard on a family-owned farm growing nuts, citrus and laurel.  Also, they have 1 cow and 2 mother pigs and earn 100-150 GEL monthly from their products. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Tamar decided to start selling walnuts and applied for credit at local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

This start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of 600 GEL to purchase a supply of walnuts at wholesale prices to resell to the local market. The new business initiative will give Tamar chance to have financial stability and increased monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of walnuts for resale

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is a 29-year-old lady from Kakamega county, married to Gerald who is a civil servant. They have one child who is three years old. Iris sells second-hand clothes, commonly known as mitumba. She has been in this business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She has now applied for a loan of 20,000 KES, her first loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she intends to use in expanding her business. The profits will be used to educate her child and to repay the loan. She has a dream of expanding to be a wholesaler in this sector.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 26 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. Nimba County is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Helena attended school before starting her business, and she describes herself as a business woman. She is unmarried and has three children between 4 and 8 years old. Only two of her children are in school and live at home. She has been running a local restaurant for the past four years now. A problem she faces is that customers are slow to buy sometimes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry meat for her business. Her plan is to build a restaurant. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dry meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat was born in 1974. She is married and has two children. Her children are adults.

Malohat is a repeated client of IMON. She is a kind woman. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. Her husband is a migrant. Malohat feeds cows. She sells milk and kefir (a fermented milk drink) to her neighbors. Her children help her to manage her business.

Malohat wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 US dollars (USD) to buy cattle for increased working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increased working capital.

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe KANOUYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.  Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 1ème prêt avec   l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Mme MARIA  occupe la première position à droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  fait le commerce des oignons. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une 50kg des oignons. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville. Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de la ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000fcfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of Kanouya Group are married women who average 34 years of age and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods in Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. In the photograph, Mrs. Maria is the first woman on the right. She sells onions.

She intends to use her loan to buy 50 kg of onions. She gets her supplies in the city of Sikasso. She resells for cash at a fixed location at Sikasso's market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 52), to be in part used to repay the loan and interests. The remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be aggressive in business. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits like mangoes, oranges, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor transport. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of fruits. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add to her stock of fruits

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Vanadzor town where she lives with her two children (17 and 22 years old).

Armine earns her family's living by providing cleaning services to different local companies. She works hard to sustain her family and cover its basic needs. Now, by applying for this loan, Armine is asking for financial support to be able to purchase cleaning materials and tools. Armine hopes for lenders' goodwill as her work is very important for her and her family.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Armine hopes for support.

loans.use: to pay for cleaning materials and tools to provide cleaning services to local companies

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Abdumalik is a hardworking man. He was born in 1959. He is married and has three children. Abdumalik has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. He has great experience. Abdumalik has additional income from growing potatoes and carrots. He works hard from early morning till late evening. 

Abdumalik is going to increase his working capital. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year old Zainab from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. She also supports two relatives at home.

Zainab runs a general food container business within her community, where she sells cups, plates, and food containers; she has been in this business since 2009. Zainab says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic and rubber cups, plates and a variety of other food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more plastic and rubber cups, plates, and a variety of other food containers.

loans.name: Barly

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Barly from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  Barly established her wax cotton material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 5:30 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Barly requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton cloth to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Barly plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton cloth to expand her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 51, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a business manufacturing cement tiles with her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past six years. They have become famous in their community for providing good quality tiles. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy stock of cement and sand with some tools. She is expecting a boost in their earnings through their larger sales. Naseem dreams of expanding their business in the near future.  She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stock of cement and sand with some tools.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, age 46, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She is doing this with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo) and makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: María Pamela

texts.es:
María Pamela es una joven de 30 años, casada, madre de dos niños en edad escolar.
Habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida y se siente muy orgullosa de ser parte de este maravilloso pueblo porque es una tierra bendecida donde se produce leche y miel.
Desde hace seis años inició su negocio el cual consiste en la venta de ropa y sandalias con la ayuda de su esposo quien le regaló un pequeño capital para que generara sus propios ingresos.
La forma de vender de Pamela es de manera ambulante la cual camina en una bicicleta visitando casa por casa a sus posibles clientes donde la mayoría la prefiere porque vende favorable y es muy amable.
Se siente a gusto con su negocio porque le da para vivir dignamente y la forma en que lo hace en bicicleta que es saludable para ella y el medio ambiente.
En este momento está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pantalones y blusas, ya que necesita de este capital porque la temporada navideña es muy buena.
Espera que los inversionistas de Kiva le apoyen con este financiamiento a través de Ceprodel donde les quedará muy agradecida.
texts.en:
María Pamela is a young woman of 30 years. She is married and is the mother of two school-aged children. She lives in the municipality of El Sauce where she has lived her entire life. She feels very proud to be a member of this marvelous town because it is a blessed land where they produce milk and honey.

She began her business 6 years ago. She sells clothing and sandals with the help of her husband, who gave her a bit of capital so that she could earn her own income. Pamela is a traveling saleswoman, traveling house-to-house by bicycle to meet potential customers. Most of her customers prefer her because her prices are good and she is very friendly. She is pleased with her business because it enables her to live a dignified life. And, since she conducts her business by bicycle, it is very healthy for her and for the environment. 

Pamela is now requesting a loan to purchase pants and blouses. She needs these items because they sell very well during the Christmas season. She hopes that the Kiva lenders support her with this money through Ceprodel, for which she would be very grateful.

loans.use: to purchase pants and blouses.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene 37 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, la señora Virginia vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Virginia va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  La señora Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción, La señora Virginia es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia is 37 years old and makes her living in buying and selling cattle. Sra. Virginia lives in the town of Batallas. This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Sra. Virginia will use this loan to purchase cattle to breed in order to grow her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is to improve her income. 

Sra. Virginia faces challenges in her business which are to grow her business and improve her quality of life and use the profits to buy nutritious food for her cattle and thus be able to have more dairy production. Sra. Virginia is a young person who wants to move forward and she is happy for this opportunity that is offered to her to enhance her business and therefore her income as this is her only activity that she does to make a living.

loans.use: to purchase Brown Swiss dairy cattle

loans.name: Hugo Julian

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene 53 años y es casado con el  sigue con la actividad de fabricar artesanías  en miniatura en plomo, su taller se encuentran en la zona  de Arahona este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Hugo va a usar este préstamo para compra de pinturas y otros materiales de transformación para la fabricaciones sus artesanías,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de inventario, El señor Hugo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la apertura de nuevas fábricas en la zona, él va a utilizar los beneficios teniendo una mayor producción de su artesanía, su deseo para su  negocio es tener una galería de miniatura y exportar al exterior del país.
texts.en:
Hugo is 53 and married. He is continuing with his crafts business, making miniatures in lead. His workshop is in the Arahona area. This loan is his third with the institution. 

Hugo is going to use this loan to buy paints and other materials for making his crafts. His reason for requesting this loan is to increase his inventory. Hugo is facing challenges in his business, such as the opening of new workshops in the area. He is going to use the profits to increase his production of crafts. His wish for his business is to have a gallery of miniatures and export to other countries.

loans.use: To buy paint and other materials.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is twenty-eight-years old, married to Bernard, and a mother of two children. She is a farmer in Wangige on the outskirts of Kangemi, and has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be Rahab's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy poultry and pigs. In future she wants to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and pigs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is thirty four years old from Olkalou. He is not married yet, but he supports his parents financially. He is a photographer, and has been running this business for the past 13 years. To enable him to buy a photo printing machine, he has applied for his fifth loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is 15,000 KES and his intention is to use profits realized from his expanded business to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya. His hope or dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a printing machine to be used in his photo lab

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Rina is married.

Rina began working with Ruma two years ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, she has had around $47 - $48 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab, who is a 25-year-old married man, lives in Kakhaberi, Batumi district.  He lives with his 2 little sons, wife, brother and parents.  His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of children.  His mother is a nurse at hospital and generates 100 GEL monthly.  His brother is a driver, who has a 400 GEL monthly income.  His father is a worker and is paid 250 GEL per month.  Merab is also a driver at minibus company and is compensated on a fixed salary. 

In order to make his income more profitable, Merab wants to purchase his own car and not have to pay for car rental.  The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1600 $ for purchasing his own car.  

Merab is motivated and is a hard-working person.  This will give him a chance to earn more income and become financially independent.  Through the start-up program, Merab will be able to create savings and provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase his own mini bus

loans.name: Semiha

texts.en:
Semiha is a widow with three children. When she lost her husband, she faced financial difficulties. She needed to do something, so Semiha wanted to acquire one of the stalls by the seaside. There, she started to sell jewelry. Now she sells various types of jewelry. In the summer, the place on the seaside where she set up her stand is bustling, and the stand does business until 3 AM. Sales are very good. Her children are married, and she has a home set up.

The income she makes from the stand is sufficient for her to meet her needs. With the loan, she will go to Istanbul and buy different jewelry to increase her selection. She believes that the greater the selection of jewelry, the greater her sales will be. This way, she will increase her profit and make more income.

After this, she wants health. As long as she remains healthy, she wants to continue to work and do her job. She wants to set up her stand every summer.  She says that by working she found life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Semiha Hanım dul ve 3 çocuğu var.  Eşini kaybedince maddi olarak sıkıntı çekti.  Bir şeyler yapması gerekiyordu.  Semiha Hanımda, sahilde kurulan  tezgahlardan yer istedi.  Burada hazır takı çeşitleri satmaya başladı.  Bu tezgahta çok çeşitli takı modelleri satmaktadır.  Yazın sahilde tezgah kurdukları yer, çok hareketli ve güzel geçer, gece saat üçlere kadar tezgahları açık olur ve satış yaparlar.  Ürün satışları çok iyi gidiyor.  Çocukları evlenmiş, kendi yuvasını kurmuş, buradan gelen gelirde Semiha Hanıma yetiyor.
Kredi ile İstanbul’gidip  değişik takılar alacak.  Çeşidini arttıracak.  Çeşidi  çok olursa ,satışıda çok olur.  Böylece kazancı artar.  Daha çok gelir elde eder.  Bundan sonra sağlık istiyor.  Sağlığı el verdikçe çalışmak,işini yapmaya devam etmek istiyor.  Tezgahını her yaz açmak istiyor.  Çalışarak hayat bulduğunu söylüyor.

loans.use: to buy different jewelry to increase her selection.

loans.name: Imas

texts.en:
Imas lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Imas is married.

Imas began working with Ruma one year, 8 months ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, she has had around $ 78 - $79 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on the weekends.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 45 year old, married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be passionate. Alice operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas, onions, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Alice describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy more stock. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stocks of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is Alice's second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further.

loans.use: to add additional stocks of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Swaleh

texts.en:
Swaleh is a married man with six school-going children. He lives in his own house that has electricity but has no piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en: Kefa is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children ages 2 to 7 years. He describes himself as confident. He operates a retail business where he sells bananas, apples, watermelon and drinks. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and drinks for sale. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: add stock of fruits and drinks

loans.name: Kalygul

texts.ru: Калыгул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. У Калыгул - средне-специальное образование. По характеру Калыгул очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. В данное время на пенсии, вместе с мужем Калыгул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец, а  также обрабатывает 3,34 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. По хозяйству существенную поддержку дает супруг. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Kalygul is 51 years old, married and raising 3 sons together with her husband. Kalygul has a secondary-specialized education. She is very responsible, personable and happy. At the present time, Kalygul and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 9 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kalygul's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 horse and 20 sheep, and also 3.34 hectares of land, where she primarily grows beans. They sell their harvest to wholesale distributors. Her husband provides significant support with the business.  The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kalygul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows and sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Kalygul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Dekontee

texts.en:
Dekontee is 28 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has a one-year-old child. She is a high school graduate, and has been selling palm oil in the local market. 

Dekontee has been doing this for three years. She says sometimes the business is very good and she has good profits and sometimes it's slow and she doesn't make much money. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more palm oil for her business. She likes having customers around. Dekontee's dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 32 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is unmarried and has three children ages 4 to 14. They all live with her and are attending school. 
For four years she has been selling pepper, oil, rice, etc in the local market. Now, she has a regular group of customers that visits regularly at her table market. She likes to make her own money. 
Cathrine has requested a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, etc. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Korlu

texts.en:
Korlu is 20 years old, a mother of a two-year-old child, and lives in the town of West Point. She’s engaged in selling palm oil which she buys in the rural area and sells in the local market in her community.

Korlu has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil, and hopes to make more profit to enable her give her child a quality education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Naili

texts.en: Naili is a 66 year-old widow woman from village Cikhesulori. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Naili's son is temporarily unemployed and her daughter-in-law takes care of her child. Naili is a teacher and gets 150 GEL monthly. Also the family is engaged in agricultural activity. They have a plot of agricultural land and grow grapes and nuts. Naili works hard in her free time and sells product locally. Her business needs some investment for further development, so Naili requested a loan. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the requested money she will purchase a milk cow and will produce yogurt and cheese for local trading. Naili will increase her family's income and create financial stability. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase milked-cow

loans.name: Dragan

texts.en:
Dragan is 35 years old and married with two children, a boy and a girl ages 4 and 7 years old. Currently only one of them is attending school. They live in a minority community of Kosovo. He works hard to improve the living conditions and future for his children.

In an effort to be able to provide a better life, Dragan has been managing his own cafe business, a dream come true for him. In this way, he has been able to provide for his family, who he loves very much, and even work alongside his wife who helps him run his business. He started with a small coffee bar and now has managed to expand by taking loans as a regular customer of KosInvest. His business is now open from early morning until very late night as he is quite popular and has many customers all day long. Primarily his customers are the younger generation who has a good time drinking coffee and getting together socially.

This time, Dragan is in need of a loan to purchase two more freezers, as well as tables, chairs, and some other materials for his cafe. He believes that these items are necessary to better meet the needs of his customers and thereby increase his business and profit even more. Eventually he would like to be able to hire another employee to help him and his wife.

Dragan promises to pay his loan on time and wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase two freezers, tables, chairs, and some other materials for his cafe business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Adama from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married with five children. Adama has a wax cotton material business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business supplying decorating material for events like birthdays, parties, and weddings. She has been doing it for the past eight years and has retained a good number of customers. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of decorating fabrics, hanging decorations, and artificial flowers, along with packs of paints in different colors. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of decorating fabrics, hanging decorations, and artificial flowers, along with packs of paints in different colors.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Kadiatu runs a retail business. She has drinks, pure water, and cigarettes for resale. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business from throughout the week and twelve hours per day. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more drinks, pure water, and cigarette to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water, and cigarettes to expand her business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. In 2009, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create income for her survival. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and a proper business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks, soap, biscuits, and cigarettes for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, soap, biscuits, cigarettes for resale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. But now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Roubina

texts.en:
Roubina is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. Currently, she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: Guadalupe de 57 años es viuda con 04 hijos independientes y pertenece al grupo “La Inmaculada Concepción”  conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras. Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y  chupetes de fruta la cual lo realiza en las afueras de un colegio, siendo sus mayores clientes alumnos del colegio. Gracias a su esfuerzo a podido apoyar en su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de azúcar, frutas y bolsas. Su mayor deseo es de tener un puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo “La Inmaculada Concepción”  agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Guadalupe se encuentra de pie es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo crema con rayas marones y falda ploma.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, who is 57, is a widow with four adult children. She belongs to La Inmaculada Concepción group, which comprises six hardworking women. Guadalupe works selling fruit juice gelatin and popsicles, which she does outside of a school, the students being her main customers. Thanks to her effort she has been able to contribute to her household. She will use this loan to buy sugar, fruit, and bags. Her greatest desire is to have a proper stand where she could offer her products.

The group La Inmaculada Concepción wants to thank everyone who is making this loan possible, and its members are committed to continue working well. Guadalupe is standing in the picture. She is the second woman from the right, wearing a cream-color polo shirt with brown stripes and a gray skirt.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, and bags.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Even though Ekua grew up in difficult circumstances, she is a successful fishmonger. She buys fresh fish in the market and smokes it to sell at Elmina, which is located in the Central Region. Ekua is standing beside the oven she uses in smoking her fish. She has been involved in this business for years. She is a single mother with four children. She uses all the proceeds from her business to pay her children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell more smoked fish. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest part of her profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet the rising customer demand and the needs of the family.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, so she can sell more smoked fish.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза родилась в 1987 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она имеет собственный бизнес. Более 3 года она занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. Ее муж построил магазин возле дома и данное время Дилфуза торгует в этом магазине. Дилфуза продает молочные продукты, мясные продукты, консервы и т.п. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Дилфуза хочет увеличить оборотный капитал в канун праздника Нового года и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilfuza was born in 1987.  She is married and is raising 2 children, and has her own business.  For more than 3 years she has been selling food stuffs.  Her husband built a store next to their home where Dilfuza her wares.  Dilfuza sells milk and meat products, preserves, etc.  Her husband helps her run her business.  Dilfuza hopes to increase her working capital as New Year holiday approaches.  WIth this goal, she is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase food products.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase her working capital

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a 47-year-old Lebanese divorced man living with his only child. He has owned a car repair shop since 1986, where he fixes different types of cars. Roger runs his business very carefully and works very hard to be able to provide himself and his child with sufficient revenue to help them meet their needs. And today, with the loan he has applied for from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will buy electrical machinery that will certainly help his operations. Roger took advantage of a previous Kiva loan, and he was very well satisfied with the results, especially because he was able to expand his business remarkably and to earn more income. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop, where he will start selling car spare parts to complement his main area of expertise.

loans.use: to purchase electrical machinery for his car repair shop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who attend school. His wife works as a hairdresser, and she contributes fairly so the family can continue to be able to handle the expensive costs of life. As for Mohamad’s occupation, he works at installing and restoring satellite TV and, at the same time, he works at his town’s municipal offices to earn enough to live on. With the loan he has applied for from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will be able to procure new tools that will smooth his business operations. Mohamad’s only wish is to insure good living conditions for his family, and he is ready to do whatever it takes to achieve this.

loans.use: to procure new tools for his satellite TV business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 54-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. He works in the construction field and specializes in getting wall foliage work done. He has been involved in this domain for the past 20 years. Simultaneously, he has worked at his town’s municipality since 2010. 

It’s noticeable that Ahmad has a big family, and working at two jobs is not surprising since at this moment of time, the life expenses are becoming very pricey. Ahmad has to do no matter what to satisfy his family’s needs. 

He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth. He hopes that the loan that he is asking for from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new construction tools and supplies will help him increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to buy new construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1971 года. Она занимается своим бизнесом уже более 12 лет. Гулсара продает детские одежды и игрушки. Она торгует на местном рынке. Гулсара каждый сезон обновляет свой товар и старается, чтобы его товар привлекал больше клиентов. Гулсара мать 4 детей. Она всегда старается для того, чтобы ее дети жили в хороших условиях. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Гулсара хочет развевать свой бизнес. Она хочет купить автомашину для перевозки своего товара. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulsara is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1971. She has been engaged in her own business for more than 12 years now. Gulsara sells children's clothing and toys. She trades at a local market. Every season, Gulsara refreshes her inventory and strives for her goods to attract more customers.

Gulsara is the mother of four children. She always strives for her children to live in good conditions. Her husband helps her to run the business. Gulsara wants to develop her business. She wants to buy an automobile to transport her goods. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to purchase an automobile.

loans.use: to buy a car for her business

loans.name: Gulry

texts.ru: Гулру порядочная и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1982 году. Гулру порядочная и умная женщина. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает физику в средней школе. Она уже более 3 лет работает в средней школе. Ее коллеги очень уважают ее. Гулру воспитывает 3 детей. Ее муж очень добрый человек и всегда поддерживает ее. Гулру хочет купить мебель для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulru is a decent and cheerful woman. She was born in 1982. Gulru is a clever woman. She has a higher pedagogical education. She teaches physics in a secondary school, where she has been working for more than three years. Her colleagues respect her very much.

Gulru is raising three children. Her husband is a very kind person and always supports her. Gulru wants to buy furniture for her household, but she does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to purchase furniture.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene 30 años, es soltero, vive en casa familiar. Es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, responsable, proactivo y muy alegre. Es maestro de obras y según referencias es muy bueno en su trabajo ya que es muy detallista en los acabados. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para compra de herramientas de construcción (carretillas, esmerile, combos, cinceles, lampa y otros). En corto plazo se ha propuesto comprarse un trompo, su sueño a largo plazo es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Rafael is thirty years old. He is single and lives in his family home. He is a very hard worker and an honest, responsible, proactive, and very cheerful person. He is a master builder and his references describe him as very good at his work because of his very detailed finishings. He will use this loan to buy construction tools (wheelbarrows, sanders, chisels, shovels, hammers, hoes, and other items). His short term goal is to purchase a cement mixer, and his long term dream is to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, sanders, chisels, shovels, hammers, hoes, and other tools.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 30 years old, married with two toddler children. The family lives in the village of Manavi and in fact without a source of income.  They are dependent on parents, who live in the neighboring district.

In order to earn income on his own, Levan is requesting a loan. With the received amount, Levan will buy sixteen calves and feed for them. He will keep them in the shed located in his yard and raise them. After several months, in autumn, Levan will sell his livestock for a good price and get a good profit. 
Levan hopes that his initiative will be lucrative and he will be able to improve the standard of living for his wife and children in future.

loans.use: to buy calves and start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
For the last five years, Hannah has been running her business of selling phone accessories at Nakuru. She is 23 years old, not yet married, but is blessed with one child, aged 18 months.

To add more stock of phone accessories to her shop, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 10,000, and her plan is to use the profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan to Vision Fund Kenya and to expand her business further.

In the future, Hannah hopes to be a successful business lady and to have a very happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is 34 years old. He is married with one grade-school child. He lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He has been engaged in a sari-sari store business (convenience shop) for 10 years, and earns a monthly income of 7,000 PHP. 

Clifford requested a new loan to buy five heads of pigs to feed, as another source of income for his child's education in the near future. He really is a business minded person and a good member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy five pigs to feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, sugar, detergents, beverages, and more.

loans.name: Hülya Şenel

texts.en:
Hülya has one child, and makes a living by selling jewelry. Her niece, who also makes jewelry, encouraged and taught her about the trade. She started out with only one bag of beads. As she sold things here and there, she bought more materials to make more jewelry. While learning to make jewelry, she made use of the information from her friends, books and CD’s. She uses these as well as the internet for inspiration for her variety of designs. 

She took her first loan from Kiva 10 years ago. With that loan, she bought materials, and in turn gained capital, thus increasing her earnings. In the summer, she was able to sell a good amount of products from her seaside stall. As of now, she no longer has the materials to produce her jewelry, and would like the loan to buy goods to create more jewelry. 

If she is able to gain more profit, her biggest dream is to open up her own shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff: 

Hülya Hanımın 1 çocuğu var.  Bir şeyler yapıp kazanç elde etmek istiyordu.  Yeğeni takı işi yapıyordu.  Hülya Hanımı da  teşvik etti ve öğretti.  İlk başlangıçta bir poşet boncukla başladı.  Küçük küçük satışlar yapıp kazancıyla boncuk alıp tekrardan yapıp satıyordu.  Takı yaparken arkadaşlarından, kitaplardan, CD lerden faydalandı.  Buralardan takı çeşitlerine ve yapımına bakıp  takılar yaptı.  Şimdi internetten bakıp  çeşitlerini arttırıyor.  Bundan on sene önce mayadan  ilk kredisini aldı.  Aldığı kredi ile çok malzeme alıp sermaye yaptı ve kazancını arttırdı.  Yazın sahilde kurduğu tezgahtan daha çok satış yapıyor.  Geçimini sattığı takılar ile sağlıyor.  Elinde malzemesi kalmadı.  Aldığı kredi ile boncuk,çeşitli taşlar ve diğer takı malzemeleri alıp çeşidini arttıracak ve daha çok kazanç elde edecek.  İşini büyütüp daha çok kazanç elde etmek ve takı üzerine bir dükkan açmak en büyük hayali.

loans.use: to buy goods to create more jewelry.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: 34-year-old Rachel lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Hers is the second most  populous county in Liberia. She did not go to school, and she has lived in Sanniquellie all her life. She is married traditionally, and her husband is a security guard. They have four children together, between 3 to 10 years old. All four of her children are in school, and they all live at home. With a little money from her husband, she was able to establish her table business four years ago, where she sells such items as onions, Vita seasoning and salt.
