She spends 12 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is her limited  income. She is applying for a loan to buy more onions, Vita, salt, and similar items for her business. Her plan is to build a shop. She thanks the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more onions, vita seasoning, salt, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 47 years old, and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. Nimba County is rich in natural resources, and the living condition is much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County is the second-largest populated county in Liberia. 

Kou did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqiulle. She is divorced and has four children from 15 to 28 years old. All of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

She was able to establish her table business for her farm products ten years ago, and sells rice by the cup. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. 

Her plan is to expand her business and educate her children. Thank you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Minisiah

texts.en:
This is 28 year old Minisiah. She lives in Sanniquille which is the capital City of Nimba County.   Nimba County is the second largest populated county in Liberia, is rich in natural resources, and has better living conditions than in the capital city.

She did not go to school and has lived all her life in this rural area.  Minisiah is unmarried and has two children ages 5 months and 2 years old. She sold bananas for her mother and therefore managed to established her business. For three years she has run a table in the local market to sell rice, pepper, oil, salt, etc. Minisiah spends 12 hours each day at her business. Currently, she has few goods on her table and would would like a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

Her plan is to one day send her children to school and increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат жизнерадостная и активная женщина, у неё имеется четверо детей. Она вышла замуж очень рано, и поэтому не смогла продолжить обучение после окончания средней школы. Поэтому она имеет среднее образование. Так как Малохат со своей семьёй живут в сельской местности, она смогла найти работу только в сельском хозяйстве.  И вот уже как 10 лет она работает сельхоз работницей. С недавних пор она стала сотрудничать с Арванд, первый раз получив кредит на потребительские нужды. Сейчас Малохат хочет сделать капитальный ремонт своего дома, потому что дом пришёл в негодное состояние. И для этого ей необходимы денежные средства, а того, что она смогла накопить от своих доходов недостаточно. Поэтому она в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Малохат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Malohat is a cheerful and active women, and she has four children.  She married very early, and therefore could not continue her education after finishing secondary school.  Thus, she does not have a higher education.  Because Malohat and her family live in a rural area, she could only find work in agriculture, and she has been working for 10 years in this field.  Not long ago she began working with Arvand, the first time receiving a loan for consumer needs.  Because her house has fallen into a state of disrepair, Malohat now hopes to make repairs to her house.  The money she has saved from her salary is not enough to pay for the repairs, so she needs additional sources of funds.  For this reason, she turned once again to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to purchase building materials to repair her home.  Malohat thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Lyantonde Twimukye Group

texts.en: Jovanis is a single mother of five children who has seen them through school and provided for their basic needs using income from selling groceries. Jovanis buys groceries from the farmers and sells to upscale people in Lyantonde. Jovanis thanks the group members for standing by each other and the Kiva lenders for partnering with the group. Jovanis is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in the Christmas  season.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is an accomplished artist and painter in Peru. He wants to purchase painting supplies such as oils and canvas, and framing supplies (including tools and wood) to stretch his own canvases and craft his own frames.

Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I've drawn and painted since childhood and I haven't found a better way to express myself than through my art. I'm concerned with the dignity of Peruvian identity and the equity that by natural law is deserved in honor of peace and happiness. Cuzco is the root of my essential motivation. My painting identifies with my country's beauty, and that beauty must be understood for its singularity and seen in the light of a country with its own language."

"I'm very grateful for your support, as I'll be able to create new works of art as well as to cut and craft my own stretchers and frames. In this way, I hope to give you a greater selection of original paintings. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Fernando's portraits and religious paintings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1642

loans.use: to purchase painting supplies (oils and canvas) and framing supplies (wood and tools) to craft his own frames.

loans.name: Telson Misael

texts.es: Telson Misael mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, el turismo, es propietario de un negocio de compra venta de cerdos en pie,y en algunas ocasiones compra cerdos en desarrollo , los cuales compra al contado en comarcas aledañas a su hogar, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie que se los vende cómodamente y aprovechar las ventas, Telson agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Telson Misael is of legal age, and he is married with two minor children. He is from the municipality of Chinandega, an area located within the western part of the country, where trade and tourism predominate. 

He owns a business selling pigs, and occasionally he makes cash purchases of “growing pigs” from regions near his home. 
 
The purpose of this loan is to purchase live pigs that are easily sold, and take advantage of the sales. 

Telson is very thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have limited economic resources.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of live pigs.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Azimjon is a hardworking man. He has been in the agricultural business since the year 2010. He feeds cattle at his home. Azimjon feeds cows. He has additional income from growing wheat. He works hard but his income is not enough for living. 

He is a well-bread person and has a good knowledge as he was one of the best pupils at the school. His parents were poor and that’s why he couldn’t go on to get higher education. He has always dreamed of being a high degree person. 

Azimjon is going to increase the number of cattle he feeds. He has acquired a loan of 2000 TJS to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mirembe

texts.en: Mirembe is married with four children and two of her children go to school.  She doesn't care for additional family members. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for 20 years.  She has applied for a loan of 1200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.  She works from home seven days a week and sells retail every day.  She generates additional income from plaiting people's hair.  Her major business challenges includes seasonality and on- and off-electricity.  She aspires to own a bridal salon and also to buy a generator to assist when power is off.  She decided to join MCDT- SACCO because of she wanted to acquire additional capital.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, paying for utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers,wevaes and braids.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 20 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing, honest and humble. She operates a business where she runs a quarry and she sells building stones. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are house builders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Mary will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add to her stock of building stones to sell. Her business goal is to open another quarry within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will finish building her house. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. She also sells poultry to earn more income .She will use the anticipated profits to add to the stock of poultry in her poultry business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of  building stones to sell

loans.name: Uaminifu Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwavita, membre du groupe Uamimifu est cliente de Hekima depuis plus de 3ans. Agée de 40 ans, elle est mariée à un commerçant et mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Vendeuse au marché central, elle  sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  10 dizaines de fût  vide pour revendre par la suite.  Son objectif est de loué un endroit plus spacieux pour la croissance de son activité et remercie Hekima pour son appui aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Mrs. Mwavita, a member of the Uamimfu group, has been a client of Hekima for over three years. 40 years old, she is married to a vendor and has five children, all of whom are in school. She sells at the central market. She is seeking this loan to buy 10 dozens of empty kegs for resale. Her goal is to rent a more spacious sales stand to increase her activity. She thanks Hekima for its support of low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozens of empty kegs.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more detergent for her soap-making business. She also operates a cereal-selling business.
  
She would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000, to buy more stocks of beans and maize for resale. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs . She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en: Decontee is 24 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has a 4-year-old child who is attending school. For past few years she been selling rice, oil, and charcoal. Some of her major problems she is faced with are fewer customers during the wet season and her inventory is very low. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal. She hopes to build her house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 33 years old and lives in West Point. She is married with two children ages 2 and 11, both attending school. Aisha has been known to most of her community's members as a very powerful business woman who sells chicken feet. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken feet for her business. She hopes to send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feet for her business,

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth (women's wrap) for resale

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 43 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between 14 and 26, who are currently in school. For the past two years, she has been selling cold Kool-aid and soft drinks. She normally doesn’t make a lot of money during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase Kool-aid and soft drinks for her business. She plans to build her own house in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase Koolaid and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo 2 western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 8 children. In 2009, Salamatu established a fish business. She began her business because she wants to create income for her survival. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and a proper business location.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future Salamatu plans to expand her fish business more than even. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran, age 32, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 2 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 51 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Zahida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zahida has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Zahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Al-Hudda Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Hudda Group, is made up of six women from Sana`a, Yemen. They are heads of households and they got together with the idea of helping their families. Their community is in a rural area surrounded b a field and they have many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 450,000 YER. 
Huda is 38 years old. For many years, Huda has been embroidering cloth and selling it, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. Huda`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She says that she always has many orders from her customers, especially because she offers good quality in her embroidery work and it is not very expensive.
She is receiving a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to fulfill existing orders for her customers. She would like to purchase fabric, needles, and other items. In the future, she would like to achieve her potential by opening an embroidery shop where she can distribute her goods to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, and other items in order to fulfill existing orders for her customers.

loans.name: Walter Juan

texts.es: Don Walter, es un señor de bajos recursos económicos, que labora como operario de limpieza en una institución del estado, su esposa es ama de casa quien se ocupa del orden del hogar solamente, el  mantiene los gastos del hogar y los de su hija que tiene bajo su cargo quien está estudiando, la meta del Sr. Walter es garantizarle a su hija una carrera universitaria para que se pueda defender sola. El solicita este crédito para construir un anexo en su vivienda lo que le facilitara mayor espacio para la comodidad familiar, esto será posible gracias al financiamiento que le brinda la facilidad de pagar en cuotas pequeñas, lo que le permite organizarse bien en sus gastos mensuales.
texts.en: Walter is a low-income gentleman who works as a janitor for a state agency. His wife is a homemaker who works only in the home. He covers their household expenses and supports their daughter, who is in school. Walter's goal is to secure a college education for his daughter so that she can fend for herself. He is requesting this loan in order to build an addition to his house, which will create more space for his family to live comfortably. This will be possible because this financing offers him easy payments and low installments, which allows him to organize his monthly expenses.

loans.use: to buy quarry stone, iron, blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Bibihadas

texts.ru: Бибихадас 43 года. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Бибихадас воспитывает свою дочь, которой 19 лет сама, так как ее муж умер в 1996 году. После смерти мужа, она нуждалась в деньгах и поэтом она начала свой бизнес пчеловодством. Ее братья помогли ей организовать бизнес и до сих пор помогают ей по введению бизнеса. Бибихадас имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания картошки и ореха. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому целый год она работает упорно, то есть подготовка, сбор урожая, сезон продажи полученного урожая требует от нее огромных сил. Она живет в старом доме, поэтому она строит новый дом. Бибихадас должна сделать крышу, но не имеет денег для покупки шифера. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bibihadas is 43 years old.  She is a hardworking and cheerful woman.  Her husband passed away in 1996, so Bibihadas is raising her 19-year old daughter alone.  She needed money after the death of her husband, and so started her own beekeeping business.  Her brothers helped her organize her business and to this day help her run the business.  Bibhadas receives additional income from growing potatoes and walnuts.  She is a very hardworking woman and works hard all year long - there is the planting, the harvest, and then the sales season after the harvest - all of which require tremendous energy from her.  She lives in an old house, and is thus building a new one.  Bibhadas needs to build a roof, but she doesn't have enough money to purchase slate.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase slate.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy slate to build a roof for her house

loans.name: Nafiou

texts.fr: Nafiou homme de 28ans est boucher de profession. Il a démarré l'activité en 2005 et s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de se prendre en charge. Pour la bonne marche de son activité, il fait un premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des bœufs afin de revendre. Il souhaite agrandir l'activité et se lancer plus tard dans la vie familiale.
texts.en: Nafiou is a 28 year old man and a butcher by profession. He started his business in 2005 and enjoys it a lot because it allows him to take care of himself. So that his business may run well, he is taking his first loan from WAGES to buy some oxen in order to resell them. He wishes to grow his business and later to start a family.

loans.use: to purchase oxen

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, madame Ayaba souhaite élargir son activité en vendant des variétés de pagnes. Activité qu'elle mène depuis 2012. Elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique et assurer le bien être de la famille. Âgée de 27ans, elle est mariée.
texts.en: As the end-of-year holidays approach, Ms. Ayaba would like to enlarge her business selling a variety of traditional cloths (pagnes). She has run this business since 2012. She wishes to open a boutique and assure the well-being of her family. At 27 years old, she is married.

loans.use: to purchase traditional West African cloths (pagnes).

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married with four children. Lily is 52 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.
Lily  is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Lily hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old. She is married and has two high-school and one grade school students. She lives in Lusot Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a laborer who is striving for children's tuition and daily consumption.

Elsa has been engage in coconut farming business for 11 years, earning a monthly income of 3,500 PHP. Elsa requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers for coconuts. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2001.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is a 28-year-old married woman and a resident of Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. 

She earns extra income from her buy and sell business. Analisa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and enjoys the membership privileges of the Cooperative. She is applying for a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase items to increase the inventory of her buy and sell business. Additional inventory would increase her  income and help her to meet the needs of her family. She wants adequate income to provide her family with a decent and comfortable lifestyle. 

Analisa wishes to continue being a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and repay her obligation in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase items to increase the inventory of her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Exon

texts.es: Exon, tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive en casa familiar. Es un joven emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente tiene un restaurant de venta de Pollos a la brasa en una avenida céntrica de su ciudad. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para compra de insumos (pollo, papas y otros) y compra de utensilios (platos, tenedores, vasos y otros) ya que la demanda crece por Fiestas Navideñas. Su sueño es poder construir su casa y ser un empresario prospero de su ciudad.
texts.en: Exon is twenty years old, single, and lives in his family home. He is an enterprising young man who is very driven to get ahead. He currently has a restaurant where he sells charbroiled chickens, located on a main avenue in his city. He will use this loan to buy supplies (chicken, potatoes, and other ingredients) and  utensils (plates, forks, cups, and other items), because demand increases during the Christmas holidays. His dreams are to be able to build his own house and to become a successful local businessman.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chicken and potatoes, and utensils like plates, forks, cups, and other items.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is 59 years old and is married. 

In 2011, Bernarda applied for membership with PMPC because of all the benefits it would offer. She is a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Bernarda is asking for a 14,900 PHP loan to buy more goods for her sari-sari store (general store). She hopes to increase her  income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and gives her heart-felt thanks.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her sari-sari store (general store) business

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
A resident of Oroquieta City, Rhodora, 46, is a happily married mother of two children. She vends nutritious food in nearby places and schools and has a rice-retailing enterprise as well to sustain their financial needs. 

Rhodora is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy additional ingredients for snacks and viand preparation. She wishes to expand her business with PMPC as her constant help.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for snacks and viand preparation

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, in the Philippines. He is 77 years old, and he is married. 

In the year 2000, Genaro became a member in PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, he never hesitated to join. He maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays his obligations in a timely manner. Even at his age now, Genaro is still an active member of PMPC.

Recently, Genaro has asked financial assistance of PHP 10,000 to buy more goods for his sari-sari store (a general store) business. Through this, he hopes to increase his income and be of help in the expansion of his business.  

He has found assistance for his financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and he is very thankful.  With all his heart.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 27 years old and lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. 

For the past year, she has been selling fish in the local market. She described herself as a hardworking woman. She is a seventh grade dropout, and has three children between 2 and 9 years old. Only two of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

She got a little money from her mother to establish her table business one year ago. She sells for 12 hours each day at her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is a small income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 40 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County.   This county, the second most populated in Liberia, is rich in natural resources and has better living conditions than the capital city of Liberia. 

She did not go to school and she 6 children between 11 and 21 years old.  Five children attend school. 

She started her business with money from her savings and for three years, she has sold items such as rice, palm oil, vita, and pepper. She spends 12 hours at her business. She has insufficient income and requests a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, and pepper for her business. 

Her plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 37 years old, and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better there than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county. She is a seventh grade dropout, and has rice and soap. Traditionally she is unmarried, and her fiancé is a motor bike driver. They have three children between 7 and 18, only two of whom are in school. They all live at home. With a little money from her fiancé she was able to establish her provision shop business ten years ago, where she sells palm oil, salt, pepper, soap, rice, etc. She spends eight hours per day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods mentioned above for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as palm oil, salt, pepper, soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Las Señoras De Lucumo Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” conformado por 06 mujeres que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Apolonia de 57 años casada con 01 independiente. Con los deseos de mejorar su situación económica decide emprender su negocio, la cual hace más de 10 años que cuenta con una bodega en su vivienda. Los créditos de Edaprospo la han ayudado a mejorar cada vez  su negocio. Con el fin de seguir progresando solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. A futuro le gustaría vender al por mayor sus productos. El grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.   Apolonia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa rosada y polo celeste.
texts.en:
The "Las Señoras de Lúcumo" (The Ladies of Lúcumo) communal outreach group is made up of six women who look to improve themselves each day. This is the story of 57-year-old Apolonia. She is married and has one child dependent of her. With a desire to improve her economic circumstances she decided to start a business. She has now had a small store at her home for over ten years. 

The loans from Edaprospo have helped her to improve her business each day. With the purpose of continuing her progress, she requested a loan to buy groceries, drinks and snacks. In the future she would like to sell products in bulk. "The Ladies of Lúcumo" group is thankful for the people who are making this loan possible. Apolonia is the second from the left and is wearing a pink jacket and sky blue polo.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Unidos Para Trabajar Group

texts.es: Analizet  de 22 años de edad soltera  y madre de 1 hijo, Analizet   tiene una pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace un  1 año. Analizet ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de belleza  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio (cosméticos) Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  Analizet  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Analizet Se le distingue por su chompa de color verde(turquesa) se encuentra a la mano derecha al costado de la señora que lleva en brazos un bebe,la sra.EMMA y el sr. NILTON no estuvieron presentes en la foto por motivo de trabajo y adjunto la foto de ambos. Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Analizet is twenty-two years old, single, and the mother of one child. She has had a small cosmetic sales business for one year. Analizet has come to gain her customers' loyalty; this has provided her with the earnings to cover home expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own business site where she could sell her beauty products and have higher earnings. With this loan, she will buy more cosmetic products for her business to continue satisfying customer demand. In this way, she will be able to get ahead. Analizet and the rest of the group members are grateful to Kiva for the loan as well as the faith that they have placed in them. Analizet is the member in the turquoise sweater to the right of the lady with a baby in her arms. Emma and Nilton were no present for the group photo due to work, which is why they both appear in the accompanying photo. Analizet promises that she will reach all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a single man with three children. He describes himself as a person with potential. He operates a transportion business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one year. 

His business is located in a high potential area and his primary customers are local. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

Bonface will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel. His business goal is to expand within five years. 
His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to create employment. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be honest and trustworthy. 

He operates a retail business where he sells electrical and hardware items like paintbrushes, taps, water closet parts, nails and other items. His business is located in a busy area with lots of customers. His primary customers are regular customers, mostly those involved in house construction. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation of materials. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy stock of electronics, brushes, nails and other items he sells in his shop. 

His business goal is to be able to supply all types of building materials within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children up to university level. 

This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 100,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy stock of electronics, brushes, nails and other items.

loans.name: Artia

texts.en:
Artia is 29 years old and married, with two children.

Artia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, cereals, snack foods, shampoo, and coffee.

Artia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and she also earns an income from direct-selling Avon products.

Artia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, cereals, snack foods, shampoo, and coffee.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 28-year-old, hard-working man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has dealt in a produce business since 2010, a business he started, so as to raise income, to look after his children and other dependents. His desire is to build a permanent house for his family and to become a leading supplier of produce in his area.

Denis is asking for a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 52 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Koo

texts.en:
Please meet 41-year-old Koo, who lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. Nimba County is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County is the second-largest populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, but she manages her business well. She has lived all her life in a rural area. She is married, and her husband is not working. They have five children between the ages of 8 to 23 years. Only two are in school, and they all live at home. 

For six years now, she has been running a table where she sells oil, pepper, and salt in the local market. She spends eight hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business. 

Her plan is to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 36 years old and married, with three children. She runs a beauty salon material business in Wara Wara, a Northern area of Sierra Leone. She is very business orientated and began her business to develop herself.

She has been in the business of running a hair dressing salon since 2000.  Her business is her only source of income. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital and the high cost of rent.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchases hair relaxer, hair cream and weave for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxer, hair cream and weave for resale.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo2, Western rural area, in Freetown. She is married with two children. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 2010, Mamusu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to contribute to taking care of the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem within her operation area.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 37 year-old vigorous lady. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she can generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with five children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2001, Kadiatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to educate her children. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation in the market.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area; she’s married and her husband is a security guard. They have three children aged between 10 and 19, all of whom live at home. For the past two years Beatrice has been preparing and selling cooked food. She started the business with help from her husband.

What she likes about this business is selling to customers. She has requested this loan to purchase cooking ingredients (peppers, oil, salt, onions, rice, fish). In the future she would like to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients (peppers, oil, salt, onions, rice, and fish).

loans.name: Rahma Group

texts.en:
This group is called, Rahma Group. It consists of four members who reside in Hodiedah, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to boost their businesses. They have requested a group loan of YER 80,000. 

The group's representative is Rahma. She is 29 years old and a married woman.  She works to cover the different household expenses. To help meet the different needs of the family, she has been selling women's clothes for many years. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from the city market. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, she is asking for a loan of YER 20,000 from AMB to buy women's fabrics, perfumes, etc. She hopes to expand her business, to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy women's fabrics, perfumes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 45, is a married woman. She is the mother of two children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a painter by profession. He has been providing painting services to the people of his community and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

For the improvement of her son’s business, Razia applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. It will help him to purchase good-quality brushes of different sizes along with buckets of white paint. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality brushes of different sizes along with buckets of white paint.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. A year ago she started up a poultry business as her husband’s income is insufficient to bear their household expenditures alone. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to build a shed roof for her chickens and to purchase a stock of feed. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for her chickens and to purchase a stock of feed.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Lirios” está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo. Este es el caso de Yury de 28 años casada con 03 hijos aún dependientes. Hace 05 años que se dedica a la venta de condimentos. Actualmente le va bien, pues dicho negocio le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de sustancias, frutas secas, canela, ajíes, entre otros productos. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Los Lirios” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, ya que permite su progreso. Yury se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo azul con chaleco y en brazos lleva a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Lirios" is made up of 6 entrepreneurial partners who have improved their businesses over time. This is has been the case for Yury who is 28 years old and has 3 dependent children. Yury is in the back row of the picture, first on the right, wearing a blue shirt and a vest. She is holding her youngest son in her arms.

Five years ago, Yury began selling condiments. Today her business is doing well and it has allowed her to improve her economic situation. She requested a loan to purchase broth, dried fruit, cinnamon and peppers, among other products. Her greatest desire is to continue running her business. 

The "Los Lirios" group is grateful to the people who make this loan possible because it will support their advancement.

loans.use: to purchase broths, dried fruits, cinnamon and peppers.

loans.name: Mercedes Gregoria

texts.es:
Mercedes Gregoria mayor de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, ademas es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como: ropa, calzado, cosméticos, ampliaciones de fotografías, utensilios para cocina, productos plásticos y otros, ella realiza compras en otro departamentos del país y en distribuidores mayoristas del municipio de Chinandega, dicha mercadería la vende de forma ambulante estilo cortero para lo cual cuenta con tres personas que se encargan de distribuir la mercadería en sitios rurales y algunos urbanos. inicia su negocio  con capital propio, el cual poco a poco ha logrado incrementar sus demandas, hoy en día ella desea construir un anexo para nuevos negocios que en un futuro no muy lejano lo conseguirá, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en su negocio como: cosméticos, ropa, calzado, productos plásticos entre otros,  por lo que en este mes las ventas son altas lo que le permitirá incrementar su clientela e ingresos.
Mejorar mi casa y ampliar a mas líneas mi negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes Gregoria is a married adult with three adult children. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement. She is also a small business owner who makes her living in the marketing of general merchandise such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, photo enlargements, kitchen utensils, and plastic products, etc.

She does her purchasing in other parts of the country and with the wholesale distributors in the municipality of Chinandega. She sells this merchandise as a walking salesperson often selling on credit. She has three people who are responsible for distributing goods in rural areas as well as some urban areas. She started her business with her own capital, which has gradually been able to increase her demands. Today she wants to build an annex for new businesses that she will gain in the near future. The purpose of this funding is to invest in working capital in her business for example: cosmetics, clothing, footwear, plastic products, etc. so that this month's sales are high enough to allow her to grow her clientele and income and help her improve her home and add more product lines to her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, footwear, clothing, and plastic products etc.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Ángeles mayor de edad casada con tres hijos  menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y de buenos modales, lo cual le ha ayudado para salir adelante, Maria es una microempresaria propietaria de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, plátanos maduros, golosinas, cebollas, tomates, chiltomas, papel higiénicos, cosméticos, shampoo, productos congelados como:pollo, carne, embutidos, entre otros, este negocio lo inicia con capital propio al ver la necesidad de los habitantes de su comunidad que tenían que viajar desde muy largo para realizar las compras para su hogar, el cual le llena de satisfacción el poder ayudar a su comunidad,el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir y surtir su pulperia, como: arroz, azúcar, aceite,jugos, pan, sopas maggi, golosinas, café, shampoo, entre otros y así aprovechar que viene las ventas de diciembre que son mas alta de esa manera podrá ofrecer variedades de productos y mejor calidad a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos realizados en todos unos profesionales y brindarles un techo digno donde vivir.-
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married with three minor children. She is from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is known to be a hard worker, and an honest, responsible, and polite woman, which has helped her get ahead. Maria is a microentrepreneur and owns a grocery store where she sells household staples like rice, sugar, beans, oil, bananas, sweets, onions, tomatoes, peppers, toilet paper, cosmetics, shampoo, frozen foods loke chicken, meat, sausages, and other products. She started this business with her own capital when she saw the need of the residents in her community, who had to travel long distances to do their grocery shopping. Being able to help her community fills her with satisfaction.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in her grocery store and stock up on rice, sugar, oil, juices, bread, dry soup mixes, sweets, coffee, shampoo, and other items. This will allow her to make the most of December sales, which are higher, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products and higher quality items.

One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals and to give them a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to buy household products like basic grains, frozen foods, and other items.

loans.name: Ekue

texts.fr: Ekue vit avec sa femme et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Il a appris comme profession la soudure à l'arc et l'exerce depuis 1990. Il espère aménager son atelier c'est pour cela, il sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son atelier et d'assurer l'avenir de la famille. Il est âgé de 48ans.
texts.en: Ekue lives with his wife and their three children in Lomé. He learned arc welding as his profession and has practiced it since 1990. He hopes to develop his workshop, and for this reason he is asking for his first loan from WAGES. The profit will allow him to increase the size of his workshop and assure the future of his family. He is 48 years old.

loans.use: to develop his workshop.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 56-year-old married woman living in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines.

For the past 6 years, Luciana has earned additional income through raising pigs. She requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and other agricultural/veterinary supplies.

Luciana has been a member of PMPC since 2009. In the future, she wants to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other agricultural/veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo, like his brother Víctor (another Biobolsa user), is trying to reduce costs of his small farm. His income is based on the success of his dairy farm. Currently, he adds value to his dairy milk by producing yogurt; a product that he can earn more money on than selling unprocessed milk. Unfortunately, the process is energy-intensive, and Gerardo is spending too much money on expensive, fossil-fuel based propane as his primary fuel source. 

Using the "waste" from his dairy cows, his 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will provide him with a clean, renewable fuel source - methane-rich biogas - which he will then use to replace the propane he currently uses. 

The system will also produce potent biofertilizer, allowing him to improve his crop yields without having to spend more money on agrochemical fertilizer. Gerardo will both save money and help the environment. This loan represents 90% of the total cost of his biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.en:
Víctor, a farmer from the small Mexican state of Morelos, is always studying ways to improve his farm, both economically and ecologically. His investment in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester fits perfectly with his vision. Using his biodigester, he will be able to more effectively use the "waste" on his farm - the abundant manure produced daily - and turn it into two valuable resources: fuel and fertilizer.

The biodigester will convert the organic material into renewable, methane-rich biogas and potent biofertilizer, allowing him to reduce his dependence on expensive, fossil-fuel based propane and agrochemical fertilizer.

His family will use the biogas domestically to cook and heat bathwater. He will save money and reduce the environmental impact of his farm - a win-win situation. This loan represents 90% of the total cost of his biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is a 69-year-old hardworking woman from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with three children who are all now married.  

For 20 years, Floreta and her husband have been engaged in growing rice, vegetables and root crops from which they earn their living. An active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing, she enjoys the privilege of being a member of the Cooperative and is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase farm fertilizers.

Floreta deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and always repays her obligations in a timely manner. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is married with one child. Lucita is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin. Lucita sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Lucita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Lucita hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Budeehuu

texts.en:
Budeehuu is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Bayarmaa is 39 years old and runs their family organic food business from a rental stall in the local market. Their three children study at local public schools. 

Budeehuu started their family business in 2000 as organic salt producers and sold at the local market. They are now running an organic food business in which his wife imports food from Russia. She also sells also domestically grown vegetables and fruits. 

Budeehuu is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of food to sell at his rental stall for Lunar New Year. 

He is a hardworking, responsible, and diligent man who has a good previous loan record at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell at his rental stall for Lunar New Year

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, a 4-year-old and a 6-year-old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics like televisions, radios, and speakers. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

Dan's business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changing tastes and preferences of customers. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to add to his stock of electronics. His business goal is to own a larger shop within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest in the business and pay back the loan.

Dan hopes that in the future, he will have an economically sustainable business.

loans.use: to add to his stock of electronics

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as God-fearing and ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to transport customers. This will enable him to transport customers faster and also travel long distances. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable and have an income-generating project. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 15,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a retail business for his wife.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to transport customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in alcohol distilling, selling milk, and banana growing to earn extra income. She started this business in 2004 with an aim of looking after her children after the death of her husband.

She is challenged by the dry season, whereby her production output is reduced. She hopes to become a leading milk producer in her town.

Mary has asked for the loan to buy a heifer for milk production.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for milk production.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Monina has been in this business for 20 years. Monina earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with two children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 24 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials like peanuts, sugar, wrappers, etc. for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for a year. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials like peanuts, sugar and wrappers for her business.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 50 years old and a mother of four children. Currently, her four children still rely on her. Two of them are in school while the remaining two are too young to go to school.

The main sources of income for her family are from rice farming and sesame planting on two hectares for each. 

Now, Sopheap has formed a group of four to obtain a new loan. With a successful repayment of their past loan, she and two fellow group members are in a fifth loan cycle while a remaining borrower is in her fourth cycle. All of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting fees, to buy insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting, labor and insecticide.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 41 years old and she lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the ages of 19 and 21 and all of them attend school. 

Hawa has been operating a shop where she sells drinks (soda, beer, and energy drinks) and other provisions. One of her main challenges is that she can’t keep up with the demands of her customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, and energy drinks) and other provisions for her business. 

In the future, Hawa hopes to sell her drinks by wholesale and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, and energy drinks) and other provisions for her business.

loans.name: Byonna Biva Gyoli Group

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man with four children, two of whom go to school. He is a farmer and grows mostly fruits and greens which he supplies to the markets on their maturity. He also runs a retail shop which has increased his incomes. 

He borrowed 800,000 UGX in order to buy more seeds and use the season.

He is so honest and hardworking. He loves farming because that’s where he earns the most income. His dream is to borrow more money and buy a small car to be able to ease his transport costs.

The sixth person at the extreme right in black is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is being photographed here with her husband Andon in a variety store that they have been running as a family business for almost ten years. 

Andon needs eye surgery immediately; this is what the loan that Fatime is requesting will be used for. 

Here is what Andon said during the interview: “Doctors have told me that I need surgery immediately, before my eyesight goes away completely and this will happen soon, if I have no money to take care of this procedure. I would very much appreciate any financial help from lenders.”

loans.use: to pay for an urgent eye operation for her husband before he goes completely blind.

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: Sara Biviana mayor de edad casada con siete hijos todos independientes, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal como laboral, esta microempresaria se dedica a la compra venta de ropa usada y nueva como: pantalones, zapatos, faldas, camisetas, vestidos, calcetines, short, negocio el cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante y en su domicilio, ofrece sus productos al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos los cuales recupera quincenalmente su inversión, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano finalizando al caer la tarde, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar sus casa de habitación, al igual que incrementar mas su negocio, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para reforzar su capital de trabajo en la compra de calidad de pacas  de ropa y ropa nueva como: zapatos, variedades estilos de ropa en trajes para niños, damas y caballero y de esa manera aprovechar las ventas en este mes de diciembre que son mayores los cuales ya cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes. Sara agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Sara Biviana is an older married woman who has seven children who live on their own.  She's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Sara's known for being an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman who very much wants to improve herself personally and professionally.  This small businesswoman makes a living selling used and new clothing: pants, shoes, skirts, t-shirts, dresses, socks, and shorts.  She carries out her business on foot and at home, selling products to steady customers for cash and credit, which she collects biweekly.  Sara begins her work day very early and finishes at the end of the afternoon.

The goal of this new loan is to strengthen her working capital with a quality purchase of bundles of clothing and new clothing such as shoes and a variety of styles of outfits for men, women, and children.  This way Sara will make the most of the major sales in the month of December, because she has several customer requests. 

Sara's grateful for the support that Kiva lenders give to low-income people.  One of her dreams is to be able to improve her home; she also wants to expand her business more.

loans.use: to buy bundles of high-quality clothing and new clothing

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es: El señor Fidel tiene 28 años y es soltero el tiene la actividad  de técnico en computadoras tiene su negocio ubicado en la zona La Merced,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, va a usar este préstamo para compra de material para su trabajo tarjetas, lectores cases para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de materiales para su trabajo ya que también realiza un trabajo de instalación de un internet y también quiere vender cpus para tener una ganancia. El señor Fidel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tiene que ser bueno en su trabajo para que también le contraten y le busquen, en otra también compite con otros técnicos que tienen un precio más barato pero también tiene conocimientos de software va a utilizar los beneficios para tener un capital de arranque para poder ahorrar y abrir un internet que este es su sueño y poder tener también allí su oficina donde atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fidel, 28, is single and works as a computer technician.  His business is located in the La Merced area.

This is Fidel's first loan sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy materials for his business: memory cards, readers, and cases.  He's requesting this loan because he lacks the cash to buy materials for work.  He's doing an Internet installation job and also wants to sell CPUs to make a profit.

The challenge Fidel faces in his business is being good in his job so customers will hire him and seek him out.  Another challenge is competition with other technicians who have lower prices.  He also is knowledgable about software, however.

Fidel's going to use his profits to have start-up capital to save money and open an Internet café, which is his dream.  He also wants to be able to have an office there to tend to his customers.

loans.use: to buy memory cards, readers, and cases

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una comerciante innata, heredó el gusto por las ventas que caracterizaba a su padre; por ello, hace aproximadamente 12 años inició su labor como comerciante independiente, vendiendo alimentos fritos en la acera de su casa, luego comenzó a vender mercancía y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio y cada día aumentaba el número de clientes, en vista de los buenos resultados decidió abrir una miscelánea y además vende blusas que ella misma confecciona. 
Con el fin de fortalecer el negocio, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para la temporada navideña (artículos de decoración, instalaciones eléctricas, entre otros) para aprovechar el incremento de la demanda en esta época del año, así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y podrá vender más, mejorando los ingresos.
María manifiesta que su propósito para un futuro a corto plazo, es ampliar su negocio, aumentar el inventario de productos y generar oportunidades de empleo, esto le permitirá mejorar la rentabilidad y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para disfrutar al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
María is natural born businesswoman. She inherited a talent for sales that defined her father. Hence, about 12 years ago she started working as an independent businesswoman, selling fried food on the sidewalk of her home, then started selling merchandise and little by little her business grew and increased the number of customers each day. Considering the good results, she decided to open a general store where she also sells blouses that she makes herself.

In order to strengthen the business, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the Christmas season (home furnishings, electronics, among others) in order to capitalize on the increased demand at this time of year so that she will have the ability to satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers and be able sell more, improving revenues.

María states that her goal for the short-term future is to expand her business, increase product inventory and generate employment opportunities. This will allow her to improve profitability and be able to have a better quality of life to enjoy alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season (home furnishings, electronics, etc.)

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 49 years old and lives in Becor,Taboo,Jimenez. She is married with four children. 
She does not have a business and is a housewife. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials.
Anecita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Anecita hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Jovely

texts.en:
Jovely is 29 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City: Philippines. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they have one child. She owns a sari-sari store. Jovely and her husband have a transportation business and they earn approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy a side car for her husband's motorcycle. 

Jovely is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Jovely and her husband hope to provide for their daily needs and wish for a good education for their child.

loans.use: to buy a side car for a motorcycle

loans.name: Marites Group

texts.en:
A resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Marites is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. For almost 20 years Marites has been growing corn, an activity that helps her to support her family, especially the education of her children. She earns PHP 8000 per cropping. 

A new member of PMPC, Marites is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers to enhance her corn production. She hopes that she can have another business by 2014 with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn production.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita works hard to support her family. Mercidita is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Mercidita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Mercidita has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mercidita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he uses his bicycle to transport customers. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are regular customers. 

David describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting his customers. This will enable him to transport his customers faster and also to travel longer distances. His business goal is to have two motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo.   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales  . El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He hopes with this loan to purchase some pigs plus the feed required to fatten them. 

What Carlos intends is to augment the number of his animals. He wants to have his pigs at an ideal weight when it's time to sell them in the local market and nearby areas. Carlos wishes to generate as much earnings as he can for his and his family's wellbeing, and to expand his animal-raising business. 

This is Carlos' first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has received no previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with all facilities and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is from Yerevan. He owns a car which he use as a taxi. Ruben lives with his mother and two children, ages 10 and 13 years old.

He has applied for this loan to install a gas fuel system on his car. This will help him to use the car more effectively and gather more income. 

Ruben has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

He hopes for lenders' support, and the loan is very important to him.

loans.use: to pay for installation of a gas fuel system on the car

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Ederlinda has been in this business for 40 years. Ederlinda earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Analiza has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one childr, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 42 years old and has five children. Angelita is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children further in school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 39 years old and lives in West Point; she is single and has two children aged 14 and 16. Both of them are attending school and live at home. Hawa completed 12th grade before starting her business. 

For the past two years she has been selling door locks, nails, hinges, etc in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, nails, hinges, etc. for her business. She hopes to have a shop and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, nails and hinges for her business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 36-year-old married woman, from Kulashi village. She  lives with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law, who is veterinarian and gets 250 GEL per month. This is the only source of the family's income. So Natia has great desire to be involved in her own activity and do her bit for the family's welfare. 

She has arranged the place with all necessary things for a grocery store and now requested a loan for products. Her application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 3,000 USD she will purchase all the needed products and put in motion the store. This store will highly increase family's income and will be a great help. Natia is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of needed products for the grocery store.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 36 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is a widow and has four children between 17 and 21 years old who are attending school and live at home.
