Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento el cual utilizara para la compra de materiales de corte y confección como ser: telas, hilos, agujas etc. que mejorara en gran manera ya que obtendrá mayores ganancia de lo esperado y podrá cubrir contratos grandes de costura, satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes que buscan trabajos de excelencia.
texts.en:
Kenia is a 23 year old woman with many ideas, many goals, and many dreams in her life that she hopes to reach and make a reality.  She is single and does not have children.  She has a high school diploma and studied up to the 3rd year of core classes in dressmaking.  She lives in her parents' home, where she has a small tailor shop where she does her work.  When the demand is very high, her mother helps her. 

Kenia has a lot of experience as she learned the trade 5 years ago in school.  Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, friends, students, and others.  Her business is well known and in demand thanks to her former classmates and customers who have been satisfied with her work, and have recommended her as she is a responsible, helpful and timely person.  The months she considers to have the highest demand are January, February, March, May, August, September, October and November because she makes few sales during the other months.  The biggest challenge she faces is the increase in cost for the materials she uses. 

In regards to competition, there is hardly any, because in her community there are no tailors of this type.  Her goals, hopes and dreams are to have a well structured small sewing company with subsidiaries that make shirts, pants, underwear, etc... that is able to supply stores, markets, and intermediaries among others, and when she has a family and home of her own, be able to support them as she should.

For this, she is seeking a loan which she will use to purchase materials for dressmaking such as: fabrics, thread, needles, etc... which will improve her business greatly as she will be able to increase her earnings, fulfill big orders and satisfy the needs of her customers who are seeking quality work.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani was born in 1993. She lives with her husband in a sector of Jordan called Dair Alla. She works with her husband in agriculture. Amani has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions and raising their profit by selling blankets from home to her neighbors for the past year. As winter is coming, Amani would like to increase the amount of blankets she sells in order to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1989. He is single and lives with his two siblings and his parents in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. His father is a governmental employee. Mohammad decided to try to support his family financially after he noticed that they are facing a financial crisis. So he started running his own grocery store two months ago. He borrowed the idea from his friend who has his own grocery store that is profitable. Now Mohammad wants to stock his store with food products and detergent to start raising his sales and profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy food products and detergent for his store

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas De Yanaoca Group

texts.es:
El socio Juan Agripino pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS DE YANAOCA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanaoca, provincia de Canas y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Juan Agripino tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente, el socio es maestro constructor, él socio trabaja en las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su trabajo, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como combo, martillos entre otros. Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, carpinteria, crianza de animales menores, licorería.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Juan Agripino is a member of the LAS HORMIGUITAS DE YANAOCA communal bank, which is located in the district of Yanaoca, in the Canas Province of Cusco department.  Juan Agripino is 42 years of age and lives with his partner.  He is a master builder and works on different building sites where his services are needed.  He has been involved in this work for some time and is successful because of the effort which he puts into his work each day.  He is a responsible and tenacious person who wants to be able to keep on working so he can continue to support his family.  Juan is applying for the loan to buy tools for his work -  a sledgehammer and other hammers, for example.  The other members of the group are involved in selling vegetables, carpentry, breeding small animals and selling alcoholic drinks.  Juan is grateful for the loan he has been granted and is committed to fulfilling his obligations.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work - a sledgehammer and other hammers, for example

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has a business of selling smoked fish. She has been selling smoked fish in the market at retail for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested a loan of Uganda Shs 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more baskets of fish for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to stock dry fish that can take her through the times that fish is scarce and very expensive to buy for resale. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product offered. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Dinael Sebastian

texts.es:
Dinael es un joven entusiasta y emprendedor, tiene 23 años de edad, soltero;   vive en  el Barrio San Antonio, Sololá.
El se dedica a la administración de un negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, en la comunidad donde vive: administra este negocio por falta de tiempo del papa (dueño) para hacerlo; a través de ella, obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sostenimiento tanto de el, como el de su familia. Tiene dos años de estar administrando este negocio y le gusta hacerlo porque es una labor honesta y con lo cual contribuye al progreso de su comunidad.
Además de  esta actividad, él también presta el servicio de parqueo de automóviles en un predio que tiene; con esto genera otros ingresos para complementar el presupuesto familiar.
El necesita un apoyo financiero, por lo cual está  solicitando un préstamo de         Q 2,000.00 para compra de más mercadería para la ampliación del negocio.
Dinael sueña con tener su propia empresa y hacerla crecer.
texts.en:
Dinael is an enthusiastic and enterprising young man. He is 23 years old, single, and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Sololá. 

He manages a business that buys and sells construction materials in the community where he lives, as his father, who owns the business, is unable to do it because of a lack of time.  With this, he earns the income needed to support himself as well as his family. He has been managing this business for two years, and he likes doing it—it is honest work, and through it he contributes to the progress of his community. 

In addition to this work, he provides car parking services on a lot that he has, earning extra income to supplement the family budget.

He needs financial support, so he is requesting a loan of Q 2,000 [2,000 Quetzals] in order to purchase more merchandise to expand the business. 

Dinael dreams of having his own business and making it grow.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is married and has six children. His wife cares for the home while he farms. He has been farming for fifteen years now and is currently growing maize, beans, groundnuts and sorghum.

This is Raphael’s first loan with Honey Care. He is applying for a 17,100 KES loan to buy beehives and apiary supplies for honey production. He is excited about beekeeping because it is an enterprise that is easy to handle and will earn him more money. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a small business. Raphael’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

Raphael lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County, located at the southwestern tip of Kenya. The northern end of the county is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares.

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, there is a strong cultural emphasis on education. As a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary supplies for honey production.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three East African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Caroline is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 20 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, sunflower, green grams, mangoes, papaya, citrus, and avocado in their farm. Caroline is looking forward to beekeeping because it will earn her some income and provide her with honey for food and medicinal use.

This is Caroline’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay for her children’s school fees. Caroline’s hope for the future is to invest more on her beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary material for honey production.

loans.name: Guderia

texts.en: Guderia a 56 year old married woman with 6 children living in Fort Portal. She deals in the buying and selling of maize alongside selling fresh foods as her side income. Since 1980, she has been in this business though being challenged by limited capital to expand her business. She has a dream of building for her family a permanent house. Guderia is in need of a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Severene

texts.en:
Severene lives close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.  

Severene is married and has three children. His wife runs a small business while he is a farmer. He has been farming for seven years and he is currently growing maize and vegetables on his farm. Severene is looking forward to beekeeping because it will provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Severene’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start his own business and buy land. Severene’s hope for the future is to have his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Candita

texts.en:
Candita lives close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Candita is single and has three children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for fifteen years and she is currently growing maize and vegetables on her farm. Candita is looking forward to beekeeping as it will earn her some income.

This is Candita’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay for her children’s school fees. Candita’s hope for the future is to see her children finish school, buy a dairy cow and build a good house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 52 years old and married with six children.

Melchora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Melchora has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Melchora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jafred

texts.en:
Jafred lives in Malava, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Jafred has three children, and has been farming for thirty five years. He is currently keeping poultry and cows and growing sugarcane and vegetables. Jafred is looking forward to beekeeping because it will provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Jafred’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Jafred’s hope for the future is to buy more land and do serious farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family. Mely is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Mely requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like threads, buttons, zippers, fabric, etc. for her business.

Mely has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like threads, buttons, zippers, fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Malava, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Joan is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired administrator while she undertakes farming. She has been farming for thirty years and she is currently keeping poultry and dairy cattle and growing bananas and vegetables.

This is Joan’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farming. Joan’s hope for the future is to live comfortably in her old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: Claudia Azucena, mayor de edad casada con dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio, el turismo, sus playas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsables en sus formas de pago y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a dos tipos de negocios en el mismo local, administra un salón de belleza donde ofrece el servicio de alizados, arreglos de manos y pies, tintes, corte de cabellos, peinados, al igual que ofrece a la misma vez sus productos de cosméticos de diferentes líneas como selza, Avon, entre otras y productos para la limpieza del hogar, además de estas actividades el cliente está elaborando repostería, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos todos unos profesionales y brindarles un techo digno donde vivir, el objetivo de este crédito es para compra de productos como: tintes, cremas faciales, cremas de alizados, uñas acrílicas, cepillos, tijeras, al igual que productos de cosméticos como: maquillajes, pinturas de uñas, rubor, cremas entre otros, claudia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Claudia Azucena is married and has two minor children. She is from the department of Chinandega, an area where commerce, tourism, and its beaches predominate.  She is known for being an enterprising and hard-working woman who is responsible with her payments.  She has a great desire for personal improvement.  

She is a small businesswoman with two types of businesses at the same place.  She owns and manages a beauty salon where she provides services including straightening, manicure and pedicure, hair coloring, haircuts, and styling.  She also sells a variety of cosmetic products like Selza and Avon, among others.  She also sells home cleaning products.  In addition to these business activities, she makes pastries. 

One of her dreams is to be able to see all of her children become professionals and to provide them with a decent roof over their heads.

The objective of this loan is to buy products like hair dyes, facial creams, straightening creams, acrylic nails, brushes, and scissors.  She will also buy cosmetic products like make-up, nail polish, blush, and creams, among others.

Claudia is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to buy products like facial creams, acrylic nails, brushes, scissors, and cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Actualmente el comité Nuevo Amanecer  se encuentran en su 1º ciclo, todas se dedican a sus actividades con la intención de aumentar sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida, ellas se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Sra. Matilde, es miembro de este grupo, quien es empleada doméstica,  y en sus días y horarios libre se dedica en su trabajo de manicurista con la ayuda de sus dos hijas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo emprendedora, y lo demuestra por medio del esfuerzo y el interés que tiene a la hora de recibir sus capacitaciones.
La Sra. Matilde  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus artículos para la manicura, como ser esmaltes, algodón, limas, alicates y demás lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer committee is currently in its first cycle. All its members are dedicated to their businesses in order to increase their income and achieve a better quality of life. They are in the poverty elimination program and are all completing the poverty elimination survey.

Matilde belongs to this group. She works as a domestic and on her days off and in her spare time she works as a manicurist alongside her two daughters. She is a very hard worker and, above all else, an enterprising person. She proves it with her effort and the interest she shows at trainings.

Matilde is requesting this loan in order to buy manicure supplies, such as nail polish, cotton, files, clippers, and other items that will help her implement her business plan, which will in turn help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, cotton, files, clippers, and other items.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa está conformado por mujeres activas que tienen un gran entusiasmo de poder mejorar su calidad de vida por medio del trabajo como grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Smilce, que se dedica exclusivamente a las ventas en su despensa, ella cuenta que invierte mucho para el crecimiento de su negocio a fin de lograr mayor producción gracias a las ventas  que le genera día a día. Es consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser  constante para lograr el progreso que anhela alcanzar, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. 
La Sra. Smilce  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus insumos para la despensa, como ser bebidas, panificados, lácteos, verduras, frutas y demás, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, y a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank is comprised of active women who are very enthusiastic about being able to improve their quality of life by working as a group.

Smilce is one of the members.  She devotes herself exclusively to selling at her store.  She says that she invests a lot in order to grow her business.  She does this in order to manage greater production, thanks to the day to day sales that she generates.  She is aware that the work and effort that she is making needs to be constant in order to manage the progress that she yearns to achieve.  With this progress she will be able to give her family better well-being.

Smilce is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her store.  She will buy things like drinks, baked goods, dairy products, vegetables, fruit, and others.  This will help her firm up her plan for her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, baked goods, dairy products, vegetables, fruit, and others.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она владетельница собственного бизнеса. Фарида 6 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она взяла в аренду магазин у своих родственников и постепенно год за годом она развевала свой бизнес. Фарида сегодня имеет свой продуктовый магазин. Она продает все необходимые продукты питания. Ее клиентами являются ее соседи. Она хочет пополнить оборотный капитал, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки продукты питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farida is a cheerful woman who is married and currently raising 2 children.  She has been running her own business, a small grocery store, for the past 6 years, renting the space for the store from her relatives and doing what she can to grow her business year by year.  She deals mostly in common, everyday food items, and knows her customers on a first-name basis.  At the moment, she'd like to stock up on certain food items, but lacks the money to buy everything she needs.  As such, she's seeking a loan of 10,000 somoni to restock her grocery store, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: replenish her store's stock of food items

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон родился и вырос в сельской местности. Поскольку животноводство является одним из основных видов работ среди жителей их села, он  имеет больше опыта, как заботиться о скоте. Олимчону сейчас 46 лет, женат, имеет четверых детей. Его семья, как и многие другие, занимаются  разведения крупного рогатого скота и производства молока. Его старший сын уехал в Казахстан, чтобы найти работу. Остальные дети помогают Олимчону .
 В целях обеспечения  своей семьи и будущего своих внуков, Олимчон  должен расширить свой бизнес, и с наступления холодов, они должны запастись корма на зиму. Некоторые из его знакомых рекомендовали, что бы он получить кредит от МДО Арванд. Олимчон решили взять кредит от МДО Арванд и подал свою заявку. Он планирует использовать средства, чтобы купить скот и корм для скота в большом количестве. Он очень благодарен МДО АРВАНД заранее за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Olimjon was born and grew up in a rural area.  Because animal husbandry is one of the primary types of work among the village residents, he has a lot of experience taking care of livestock.  Olimjon is currently 46 years old, married and has four children.  His family, like many others, is involved in breeding cattle and producing milk.  His oldest son went to Kazakhstan to find work.  The rest of the children help Olimjon. To provide for his family and future for his gransons, Olimjon has to expand his business and, with the onset of cold weather, stock up on feed for the winter.  Some of his friends recommended that he obtained a loan from MDO Arvand.  Olimjon decided to obtain a loan from MDO Arvand and put in his request.  He plans to use the loan to buy livestock and a large quantity of livestock feed.  He is very grateful in advance to MDO Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and a large quantity of livestock feed

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. Mildred is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Mildred requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Mildred has been in this business for 50 years now.

Mildred would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, and nylon thread for her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after her sister.
She has been selling second hand clothes in a shop at retail for two years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has requested a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more skirts and blouses for sale. Her challenges include unstable prices. Her dream is to become an importer so that she sells at wholesale. She joined MCDT because she wanted to put up a building to shift her business there. She stays with her husband in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married but has no children. Her husband is a watchman. For the past three years she has been growing maize, millet and beans on their farm.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care. She is applying for a 17,100 KES loan to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production. Mary is looking forward to beekeeping because it will earn her extra income. She intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a small business. Mary’s hope for the future is to produce more honey and have a thriving business.

Mary lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry.

A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis lives in Malava, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Vitalis is married and has four children. His wife is a volunteer health worker while he is a farmer. He has been farming for four years and he is currently growing maize, beans, bananas and soya beans. Vitalis is looking forward to beekeeping because it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Vitalis’ first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the income generated from his beehives to pay school fees for her children and improve his kitchen garden. Vitalis’ hope for the future is to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ford

texts.en:
Ford lives in Malava. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Ford is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years and they are currently keeping cows and growing sugarcane in their farm. Ford is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him some income.

This is Ford’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the income generated from his beehives to pay fees for his children. Ford’s hope for the future is to help educate the community on how to earn a living through farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en:
Selpha lives in Malava, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Selpha is single and has five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty five years and she is currently growing maize, sorghum, sugarcane, sweet potatoes and bananas. Selpha is excited about beekeeping because it will earn her some income.

This is Selpha’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Selpha’s hope for the future is to expand her businesses and be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah lives in a town in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Keziah is single and has five children. Keziah is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty years and she is currently keeping bees and growing, maize, beans, trees and bananas in her farm. Keziah is interested in beekeeping because it does not require much input.

This is Keziah’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farming. Keziah’s hope for the future is to live a healthy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Nuevo Amanecer forma parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas y cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder ayudarlas por medio de capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Seneida, quien vende gallinas, es una persona muy humilde, pero que por medio de su trajo y su sacrificio quiere ir mejorando, ya que a través de su trabajo su familia tiene para el día a día. Su meta es no tener que trabajar más en forma ambulante y poder tener un local. Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gallinas para la venta, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorando más y más.
texts.en:
"Nuevo Amanecer" is part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program where each and every member takes a poverty elimination survey to be able to help them through training. 

One of the members is Seneida who sells chickens. She is a very modest person, but one who wants to continue improving through work and sacrifice, considering that it's through her job that her family gets by day by day. Her goal is to be able to have her own business site and no longer have to work on foot. She is asking for this loan today to be able to buy chickens to sell which will allow her to continue growing and improving steadily.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, con vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, que tuvieron el sueño de poder trabajar juntas y así poder ayudarse. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, que las ayuda a conocer la situación en la que cada una está, y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nemesia, quien es digna de destacar por el gran entusiasmo que muestra y también por su interés de ir mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de embutidos y también de carne de cerdos, y comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene una clientela fiel que siempre le hace pedidos, y más aún en esta época de navidad y año nuevo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne de cerdo, para poder surtirse, ya que tendrá muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Roque was founded in the city of Caaguazú among local friends and neighbors who had the dream of being able to work together and help each other. They are in the poverty elimination program, which helps them know each of their situations and work accordingly.

Nemesia is one of its members. Her enthusiasm is worth noting, as well as the interest she shows in gradually improving her income and living conditions. She works selling sausages and pork, and mentions that things are going very well for her because she has a loyal customer base who always orders from her, particularly during the Christmas and New Year season. 

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing pork so that her business is well stocked, because she is going to have lots of orders from customers and wants to be able to deliver.

loans.use: to buy pork to sell.

loans.name: Novisilele Group

texts.fr: Mme Sokandé âgée de 59ans est productrice de gari. Veuve, elle a 05 enfants en charge. En plus de son activité champêtre, elle produit du gari. Elle a démarré en 2003 et sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter du manioc. Elle a été nommée pour être la responsable du groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes. Ils sont soient dans le commerce, dans la production de gari et de l'huile de coco. Ils espèrent avec le profit disposer de plus de réserves et assurer les besoins alimentaires de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en: Mrs. Sokandé is 59 years old and a cassava flour producer. Widowed, she has five children in her care. Besides her rural business, she produces cassava flour. She began in 2003 and is asking for her third loan to buy cassava. She was named the leader of this group, made up of men and women. They are in business in the production of cassava flour and coconut oil. They hope that with their profit they can make use of more for reserves and ensure enough food for their respective families' needs.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, spices, and other things.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two to 15 years. He describes himself as a risk taker. He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of fruits and vegetables. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment for youth. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a determined person. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years.

His business is located in a suburban area and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

His business goal is to buy a car for a taxi business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will boost the economy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Darío De Jesús

texts.es:
Darío es un hombre trabajador de 45 años de edad, padre de un hijo adolescente a quien ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y paciencia. Durante 20 años de su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente vendiendo diferentes productos en un pequeño local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad pero, desde hace 7 años se dedica a vender ropa para hombres, atiende de lunes a sábado de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm y en temporada alta como la de fin de año contrata a otra persona para que le colabore, así logra generar los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 
El propósito que tiene con el crédito que solicita, es invertir el dinero en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (camisas, pantalones, ropa deportiva, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de sus clientes, obteniendo una mayor ganancia, además podrá hacerle frente a los desafíos que presentan en su labor, como la competencia desleal, el constante cambio climático y los altibajos de las ventas.
Darío manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir su sueño de adquirir un vehículo para prestar el servicio de taxi y así complementar los ingresos familiares, para dar a su hijo la posibilidad de realizar estudios universitarios para que sea un hombre íntegro y próspero.
texts.en:
Darío is a hardworking 45-year-old man.  He is the father of one son, who he has raised with determination and patience.  During his past 20 years as a working man, he has earned a living as an independent businessman selling different products in a small stall in the city center.  He has been selling men's clothing for the past seven years and attends to his store Monday through Saturday, 9AM-7PM.  During busy seasons (like at the end of the year), he hires another person to help him, which permits him to generate sufficient income to maintain his home. 

With the requested loan, he will invest in the purchase of merchandise wholesale (shirts, pants, athletic clothing, and other items).  This will give him the capacity to satisfy the demand and diverse tastes of his clients, allowing him to earn higher profits.  He will also be able to face any challenges that present themselves during his work, including unfair competition, the constant change in climate, and the ups and downs of his sales.  

Darío says that he wants to continue working hard in order to realize his dream of buying a vehicle.  He wants to purchase a vehicle so that he may offer taxi services and thereby complement the family income.  He works so that he can give his son the possibility of going to college and becoming an honest and prosperous man.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (shirts, pants, athletic clothing, and other items).

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is a married woman who was born in 1971. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Karak with her husband, 6 sons and daughter.

Nadya's husband has been raising sheep and selling their products for 15 years. He started his project selling a few sheep. Now he is seeking to expand his project by buying a larger quantity of sheep in order to raise his productivity, which will lead to raising her sales and income, and this will help him cover his children needs. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Nadya has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business

loans.name: Najmelsahar

texts.en:
Najmelsahar was born in 1966. She is a married lady living in an area of Jordan called Salt with her husband and four sons and daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver. Najmelsahar has been supporting her husband financially with her project of selling blankets for the past year since she noticed that his job is a weak source of income. 

She started by selling a small quantity of blankets. Now she wants to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of blankets in order to raise her profit and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia was born in 1976. She is a single lady living in an area in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her sister and her parents. Alia started supporting her parents financially after they faced financial problems. She has been running her project selling food products for a year now. 

She started by selling a small quantity of foodstuffs in a rented store. Now she would like to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of food products in order to raise her profit and income. But unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her mini market.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila was born in 1985. She is married and a mother of three. Her husband works in car repair. They are all living at an area of Jordan called Wihdat. Laila has been selling decorated vases and pottery in addition to detergents for the past six months. Her project has been a good source of income for her family and has helped her in supporting her husband and children financially. 

Now she needs to expand her project to raise her sales and profits by buying a larger quantity of pots and decorating tools in order to raise her productivity and sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy pots and decorating tools in addition to detergents for her business.

loans.name: Omaima

texts.en:
Omaima is a married woman who was born in 1993. She lives in an area of Jordan called Dairalla with her husband who is in the military. Omaima has been selling blankets for a year and has found it a good source of income to help her husband in covering their needs. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales as the winter is coming. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a married woman who was born in 1983. She is a mother of three and she lives with her children and her husband in an area in Jordan called Marka. Dina has been making detergents at home for five years and her husband sells them outdoors. She found her project profitable. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of the needed materials to make detergents in order to increase her sales to cover their children needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy the needed materials to make more detergents.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman who was born in 1975. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and only son. Her husband is an electrician. Fatima decided to help her husband financially by selling home products since a year ago and found it profitable. Now Fatima wants to buy a larger quantity of home products to raise her sales in order to help her husband in covering the needs of their son. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 43-year-old single woman. She has two children aged 20 years and 23 years. She describes herself as a committed person. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, sugar,maize flour and other items. 

She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add a stock of sugar, drinks, maize flour etc. Her business goal is to expand her business to a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment for youth. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, drinks and maize flour.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman who was born in 1981. She has one son. Her husband works in a hotel. Fatima decided to help her husband financially by selling clothes since a year ago, and found it profitable. Now Fatima wants to buy a larger quantity of winter clothes to raise her sales as winter is coming in order to help her husband in covering their child's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more winter clothes for her business

loans.name: Ndejje Tusubira Group

texts.en: Christine is a single mother of four, a member of Ndejje Tusubira development group, who is currently running a beauty shop that sells hair products for women. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. Like most single mothers, Christine's major problem is of limited capital to increase her business and to cater for her family's wellbeing. She is grateful to Ugafode for supporting their business ventures and giving them loans when they are in need. She believes she will make a lot of profits this season since her shop will be well stocked. She is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Kuralai

texts.ru:
Куралай со своей дочерью живут в г. Табошаре. Она занимается откормом скота. В ее возрасте найти работу очень трудно, поэтому она разводит скот. Куралай получает молоко и делает различные молочные продукты, это также является дополнительным источником доходом. Куралай надеется что кредит от Арванд поможет  ей решить проблемы и улучшить условия проживания.  Она осталось в молодости одна и ее единственная надежда была ее дочь, благодаря которой она  все эти годы работала усердно не покладая рук, и воспитала хорошую добропорядочную девушку. На сегодняшний  день дочь Куралай выросла и стала помощницей своей  маме и они вместе занимаются разведением скота.
Куралай на полученный кредит Куралай хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Она вместе с дочкой заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Kuralai lives with her daughter in Taboshar and breeds cattle. Her age makes it difficult to find a job, so she is engaged in animal husbandry. Kuralai also makes various dairy products, which serve as an additional source of income. Kuralai hopes that a loan from Arvand will help solve her problems and improve her living conditions. 

Kuralai became single as a young woman, and her only hope was her daughter, for whom she worked tirelessly for many years, raising a respectable young woman. Kuralai's daughter is now grown up and has become a helper to her mother; they raise cattle together. Kuralai will use her loan money to buy cattle and increase the size of her flock. Kuralai and her daughter thank Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana: Es una mujer jovial y expresiva, tiene 40 años de edad, originaria de  Puerto Cabezas, tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 años estableció una pulpería en su vivienda con apoyo económico de su esposo, con el propósito de generar sus propios ingresos y estar siempre al cuidado de sus hijos. Recuerda que su primera inversión fue de: Un quintal de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, dos bolsones de chivería y un bolsón de café, con las ganancias que ha venido percibiendo le ha permitido adquirir nuevos productos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Un quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, gaseosa, un bidón de aceite, una caja de leche en polvo, jugos, mortadela, pollo, hot dog, pan, chiverías, cereales y sopa instantáneas. Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio diversificando los productos en la rama de cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios para hombres y mujeres, poner un restaurante de comida típica y extranjera en un punto estratégico de la Ciudad de Bilwi, entre otros.
texts.en:
Ana is a cheerful and expressive woman. She is forty years old and is from Puerto Cabezas. She has two children. Twelve years ago she set up a grocery store in her home with financial help from her husband in order to generate her own income while tending to her children. She remembers what she bought with her first investment: a quintal of rice, sugar, beans, two big packs of yogurt drinks, and one big pack of coffee. The profit she has earned has allowed her to acquire more products. She is requesting financing to buy a quintal of rice, beans, sugar, flour, sodas, a barrel of oil, a box of powdered milk, juice, cold cuts, chicken, sausage links, bread, yogurt drinks, cereal, and instant soup mix.

Her dream is to strengthen her business and diversify her products by including cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for men and women. Among other things, she would also like to open a restaurant serving traditional food from the region at a strategic location in the city of Bilwi.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, sodas, oil, powdered milk, juice, cold cuts, chicken, sausage links, bread, yogurt drinks, cereal, and instant soup mix.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Peregrina is 43-years-old and her four children are in school.

Peregrina has a sewing business in the Philippines. Peregrina requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her sewing business.

Peregrina has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Peregrina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her sewing business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra  tiene  26 años, es soltera  y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es hija de una pareja que toda la vida se dedicó a la fabricación y ventas de artesanías, tales como la hamacas, frazadas y manteles bordados, ella para no quedarse atrás empezó a ayudar ya que sus hermanos también se dedicaban a eso. Hoy en día ya lleva sus productos para la venta por Argentina y así está ganándose el sustento para su familia. Es una persona muy activa, que trabaja y se esfuerza por ir mejorando su vid ay también poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más sabanas e hilo para la fabricación de hamacas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old,single, and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is the daughter of a couple who spent their entire lives making and selling handicrafts such as embroidered hammocks, blankets, and tablecloths. Not wanting to be left behind, she began to help, along with her siblings who also did this work. 

Currently she goes to Argentina to sell her products and earns enough money to sustain her family. She is a very active person who works hard and really tries to improve her life and help her family.  she is asking for the loan so she can buy more sheets and thread to make hammocks.

loans.use: to buy sheets and thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Villa Serenidad Group

texts.es:
Villa Serenidad está en su ciclo 7 del programa de comités, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo día a día para poder crecer y salir adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren un mejor futuro para ellas y sus hijos.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Mirna, quien a través del humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales se gana la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno que permite dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Mirna pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Villa Serenidad" communal bank is in their 7th loan cycle with the Women's committees. Each member makes their best effort every day to grow and get ahead. They are woman who are heads of their families and who want a better future for themselves and their families. 

One of them is Mirna who through the modest work of selling natural remedies earns her living. She is a hard-working woman who is proud of what she does, as by way of her honest work she can provide her family what it needs from day to day. Mirna is requesting a loan to invest in buying natural remedies, which will allow her to continue her sales and work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for re-sale.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 61 años y está Casado con la señora Catalina quien tiene 56 años ambos oriundos de la ciudad de Caacupé, ambos tienen hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes.
El señor José tiene una despensa copetín el que está instalado en su propia casa, ayudado por su esposa, y de esa forma ambos luchan por seguir trabajando. Es una pareja que se esfuerza mucho por poder seguir con su trabajo y mantener sus gastos del día a día.
José solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas alusivas a  las fiestas de fin de año, así tendrá todo tipo para ofrecer a su clientela. El agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old and is married to Catalina, who is 56. They are both from the city of Caacupé and have adult children who live on their own. 

José has a small store in his home which he runs with his wife's help. It allows them to keep working. They are a couple who strive to keep their business going and cover their daily expenses. 

José is requesting this loan to buy holiday sweets for New Year's Eve. This will allow him to have all different kinds to offer his customers. He is grateful for this opportunity to keep working.

loans.use: to buy holiday sweets to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria viene de una familia muy humilde, que es muy trabajadora y que siempre fue un ejemplo para ella y que son su inspiración.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, por medio del cual podrá ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud y lo cual siempre ha sido su sueño.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Gloria is from a  humble, hard-working family which has always been an example for her and an inspiration. She is studying nursing which will allow her to help people who need health care.  This has always been her dream. She is asking for this loan so she can pay her tuition and be able to continue to study and reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es una persona luchadora, ya que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo para poder cubrir una parte de sus estudios y también colaborar en su casa con los gastos.
Claudia está muy esperanzada de que por medio de su esfuerzo podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, ya que quiere ser una profesional exitosa que sea útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también poder cubrir sus cuotas. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad de seguir estudiando que le da kiva.
texts.en: Claudia is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is a fighter as she both studies and works at the same time in order to cover part of her studies and also contribute to the household expenses. Claudia is very encouraged that through her studies she can improve her and her family's standard of living. She is studying Business Administration as she wants to be a successful profession who is useful to her community. She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her tuition and fees for her university classes. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue studying that Kiva is giving her.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees for her classes at university.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan es un grupo muy trabajador, que se unió con el esfuerzo de poder trabajar todas unidas y que por medio de ese trabajo pueda mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Martha, quien además de ser miembro, también es la presidenta de este grupo. Es una persona muy activa y siempre trata de poder motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando y que no se den por vencidas. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya sea para mate o tereré, que son bebidas típicas de Paraguay. Dice que su trabajo es humilde, pero que está contenta con lo que hace pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, que le permitirá seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
San Juan is a very hardworking group that united in order to strive and work together so that each of its members could benefit from that work and improve their living standards. 

Martha is not only one of its members, but also the President of the group. She is a very active person and always tries to motivate her fellow members to keep up the fight and never give up. She works selling natural remedies for mate or tereré, which are traditional Paraguayan drinks. She says her work is humble, but that she is happy with what she does because she makes an honest living. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing natural remedies to sell, which will allow her to keep growing and fighting for a better life.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 21-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Mustafa's brother works as an employee in a local firm and he earns a low income. This is the only source of income in the family. Mustafa studies English Literature and he would like to finish his studies to find a job and help his family for part of the family expenses. Mustafa dreams of taking a higher degree in the future.

Mustafa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mustafa will be able to do his home works and write the reports easily. 

Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo.

Mona is a 18-year-old single young lady from a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Mona's father works as a taxi driver with a non-stable wage. Mona studies Business Administration and she would like to finish her studies and take a BA degree and then find a job to help her family paying part of the family expenses.

Mona took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university instalment for this semester. By taking this loan, Mona will be able to complete her studies and find a job as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Moyad

texts.en:
Moyad is a 33-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his wife in a small simple house in the city. Since Moyad was a young man, he has been working on the family land where they plant olive trees. They sell olives and olive oil to the local traders. It is a good business but seasonal. 

Moyad took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his farm. By taking out this loan, Moyad's business will be improved and his income will be increased. Moyad appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings  for his farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 41 years old, married and has three children ages 8, 9, and 11 years old. She lives in Cortes, Bohol with her family. Zenaida operates a small restaurant, locally known as "carenderia", in the neighborhood for 11 years now. She sells different home-cooked viands made of vegetables, fish and meat. Her husband also helps in the business. She is asking for a loan to buy pork, rice, soy sauce, cooking oil and spices. With the loan, she will be able to finance her business while also meeting the needs of her children such as school fees and food for her family. In the future, Zenaida hopes to have a bigger restaurant for the people in her community and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pork, rice, soy sauce, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 20-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She engages in selling various clothing goods and footwear apparel. Her business started more than 2 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various stocks of footwear like slippers and clothing like skirts, pants and whole dresses. This will be very helpful in attracting her customers, and at the same time, she could cater to her customers needs on time, creating an increase in sales and generated income. In the future, Deborah hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various stocks of footwear like slippers and clothing like skirts, pants and whole dresses

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with 2 school-aged children. She operates a cellphone reloading business. She sells loads like Smart, Touch mobile, Talk n Text and Globe subscribers. Her business started more than a year ago now. She is asking for a loan to buy more cellphone units and to pay for her children's school fees. This is very essential in making her loading business prosper and also to provide her children with good living conditions. In the future, Leonora would like to expand her electronic loading business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  more cellphone units and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 21-year-old married man. He describes himself as a man of the people. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years now. His business is located in a sub-urban area and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pay for motorcycle insurance. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will help to boost the economy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back this loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pay for motorcycle insurance

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a committed person. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. Nelius has been involved in this business for 6 years now. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are individuals and hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low season which affects her sales. Nelius will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stocks of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be able to export her produce within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 22-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment for others.

loans.use: to buy stocks of drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 21-year-old single man. He describes himself as a person with potential. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local customers.

Simon describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a more profitable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be more competitive and will create employment.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en:
Bethy is a 30-year-old woman who has four children. She describes herself as experienced. For the past seven years, Bethy has operated a retail business where she sells socks, wallets, jewellery and other accessories. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital.

Bethy will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of wallets, socks, jewellery, etc. Her business goal is to be sustainable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of wallets, socks, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 37-year-old married woman who has six children. She describes herself as an honest person. For the past seven years, Susan has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Alexander Joel

texts.es: Alexander, tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive en casa familiar. Es un joven muy trabajador y responsable. Actualmente trabaja como ayudante en una panadería, elaborando pasteles, biscochos y otros. Beneficiario solicita crédito para remodelación y construcción de su cuarto para el cual necesita comprar: ladrillos, cemento, pintura y otros para tener mayor seguridad e independencia. Su sueño es comprarse su casa propia
texts.en: Alexander is twenty-one years old. He in single and lives with his parents. He is a very hardworking and responsible young man. He currently works as an assistant at a bakery, making cakes, sponge cake, and other items. He is applying for this loan to build and remodel his room for which he will need to buy bricks, cement, paint, and other items, in order to have more independence and security. His dream is to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, paint, and other items to build and remodel his room.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Aquilina: Es una mujer emprendedora, amable y luchadora, con dos hijos en edad escolar; es originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Desde hace 20 años estableció en su vivienda el negocio de ropa usada para hombres y mujeres, también tiene un salón de belleza, que lo inició con capital propio. Gracias a los ingresos de sus negocios es una mujer independiente que está educando a sus hijos con sus propios esfuerzos. Aún permanece en su memoria las etapas iniciales de su negocio, que alquilaba el espejo y algunos accesorios. Poco a poco ha venido creciendo y actualmente cuenta con un personal de 5 personas que trabajan con ella en el salón de belleza. Hace dos años comenzó también con el negocio de ropa usada en el mercado de Bilwi en el cual también ha dado trabajo a una muchacha que le ayuda atender a los clientes. Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar una paca de pantalón para hombres, una paca de camisa manga larga y mixtas para hombres, una paca de faldas, capri y blusas. Los productos los compra en Managua, para ofertarlo a precios accesibles en Bilwi. Su sueño es remodelar el local del salón de belleza, equiparlo con una secadora y plancha de cabello, ofertar productos de belleza y construir con cerámica el piso de su vivienda que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Aquilina is an enterprising, kind, and determined woman with 2 school-age children. She is from Puerto Cabazas. Some 20 years ago, Aquilina established in her home a used-clothing business for men and women. She also has a beauty salon which she launched with her own capital. 

Thanks to the income from her businesses, Aquilina is an independent woman who is educating her children through her own efforts. She still remembers the first stages of her business, when she rented the mirror and some accessories. Little by little, her business has been growing and at present, she can count on 5 workers who help her in the beauty salon.

Some 2 years ago, Aquilina also started a used clothing business in the Bilwi market, and she has hired a girl who helps her attend to customers there.

Now she is soliciting financing to purchase a bundle of men's pants, another of long-sleeved shirts and men's mixed clothing, and a bundle of skirts, capri pants, and blouses. She is buying these products in Managua to offer at accessible prices in Bilwi.

Aquilina's dream is to remodel the location of her beauty salon, and to purchase a hair drier and a hair iron, and to offer beauty products for sale. Also, to construct a tile floor for her home, which is presently made of earth.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of men's pants, and a bundle of long-sleeved shirts, and another of mixed men's clothing, plus a bundle of skirts, capri pants and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 48-year-old mother of four. For several years, she had a small at-home daycare for pre-kindergarten kids. After the children in her neighborhood have grown, there was no need for daycare services. Mona completed a sewing and tailoring course with success and is now using her business knowledge to open a new business activity. Mona creates bridal wear and provides tailoring services. She needs this loan to assist her in purchasing a sewing machine, beading, materials, cloth, shelving and hanging arrangements for dresses. Mona knows she can make her business a success. There is much demand in her area and she will be providing quality services. Right now, she is concentrating on organizing the area for her business and wants to continue so that one day, she will be able to expand into a larger store.

loans.use: to assist in purchasing a sewing machine, beading, materials, cloth, shelving and hanging arrangement for dresses.

loans.name: Sory's Group

texts.en:
Sory is a 50-year-old mother of two kids. She is a villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.

To earn a living, she raises pigs. She earns additional income by working for others for a fee. Her five years in the pig-raising business has enabled her to earn up to 34,000 KHR per day.

This is Sory's first loan request through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan in order to buy a plot of farmland, pigs, as well as pig feed. She hopes that she can generate solid income from her business as a result of the requested loan.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a plot of farmland, pigs, and feed

loans.name: Each

texts.en:
Each is a 43-year-old mother of five children. She is from the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia.

To earn a livng, she works as a farmer. For 30 years, she has also been raising piglets as a second source of income. She typically earns approximately $5.02 per day from her business activities, which usually enables her to support her family.

But now she has insufficient funds to pay for her son's education. So, she decided to apply for a new loan from VisionFund to pay for her son's school fees because he wants to finish his accounting coursework. She hopes that her son will get a new job after he graduates from school.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en: Ceciliah is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 3 children from ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years old. She describes herself as an enterprising person. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 27 years now. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of bananas. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stocks of bananas. Her business goal is to be a supplier of bananas within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of bananas

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are ages 5 years and 13 years old. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits and drinks. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a gas cooker that which will benefit four family members. They will be able to cook efficiently in their house. They face the challenge of unreliable sources for cooking fuel. She hopes that in the future, she will live comfortably. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Damas Trabajadoras es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción, por mujeres muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, es por eso que lleva ese nombre este grupo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el que quieren conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a eso poder seguir trabajando.
 Una persona a destacar es  Sebastiana, quien vende frutas y verduras de estación, su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que sus ventas las hace de manera ambulante, y así se gana el día a día. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande donde poder ofrecer sus productos y también seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia. Pide de este préstamo ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras frescas, para poder seguir sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Damas Trabajadoras" communal bank is located in the city of Asunción. It is made up of woman who are very demanding and hard-working, which is why the group wears this name (working women). They have participated in the Poverty Stoplight survey, so they can understand all their situations and from this continue working. 

One member who stands out is Sebastiana, who sells fruit and vegetables. Her work is very demanding as she sells door to door and each day earns her living in this way. Her dream is to own a large store where she can offer her products and continue working to help her family. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fresh fruit and vegetables to continue her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 20-year-old single young man from Jenin City. He lives with his family in a simple house. Ibrahim and his father work on their agricultural land where they plant olive trees. It is a good business but with a seasonal income. 

Ibrahim has a health problem and he needs stomach surgery. Ibrahim took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for the stomach surgery. By taking out this loan, Ibrahim will be able to go back to work and do all his daily activities. Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for his stomach surgery

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a determined person.

To earn a living, she operates a tailoring shop, where she makes dresses. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.

She would like to use the proceeds from the requested 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric, threads, and other materials for making dresses. Her business goal is to reach a wider market within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., fabric and threads) to make more dresses

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
